loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 7 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée le 16 novembre 2009. Il est constitué de femmes du même quartier et des environs qui s'activent dans le commerce et ont de bonnes relations entre elles.
AWA à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 57 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont 3 garçons et 4 filles. L'ainé est né en 1980 et le cadet en 2001.
Avec le prêt reçu elle va acheter des perles  pour confectionner des colliers "bin bin " pour reins et chouchous pour enfant, de l'encens, de la teinte pour cheveux et des pagnes. Elle achète des perles pour une valeur de 150 000 FCFA soit 25 kilo à 6000 FCFA le kilo. Après confection pour chaque kilo elle obtient 12 colliers qu'elle revend à 700 FCFA l'un.Pour les chouchous pour enfant elle achète des perles pour une valeur de 50 000 FCFA et a un bénéfice de 10 000 FCFA après vente des chouchous. Elle achète également deux seaux d'encens à 10 000 FCFA le seau et revend le kilo d'encens à 4000 FCFA. Elle achète des pagnes pour une valeur de 50 000 FCFA, après vente elle se retrouve avec un bénéfice de  25 000 FCFA. Elle achète aussi de la teinte pour cheveux, 20 tablettes, la tablette à 2000 FCFA et la cède à 4000 FCFA. Le reste du prêt va lui permettre de couvrir les dépenses et autres activités parallèles imprévues.
Les bénéfices vont lui permettre d’épargner au niveau du banc villageois mais aussi s'occuper de sa famille en achetant de la nourriture, et aussi assurer la santé des enfants.
texts.en:
This group of seven members is part of the 'banc villageois' that was created on November 16, 2009. It is composed of women from in and around the same district who are active in commerce. The women get along well with each other. AWA, at the right in the photo with a hand raised, is 57 years old and a married mother of seven children (3 boys and 4 girls). The oldest was born in 1980, and the youngest, in 2001.

With this loan in hand, she is going to purchase beads to make “bin bin” waist beads and hair scrunchies for kids; incense; hair dyes, and 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa). She purchases beads worth 150,000 francs CFA (about 25 kg at 6,000 francs per kilo). Each kilo produces 12 bin bin, which she sells for 700 francs each. 

For the scrunchies, she purchases beads worth 50,000 francs and makes a profit of 10,000 francs upon selling them. She also purchases two pails of incense at 10,000 francs per pail and resells at 4,000 francs per kilo. She purchases ‘pagne’ cloth worth 50,000 francs and ends up with a profit of 25,000 francs. She also purchases hair dyes, 20 tablets at 2,000 francs each, and she accepts 4,000 francs each for them.The rest of the loan will enable her to cover expenses and other unforeseen work. 

The profits will enable her to save money at the 'banc villageois' and also to take care of her family by providing food and health care for the children.

loans.use: tp purchase beads, incense, 'pagne' cloth, and hair dyes

loans.name: Maria Elisa

texts.es: A sus 30 años de edad María es una madre soltera muy trabajadora, sus hijos tienen 8, 10 y 12 años de edad, María se dedica a vender comidas rápidas en un pequeño local que  se ubica cerca a la carretera donde es muy transcurrido por personas  que le compran las salchi papas, fritadas, jugos y mas productos que ofrece en su puesto de comidas. Maria solicita el dinero del crédito  para comprar papas, aguas y otros productos, que ofrece en su puesto. María espera que su negocio se mejore y asi lograr que sus hijos no pasen necesidades y además que sus hijos sigan en sus estudios.
texts.en:
At her 30 years of age, María is a hardworking single mother. Her children are 8, 10, and 12 years old. María works by selling fast food in her small venue that is located close to a highway that is heavily transited by people who buy her salchipapas [fries with hot dog strips], fritadas [traditional fried pork meal], juices, and other products she has in her food station.

María requests a loan to buy potatoes, juices, and other products she offers. María hopes that her business will improve so as to ensure that her children don't lack for anything and so that they may continue with their studies.

Maria solicita el dinero del crédito  para comprar papas, aguas y otros productos, que ofrece en su puesto. María espera que su negocio se mejore y asi lograr que sus hijos no pasen necesidades y además que sus hijos sigan en sus estudios.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and juices.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Tita works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Tita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to  purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

Tita has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Ebru

texts.en:
Ebru  is single and living on her own. She is planning to re-open her stand by the sea which she has owned for two years. She is selling jeans and jewelry; she is very happy with it. Her friends at the other stands and the traffic of the people walking by the sea make her very happy. 

With the help of her fourth loan, she is planning to purchase bulks of jeans. She hopes to have a good summer. 

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Ebru  Hanım bekar ailesinden ayrı yaşıyor. İki sene önce sahilde açtığı tezgahını bu sezon da açacak. Tezgahında kot  ve takı satışı yapıyor. Bu işi yapmaktan çok memnun.  Gerek tezgah arkadaşları gerek sahili gezen insanların hareketliliği Ebru Hanımı çok mutlu ediyor. Aldığı dördüncü kredi ile tekrardan kot alımı yapacak. Güzel bir yaz sezonu geçirmeyi diliyor.

loans.use: to buy jeans

loans.name: Mahfirat

texts.en:
Mahfirat is a bright girl and was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1994. She is single and is living in a small city with her family. She already has work experience at her young age, as a teacher at the secondary school. She and her mother are in the photo. Her mother supports her self-development and achievements. 

Mahfirat wants to study at university and get a higher education degree. She has a dream to be a professional specialist in social sciences and help for social change. She appealed to IMON asking a loan to pay her tuition fee. She awaits Kiva lenders kindness.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee in social sciences

loans.name: Souadou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 3 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée le 14 novembre 2009. Il est constitué de femmes du même quartier qui s'activent dans le commerce et ont de bonnes relations entre elles.
SOUADOU assise à droite de la photo est âgée de 49 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont 3 garçons et 2 filles.
Avec le prêt reçu elle va acheter des bols, des glacières, des bassines et des seaux. Elle travaille en collaboration avec sa grande sœur qui se trouve au Nigeria et qui achète pour elle les marchandises et les envois au Sénégal. Pour le transport elle paye un montant de 100 000 FCFA. Elle achète les trois bols à 12500 FCFA et les revend à 25 000 FCFA. Elle achète la bassine à 1000 FCFA et la revend à 3000 FCFA. Elle achète enfin le seau à 500 FCFA et le cède à 1000 FCFA.
Les bénéfices vont lui permettre de s'occuper de sa famille, assurer la scolarité des enfants, acheter de la nourriture dans la mesure ou son mari est à la retraite.
texts.en:
This group of three members is part of the 'banc villageois' that was created on November 14, 2009. It is composed of women from in and around the same district who are active in commerce. The women get along well with each other. SOUADOU, sitting at the right in the photo, is 49 years old and a married mother of five children (3 boys and 2 girls). 

After receiving the loan, she is going to purchase bowls, coolers (insulated containers), tubs, and buckets. She works in collaboration with her older sister, who is in Nigeria buying goods for her and sending them to Senegal. For transport, she pays 100,000 francs CFA. She is purchasing 3 bowls at 12,500 francs and resells at 25,000 francs. She is purchasing tubs at 1,000 francs each and resells at 3,000 francs. Finally, she is purchasing buckets at 500 francs each and sells for 1,000 francs. 

The profits will enable her to take care of her family, ensure her children’s schooling costs are covered, and buy food, since her husband is retired.

loans.use: to purchase bowls, coolers (insulated containers), tubs, and buckets

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is 51 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Winnie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, soap, noodles, milk, coffee, drinks and other personal care products.

Winnie has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, soap, noodles, milk, coffee, drinks and other personal care products

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 61 years old and married with six children.

She runs an agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Clarita is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Clarita has been in this business for 10 years and also earns additional income from tailoring.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her husband's tractor and trolley.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Kanini

texts.en:
Kanini is a Kiva borrower. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be loyal. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, flour, sweets and other items. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in an area with potential. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stocks of sugar, flour, soap and other items. Her business goal is to open more branches within 5 years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap and other items

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 49 years old, married with two children.

Gemma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of groceries to sell like spices, sugar, milk, coffee, drinks, canned goods, noodles and other personal care products.

Gemma has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from buy and sell dried fish.

Gemma aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items of groceries to sell like spices, sugar, milk, coffee, drinks, canned goods, noodles and other personal care products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy gemstones and more material for her husband's embroidery shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for construction of an animal shelter.

loans.name: Haideta

texts.en:
Haideta is 53 years old, married and has four children.

Haideta is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Haideta requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Haideta has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 36 years old, married to Kennedy and supports five children. She has been practicing small scale farming the last 14 years earning KES9,000 per month. 


Agnes has applied for her first loan of KES.25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supplies for more income gain. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children to high levels. Her future hopes and plans are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supplies for more income gain.

loans.name: Madona Group

texts.en:
Ayubu,, who is in her late 30s is married with two kids one is still at school and the other one is still small.  She has been running  a restaurant for three years now.  She works from 06am to 06pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Ayubu's 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase on the restaurant stock and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group.  She used the profit to pay school fees, paid rent, to repay loans and covered household expenses. 

She will use this loan to buy the best selling drinks and food for her restaurant.  She dreams of buying a plot of land and to extend her business.

Ayubu will share this loan with her loan group  Madona which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the best selling drinks and food for her restaurant.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, es dueño de una tienda de productos para uso doméstico, negocio que aprendió a desarrollarlo con la ayuda de sus padres, ya que ellos han vivido toda su vida en el campo y les ha gustado trabajar para tener ingresos, también es empleado como promotor de salud, el horario atención en la tienda  es de seis de la mañana a ocho de la noche. Vive con su esposa y dos hijas, la familia le ayuda con el negocio mientras él cumple con la jornada de trabajo.
Invertirá en maíz, frijol, arroz, aceite, huevos, pastas dentales, sodas, jugos, etc., para tener nuevos productos con los que pueda cubrir las demandas de sus clientes, aspira a mejorar la competitividad de su negocio y continuar teniendo ingresos con los que pueda cumplir con sus obligaciones.
Su sueño es tener el negocio más grande de la zona y abastecer a su familia de todo lo básico para tener una vida digna.
texts.en:
Luis is the owner of a shop of products for domestic use, a business that he learned to develop with the help of his parents, since they have lived all their life in the country and they have liked to work for income.  He is also employed as a health promoter.  The hours of his shop are 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m.  He lives with his wife and two daughters.  The family helps him with the business while he completes his workday.
He will invest in corn, beans, rice, toothpastes, sodas, juices, etc. in order to have new products with which to cover the demands of his customers.  His dream is to have the biggest business in the zone and supply his family with all the basic necessities in order to have a worthy life.

loans.use: to invest in corn, beans, rice, oil, eggs, toothpastes, sodas, juices, etc. in order to have new products with which to cover the demands of his customers.

loans.name: Waka

texts.en: Waka is a Babban Gona farmer from Makwalla village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Waka no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to increase his farmland. Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see him increase his income considerably.  This season Waka has ambitious plans to harvest  40 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Waka  now has the opportunity to acquire more land to put into Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a Babban Gona farmer from Dandoka Village. Ibrahim joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Ibrahim will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Ibrahim would like to use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy new rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Shehu

texts.en: Shehu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from  Kofar Barauki  Village. Shehu  joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Shehu will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase him household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Shehu now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to start a new business.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Lusuvilo Group

texts.en:
Halima, who is in her late 40s, is married with four children; three of them are still in school and the other one is grown-up.  She has been running two projects, selling chips and a genge for eight years now.  She works from 07am to 8.30pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Halima's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to start selling chips and restocked the out-of-stock items in her genge.  

She has paid back her loan successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay the loan and covered household expenses.  

She will use this loan to increase the genge stock and to buy Irish potatoes, cooking oil and charcoal for frying the chips.  

She dreams building her own house.

Halima will share this loan with her loan group,  Lusuvilo, which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the genge stock and to buy Irish potatoes, cooking oil and charcoal for frying the chips

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wooden planks and bamboos for sheltering services by her husband.

loans.name: Yasemin

texts.en:
Yasemin is married and has a child. She has been a representative of Amway (cosmetics, parfumes, make-up) products for six years. First she started selling the products to her neighbours, later on she performed meetings at people's homes and increased the number of her customers. 

With the help of the loan, she is planning to buy bulk products thus increase her sales. 

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Yasemin Hanım evli, bir çocuk annesi. Altı yıldır amway ürün satışı yapıyor. Çevresiyle başlamış satış yapmaya zamanla ev toplantıları yaparak müşterilerinin sayısını arttırmış. Alt gruplar kurarak grup lideri olmuş. Hedefi daha da ilerlemek. Aldığı kredi  ile toplu ürün çekecek.  Elinde toplu ürün olduğundan satışları daha da artacak.

loans.use: to buy products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for top dressing for her crops so as to get a better harvest to sell in the market and meet both family and client needs.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en: Yusuf is a Babban Gona maize farmer from  Kofar Barauki village. Yusuf  joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Yusuf will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Yusuf now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Gulru

texts.en:
Gulru is a wise woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1973. She is living in a remote district with her big family. She is married and has five children.  She is a teacher at a secondary school in her area. She teaches to initial class students. She does not earn enough money to pay for each of her children’s tuition fees to study. 

She appealed to IMON, asking for financial support to pay her daughter’s higher education costs. She wishes to be supported.

loans.use: To pay her daughter’s higher education cost

loans.name: Abdullahi	Dan Tela

texts.en:
Abdullahi Dan Tela is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dummuga village. Abdullahi Dan Tela  joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Abdullahi Dan Tela will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizer, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Abdullahi Dan Tela now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into Babban Gona's program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase fhe farmer’s yields

loans.name: Shitu Bala

texts.en:
Shitu Bala is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dummuga village. Shitu Bala joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Shitu Bala suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to feed his family and children. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Shitu Bala will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizer, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Shitu Bala now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farmer’s yields

loans.name: Mango Group

texts.en:
Joyce, who is in her late 20s, is single with two kids who are still at school.  She has been running two projects, selling charcoal and bites in the shop for three years now.  She works from 05am to 07pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Joyce's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to start selling bites and increase on the charcoal stock.  She has managed to pay back her loan successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees, covered household expenses and to repay loan. 

She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal and to make and sell bites like mandazi, chapati, vitumbua, half cake etc. and meet her customers' demand.  She dreams of buying a plot of land.  

Joyce will share this loan with her loan group, Mango, which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and to make and sell bites like mandazi, chapati, vitumbua, half cake etc. and meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Erick Alexander

texts.es:
Erick, tiene como negocio sembrar granos básicos como maíz y frijol para consumo familiar y para poder comercializar otra parte, ya que de esa manera genera ingresos para ir cubriendo otras necesidades familiares, tiene 9 años de estar trabajando en su negocio propio, cuenta con mucha experiencia debido a que desde muy joven inicio a trabajar en el campo ayudando a sus padres para poder subsistir. Vive en casa de sus padres junto a ellos y sus hermanos, las actividades agrícolas las desarrollan con la ayuda de sus hermanos y juntos pueden llevar el sustento para toda la familia y cuidar de sus padres que ya están ancianos.
Está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos agrícolas con los que iniciara la preparación del terreno en que siembra maíz y frijol, así mismo pagara el alquiler del terreno, le será de utilidad para aumentar el área de cultivo y tener una cosecha más abundante.
Las aspiraciones de Erick son almacenar la cosecha para consumo familiar y para tener futuras ventas a mejor precio.
texts.en:
Erick has as a business the planting of basic grains like corn and beans for his family's consumption and to sell the other part, since this way he generates income to cover other family necessities.  He has worked for nine years in his own business.  He has a lot of experience given that from a young age he began working in the fields helping his parents in order to subsist.  He lives in his parents' house with them and his siblings.  The agricultural activities work out with the help of his siblings and together they are able to get the sustenance for the whole family and take care of their parents who are already old.
He is requesting a loan in order to buy agricultural supplies with which he will initiate the preparation of the land in which they will plant corn and beans as well as pay the rent for the land.  It will be useful to him to increase the area under cultivation and to have a more abundant harvest.
Erick's aspirations are to store the harvest for the family consumption and to have future sales at the best price.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies with which he will initiate the preparation of the land in which he will plant corn and beans as well as pay the rent for the land.

loans.name: Yeny Carolina

texts.es:
Yeny, de 27 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, está soltera y tiene un hijo, en su casa vive su hermana, su mamá y su abuela.

Yeny, tiene un cafetín en la misma comunidad donde vive desde hace 6 años, decidió colocar un puesto de venta en la comunidad, porque observo que no habían tiendas y la gente buscaba productos que solo en la ciudad se pueden conseguir; el negocio está cerca de su casa y camina 10 metros para llegar y para comprar mercadería tiene que viajar a la ciudad 2 veces por semana y recorre 35 kilómetros y su horario de trabajo es de 8 horas al día de lunes a domingo.

Yeny, necesita el crédito para comprar jabón, detergentes, papel higiénico, arroz y frijol para la venta, con esto mejorara su negocio, porque tendrá la oportunidad de vender más y podrá satisfacer algunas necesidades que tiene su hijo. 

Sus, sueños son hacer crecer su negocio, desea que su hijo crezca en un ambiente sano y estudien.
texts.en:
Yeny is 27-years old and went to school until fifth grade.  She is single and has one son.  Yeny lives at home with her sister, her mother and her grandmother. 

Yeny has had a small store for the last six years.  She decided to open a store in her community because she saw that there weren't any small stores and the people were wanting products they could only get in the city.  Yeny's business is close to home; she walks ten meters to get there.  To purchase her products. she travels 35 kilometers to go to the city.  Yeny works eight hours a day from Monday to Sunday. 

Yeny needs to the loan to purchase soap, detergents, toilet paper, rice and beans, all for re-sale.  This purchase will improve her business because she will have the opportunity to sell more.  She will then be able to meet some needs her son has. 

Yeny's hopes are to grow her business and for her son to grow up in a healthy atmosphere and to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase soap, detergents, toilet paper, rice and beans.

loans.name: Musa Bala

texts.en:
Musa Bala is a Babban Gona maize farmer from  Dummuga village. Musa Bala joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Musa Bala will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizer, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Musa Bala now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to purchase a motorbike to do business with.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farmer’s yields

loans.name: Nozigul

texts.ru: Nozigul is a cheerful woman. She was born in southern part of Tajikistan in the family of workers. She is divorced and lives with parents. She has her own business. She is a tailor. She sews traditional women and kids dresses. She has permanent customers and gets well profit from her business. At the same time she studies at university. She is an active, responsible and honest person. She needs money to pay her tuition fee of university. She requests a loan from KIVA lenders to pay her higher education costs. She awaits your compassion.
texts.en:
Nozigul is a cheerful woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in a family of workers. She is divorced and lives with parents. 

She has her own business. She is a tailor. She sews traditional women and kid's dresses. She has permanent customers and gets well profit from her business. At the same time she studies at university. She is an active, responsible and honest person. 

She needs money to pay her tuition fee of university. She requests a loan from Kiva lenders to pay her higher education costs. 

She awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to pay her higher education costs

loans.name: Shuáibu

texts.en:
Shuáibu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Makwalla village. Shuáibu joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Shuáibu will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizer, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Shuáibu now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to put into Babban Gona's program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farmer’s yields

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a Business Management Student at the Maharishi Institut and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute. This is her story:
1.	What do you study at the Maharishi Institute? Which classes do you enjoy the most?
I am currently doing a degree in Bachelor of Art in Business Administration Management. I enjoyed Business Law and Ethics, Leadership and Culture, Organization and Management and Sustainable Living.

2.	What are your goals after graduating from the Maharishi Institute? Please be specific: in which sector do you expect to work? In which city would you like to work? Would you like to travel?
My short-term goal is to be involved with a company, specifically in logistics or property and construction. I would like to be in the Marketing or Analyst department because this would be a stepping stone on how to market product or services. I would like to operate in Johannesburg, but expand in my work place in Soweto and yes, I would like to travel and when I have my own businesses I can be able to know which cities need more service and reduce unemployment.

3.	Tell us about your background. Where were you born? Do you have brothers and sisters? What do your parents do for work? Are you married; do you have children?
I am a 22-year-old female, born in TimbiSha and I stay with my mother. I am the first child to my parents and have only one sister from my father's side with another lady. My mother has been a single parent as my father passed away in 2006 June. It has been over four years since she has not worked due to an operation she underwent. I am unwedded and yes I am a mother of a baby girl.

4.	What do you like to do in your spare time?
I like reading novels and writing poems during my spare time. I also enjoy listening to church songs and going out with my daughter.

5.	How will Kiva loan change your life? Describe how the loan will affect your studies and your lifestyle: will there be significant changes?
Kiva loan will change my life because it is hard for me to meet basic needs, especially transport money and tuition fees. My lifestyle would change because at least I would have something to keep me going and the will be significant changes because I won’t be missing any school days due to transport money and I will be able to buy formal clothes as it is our dress code.

loans.use: to pay for one year's tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Macario Alcides

texts.es:
Macario, tiene una  familia compuesta por su esposa y dos hijos, en total son 4 personas, es una persona reconocida por sus vecinos como responsable y honesta. Su fuente de ingresos es el cultivo de hortalizas y granos básicos, está desarrollando esté negocio desde hace 25 años, su padre le enseño el oficio, su horario de trabajo es de cinco de la mañana cinco de la tarde, trabaja solo, su ventaja es que los productos que cultivan son muy demandados y los vende frescos.
Invertirá en fertilizantes, fungicidas y herbicidas, para poder darle un buen trato a sus cultivos y obtener una cosecha abundante, que le permita tener alimento para su familia y producto de calidad para poder atender a nuevos clientes y compartir con su familia un mejor entorno.
Sus sueños son diversificar sus cultivos, tener estabilidad económica y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Macario's family is composed of himself, his wife and their two children; they are four people total.  He is known by as neighbors for being responsible and honest.  Macario's source of income comes from growing vegetables and staple grains.  He has been developing his business for 25 years.  His father taught him the trade.  Marcario works from 5:00am to 5:00pm.  He works alone.  His advantage is that the products he grows are in demand and he sells them fresh. 
Macario will invest in fertilizers, fungicides and herbicides, which will be good for his crops and give him an abundant harvest.  This will allow him to feed his family and have a quality product to sell to new customers.  He will also be able to share a better environment with his family. 
Macario's hopes are to diversity his crop, to have financial stability and to get ahead with his family.

loans.use: to invest in fertilizers, fungicides and herbicides, which will be good for his crops well and give him an abundant harvest.

loans.name: Maria Carmen

texts.es:
María, agradece la oportunidad que Padecomsm y los inversionistas Kiva le han dado para trabajar con créditos, actualmente ha mejorado su negocio, ya que ha comprado ganado, sus ingresos han mejorado significativamente y toda la familia se encuentra saludable.
Está necesitando de un nuevo crédito para utilizarlo en el fortalecimiento de su negocio, comprara lácteos, maíz para elaborar la venta de tortillas y concentrado para alimentar el ganado, espera mantener su negocio con actividad.
texts.en:
María is grateful for the opportunity given her by Padecomsm and the Kiva lenders to work with loans.  Her business has improved since she has purchased livestock.  Her income has improved significantly, and her whole family is healthy.  
María needs a new loan, which will be used to strengthen her business.  She will purchase dairy products, corn for making and selling tortillas and feed for her livestock.  She hopes for her business to sustain itself.

loans.use: to purchase dairy products, corn for making and selling tortillas and animal feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a Babban Gona farmer from Makwalla village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Musa no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to feed his family and children. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria. This will see him increase his income considerably.  

This season Musa has ambitious plans to harvest 35 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Musa now has the opportunity to renovate his house.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farmer’s yields

loans.name: Las Canelitas De La I Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Las canelitas de la i” conformada por 06 socias emprendedoras y solidarias que con el fruto de sus esfuerzos han ido mejorando. Ana de 34  años es  separada con cuatro hijos uno de ellos es dependiente. Ella  se dedica a la venta de papa rellena lo cual lo hace de forma ambulatoria. Ana se siente orgullosa porque gracias al préstamo podrá mejorar su calidad de vida. El crédito que solicitó lo destinará para la compra de papa, carne y huevos. El deseo de Ana es de mejorar el negocio. El grupo “las canelitas de la i” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. Ana es la primera del lado izquierdo viste polo color fucsia.
texts.en:
This is the "Las Canelitas de la I” communal bank. It is made up of six enterprising and supportive members who, through the fruit of their actions, have been improving their situations.

Ana is 34-years old. She is separated and has four children, one of whom is dependent on her. Ana makes her living selling "papa rellena" (potato croquettes) as a street vendor. She feels proud that thanks to the loan, she will be able to improve her quality of life. The loan she has requested will be used to purchase potatoes, meat and eggs. Ana's hope is to improve her business.

The “Las Canelitas de la I” communal bank is grateful to those who have made this loan possible.

In the above photo, Ana is first from the left and wearing a fuchsia-colored t-shirt.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, meat and eggs.

loans.name: Josefina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Josefina, de 47 años de edad, no estudio, está acompañada desde hace 26 años, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 3 hijos y todos tienen sus propios hogares, en su casa viven sus dos nietos.

Josefina, se dedica a la agricultura con su esposo desde hace 12 años, todo lo aprendió de sus padres, quienes desde muy pequeña le enseñaron todo lo que sabe.- Además de la agricultura también se dedica a la venta de leche y queso, lo vende en su comunidad y su horario de trabajo es de 4 horas al día. 

Josefina, necesita el dinero para comprar una vaquilla, de esa manera mejorara el ingreso por la venta de lácteos.
texts.en:
Josefina, 47. never studied and has been married for 26 years.  Her husband makes a living in agriculture. She has three children and they all have their own homes.  Her two grandchildren live in her house.
Josephina has been making a living from agriculture for 12 years.  She learned it all from her parents who taught her all she knows from a young age.  In addition to agriculture, she also makes a living from the sales of milk and cheese.  She sells them in her community and she works for four hours a day.
Josephina needs the money to buy a heifer and in this way she will improve the income from her dairy product sales.

loans.use: to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a moto-rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Jaime Hernando

texts.es: Jaime es un microempresario de 57 años domiciliado en un barrio ubicado en Bogotá, su gusto por la culinaria lo motivó a capacitarse en esta actividad por intermedio de una entidad del estado y posteriormente en una escuela de pescadería.  Hoy en día ofrece servicios en elaboración de platos especiales; paellas, pavos rellenos y pollo, desde una página de internet, sus amigos y referidos pueden realizar sus pedidos cualquier día de la semana a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m.  Desde que inauguró su negocio ha logrado sustentar a su familia gracias a su compromiso y dedicación, él es padre de dos hijos mayores de edad a quienes ofreció  bienestar y su principal desafío es lograr estabilidad y solvencia económica para mejorar sus condiciones de vida. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en estufas, platos, publicidad y materias primas como arroz, aceite, carnes y verduras. Con esta inversión pretende incrementar la demanda de consumidores  y así lograr incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Jaime is a 57-year old micro-entrepreneur.  He lives in one of Bogotá's neighborhood's.  His taste for cooking motivated him to get trained for the business through a state organization and later at a fishery school.  Today, Jaime's services include making special dishes, paellas, stuffed turkeys and chicken.  His friends and those referred to him can place their orders on an internet page any day of the week from 8:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m.  Since opening his business, Jaime has been able to support his family, thanks to his commitment and dedication.  
Jaime is the father of two grown children, whose welfare he provided for.  
Jaime's main challenge is achieving stability and financial solvency so he can improve his quality of life.  
Jaime is currently requesting a credikiva, his first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, so he can invest in stoves, plates, advertising and raw materials such as rice, cooking oil, meat and vegetables.  With this investment, Jaime expects to increase consumer demand and therefore increase his sales.

loans.use: to invest in stoves, plates, advertising and raw materials such as rice, cooking oil, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 37-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a vegetable seller by profession, selling vegetables e.g. onions, lady fingers, potatoes, etc. Her husband is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Farzana's husband needs to purchase different types of vegetables for reselling purposes, so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to his unfavorable financial position her husband is not in a condition to purchase vegetables for his business purpose.

Therefore Farzana has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business purpose.

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: increase her husband's vegetable business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing for reselling from her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en: Ivan is 35 years old, male, and married with six children, four of whom are attending school. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. He has a clothing boutique and grows maize and beans for additional income. He used his previous loan to buy ready-made clothes, shoes, and other textiles for selling. Ivan's business growth is affected by the season, especially during the festive season when sales are very high during the season and very low afterwards. He is requesting a loan to buy shoes and clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothes for selling

loans.name: Abdullahi

texts.en: Abdullahi is a Babban Gona farmer from Garu Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realize better yields from his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Abdullahi no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to pay for his children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see him increase his income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Abdullahi now has the opportunity to renovate his house.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm's yields.

loans.name: Mahamat

texts.en: Mahamat is a careful father. He was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1959. He is living with his big family in a village. He is married and has six children. For almost ten years he has been working at a collective farm as a specialist in agriculture. He is a well-known client at IMON. It is his fourth time applying to get a loan. He is sick and wants to be treated at a hospital now. He appealed to IMON, asking for a loan to be treated at the medical clinic. He hopes to be healthy and continue his activity in agriculture. He wishes to be supported by KIVA lenders.

loans.use: to be treated at the medical clinic.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 50 years old and married to Alex. Together, they support a family of 3 children. 

She has been practicing small scale farming for the last 26 years, earning KES 15,000 per month.

Hellen has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya in order to buy a dairy cow to increase milk production and to earn more income. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to start poultry farming. 

In the future, she dreams of being financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to increase milk production.

loans.name: Hannatu

texts.en:
Hannatu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kunda Village. She joined Babban Gona to create a better life for her children. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Hannatu will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see her increase her household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Hannatu now has the opportunity to increase her yields and income and use her additional earnings to build a better home for her family.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha is a 23-year-old single student, from the Kampot Province in Cambodia. Her father is a rice farmer and her mother is a teacher.

She is pursuing a Bachelor’s degree, majoring in finance and banking, and is in her second year of her studies at university in the city. 

Currently, Chantha is requesting a loan because she needs finances to pay her university fees for her second through fourth years. With this loan, she will be able to earn a bachelor’s degree successfully. 

In the future, she hopes to have a good job in a financial institution with a reasonable salary, so she will be able to build her own house.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stock of clothes for sale in the market so as to meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more trees for home energy supply to earn more income

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Sarki Village. Naomi joined Babban Gona to create a better life for her children. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Naomi will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, which is double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. 

This will increase her household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Naomi now has the opportunity to increase her yields and income.  She will use her additional earnings to build a better home for her family.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her yield.

loans.name: Hayriniso

texts.en:
Hayriniso is a nice woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1975. She lives in a village with her parents. She is divorced and has five children. 

For almost 13 years she has been working at a medical clinic in her area. She has worked hard and progressively during her working years, and recently she has become a director at the clinic. It has been hard to support her big family alone. 

Unfortunately her son has fallen sick, and she needs to treat him in hospital. She is asking a loan from Kiva lenders to treat her son in hospital. 

Hayriniso hopes to be supported and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to treat her son in hospital

loans.name: Sabounyouma Group

texts.fr:
Moriba  tient la corde de mouton,  il est    malien, âgé  de 45 berges, mari de deux épouses, ces deux épouses fond  les jardinages, les petites commerces, et l’hivernage elles cultivent  pour aider leur mari à subvenir aux  besoins familiales.
Il est père de 8 enfants dont 4 garçons et 4 filles, parmi ces 8 enfants deux sont scolarisés.
Les rêves  et  les  espoirs  de Moriba    est d’ améliorer  l’éducation , la santé, l’hygiène de ces enfants et d’ acheter  un terrain dans une ville et si possible construire.
Moriba a  été  à l’école mais  il n’a pas pu finir ces  études. il prête au  RMCR pour acheter plus de beliers.. 
Il est emboucheur  ovins. Moriba  achète  ces béliers  dans les  différentes foires  et revend  dans les mêmes lieux.  
Il les engraisse avant de les vendre. il peut  avoir un  bénéfice  de 25 000f CFA par tête. Il  prête pour achèter  les bovins, ovins et  cultive son champs aussi.
Moriba a commencé  cette  activité depuis  4 ans et puis ça lui  plait parce qu’il gagne dedans . Les obstacles soulignés par Moriba : les maladies des animaux  et parfois les frais  de nourriture augmentent.
texts.en:
Moriba is seen in the photo, holding the sheep's rope.  He is 45 years old and married to two wives who grow vegetables and work in retail to help their husband provide for their family.  Moriba has eight children (four girls and four boys), two of his children attend school.  Moriba's dream is to improve the education, health and cleanliness of his children.  He would also like to buy some land and, if possible, build a house.  Although he attended school, he was unable to finish his studies.  

Moriba is a client of the field partner, RMCR, and has been rearing sheep for four years.  He enjoys his work as it provides a good living.  This loan will be used to buy more sheep from local markets, fatten them up and then resell them at the same markets.  He makes a profit of 25,000 francs CFA a head when he sells the sheep.  Moriba's loans are used to buy sheep, cattle and supplies to cultivate his fields.  He encounters difficulties with animal disease and rising feed prices.

loans.use: to buy cows and sheep for fattening up and selling on.

loans.name: God Is Good Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of eight members, who will begin their first term with ID-Ghana. The members run a wide variety of businesses that deal in wigs, foodstuff, banana, cassava dough, groceries and seamstress services. This loan will benefit all of the small businesses in Patience's group. 

Patience joined ID-Ghana a year ago at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. She currently has a business selling wigs. She started the business on her own three years ago upon seeing how well this type of business was doing in the market. She will use this loan to increase her capital by purchasing wigs from the main market to sell to her customers. This work generates enough income to support herself, as she is single and has no children. 

When asked what she likes best about ID-Ghana, Patience said she likes the health services and the training that the institution provides.

loans.use: To purchase wigs from the main market to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jamima

texts.en:
Jamima is a Babban Gona farmer from Dankwaire Village. She joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Jamima will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds. This loan will help her produce yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, which is double the 14 bags per hectare produced by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. 

With the opportunity to earn higher yields and increase her net income, Jamima would like to use her extra earnings to move to the city with her family.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her yields

loans.name: Joseph

texts.fr: Joseph, âgé de 52 ans, est père de 5 enfants. Il est divorcé de sa femme et a la garde de ses enfants. Il vend des matériaux de construction (fer, bois, blocs… etc). Il a déjà bénéficié de petits crédits pour démarrer son activité et les a remboursés avec succès. Il fait une demande de microcrédit dans le but d'augmenter son stock de marchandise à vendre. Il veut agrandir davantage son commerce et offrir de meilleures conditions de vie à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Joseph is fifty-two years old and father to five children.  He is divorced but has custody of his children.  Joseph sells construction materials (iron, wood, blocks, etc)  He started his business with loans which he repaid without difficulty.

Joseph has requested this loan to increase his stock holding levels.  He would like to expand his business and be able to offer his children better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy iron posts for sale.

loans.name: Mie Florianne

texts.fr: Florianne, 59 ans, est mariée. Elle a 2 enfants à sa charge. Elle a une boutique petite épicerie à domicile où elle vend des produits alimentaires et produits cosmétiques.  Elle est en rupture de stock de produits cosmétique. Elle cherche un microcrédit pour acheter des shampoings, savons de toilette,  déodorants et dentifrices.
texts.en:
Florianne is fifty-nine years old and married.  She has two children in her care.  Florianne runs a small general store from her home.  She sells food and cosmetic products.

Currently, she has run out of stock of cosmetic products and has requested this loan to buy more shampoo, soap, deodorant and toothpaste to sell.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, soap, deodorant and toothpaste for sale.

loans.name: Annalise

texts.fr: Annalise est âgée de 49 ans. Elle est mariée et a 5 enfants. Son activité est un petit commerce de produits alimentaires et produits cosmétiques. Elle exerce cette activité depuis de longues années. Souhaitant multiplier ses revenus, elle cherche un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock de marchandises.
texts.en:
Annalise is forty-nine years old, married and has five children.  She earns a living by selling food and cosmetic products, and has been doing this for many years.

Annalise has requested this loan to increase her stock-holding and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice for sale.

loans.name: Ndeye's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 36 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée le 14 novembre 2009. Il est constitué de femmes du même quartier qui s'activent dans le commerce et ont de bonnes relations entre elles.
SOPHIE à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 29 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'un garçon.
Avec le prêt reçu elle se rend à touba pour acheter ses marchandises. Pour les parfums elle achète deux façons.
La première à 700 FCFA et la revend à 1000 voire 1500 FCFA et la deuxième à 1200 FCFA et la cède à 2000 FCFA. Elle place les parfums à crédit jusqu'à la fin du mois. Elle achète le tissu 11 000 FCFA les 30 yards pour confectionner des draps artisanaux. Après confection, elle obtient 8 paires et cède la paire à 2500 FCFA.
Les bénéfices vont lui servir à épargner et aussi à rembourser son prêt.
texts.en:
This group of 36 members is part of the "banc villageois" loan association that was created November 14, 2009. It is made up of women from the same neighborhood who are active in trade and have a good relationship.

Sophie, raising her hand on the right of the photo, is 29 years old. She is married and the mother of one boy. With the loan she receives she goes to Touba to buy her merchandise.

She buys perfumes in two qualities: the first she buys at 700 CFA francs for resale at 1000 or even 1500 CFA francs, and the second at 1200 CFA francs to be let go at 2000 CFA francs. Those perfumes are sold on credit until the end of the month.

She buys 30 yards' worth of fabric for 11,000 CFA francs to make handcrafted linens, from which she obtains eight pairs of sheets to be sold at 2,500 CFA francs a pair.

The profits will be put into savings and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: She will buy perfumes and fabric

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dankwaire Village. She joined Babban Gona to expand her farm and grow her agricultural business.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Victoria will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her produce yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see her increase her household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Victoria now has the opportunity to increase her yields and income, and she will use her extra earnings to provide employment to members of her community through her farm.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her yields

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy ingredients to bake pastries for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: Meri

texts.en:
Meri, 25 years old, is from the capital of Georgia. She has a husband, who sometimes works in Turkey. Meri is a stylist at the local beauty salon and generates her own income. Up until now, her husband’s salary and her additional income have not been enough for her family's welfare as their combined income is low. Meri wants to make another source of income and start her own business. Meri requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for her trading business startup. She received the credit in the framework of a joint initiative, Kiva and Credo - Startup Program, that gives people the chance to start or re-start businesses. Meri will purchase stock of fresh fruits and vegetables every day and will trade locally. She will get a significant source of income and will attract daily clients among the local people.
 
The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the family's income and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To start her own business and trade in fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Wendlafan Group

texts.fr: Rahinata, âgée de 32 ans est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Cette jeune dame vend du jus et cela fait 7 ans déjà. Elle a besoin de ce prêt pour acheter 2 sacs de sucre, des sachets, d'autres ingrédients(bissap , gingembre, épices, tamarin,...) pour faire du jus pour vendre. Elle va arranger aussi son congélateur avec une partie de l'argent.Le groupe de Rahinata fait bien ses remboursements et à la bonne date. Après ses ventes, son bénéfice lui permettra d'aider sa famille.
texts.en:
32-year-old Rahinata is married with four children. This young lady has been selling juice for the past seven years.

She needs the loan to buy 2 bags of sugar, plastic pouches and other ingredients (hibiscus, ginger, spices, tamarind, ...) to make juices for sale. She will also use some of the money to repair her freezer.

Rahinata's group manages to reimburse well and on time. After sales, the profits will enable her to help her family.

loans.use: buy two bags of sugar, plastic pouches and other ingredients, to make juices for sale

loans.name: Monrovia Group

texts.en:
Stella, who is in her early 40s, is married with one son who is still in school.  She has been running a retail shop for six years now.  She works from 6 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a small profit.

This will be Stella's eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase the shop inventory and has been able to pay back all of her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees, buy a plot of land, repay the loans and cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to increase her shop inventory to meet her customers' demands. She dreams of owning good money.

Stella will share this loan with her loan group Monrovia, which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her shop inventory to meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Haydee Yamires

texts.es:
Haydee, de 44 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está acompañada y su pareja es agricultor, tienen 3 hijos, uno de ellos está acompañado. 

Haydee, se dedica a la venta de queso fresco y leche, ella le compra la leche a otras personas y luego la revende, de esa manera le ayuda a su pareja con los gastos del hogar, se ha dedicado a este negocio desde hace 24 años, su padre le enseño esta actividad, ella vende en el municipio más cercano a su casa y recorre 7.5  kilómetros en bus, dos veces a la semana para poder vender sus productos y su horario de trabajo es de 6 horas al día. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar más leche, para elaborar más queso y requesón; con esta ayuda ella podrá incrementar su producción y mejorar sus ganancias. 

El principal sueño de Haydee, es ver a sus hijos terminar una carrera universitaria, ya que ella no lo logro.- Además, desea colocar un puesto formal de venta de lácteos en el municipio donde vive.
texts.en:
Haydee is 44 years old and has a third-grade education. She has a partner, a farmer; the couple has three children, one of whom has their own partner.

Haydee makes a living selling fresh cheese and milk. She buys the milk and then re-sells it, thus helping her partner with household costs. Haydee has had this business for 24 years, her father having taught her this work. Haydee sells milk in the municipality closest to her house, travelling 7.5km on the bus twice a week in order to sell her products. Haydee works six hours per day.

Haydee needs this loan so that she can buy more milk and produce more cheese and cottage cheese. This loan will allow Haydee to increase production and her income.

Haydee’s biggest dream is to see her children graduate from university, something that she herself could not do. Haydee would also like to have dairy-products stall in her municipality.

loans.use: to buy more milk in order to produce more cheese and cottage cheese.

loans.name: Yanci Dolores

texts.es:
Yancy, es una persona que desde hace 2 años emprendió su negocio de elaboración y venta de piezas de loza, su mamá le enseño a desarrollar dicha actividad desde que tenía corta edad, tiene un horario de labores de 8:00 de la mañana a 5:00 de la tarde, sus ventajas son que ya ha establecido clientes frecuentes y que sus productos son aceptados en el mercado. Yancy vive con su compañero de vida, todavía no tienen hijos, en su comunidad los identifican como personas responsables y con buenos valores.
Utilizará en su totalidad el crédito que solicita en la compra de nacazcol, leña, arcilla y barro crudo para seguir produciendo ollas, sartenes, comales, etc., espera tener los materiales necesarios para expandir más su negocio y atender los pedidos de la temporada y así tener nuevos ingresos.
Sus sueños son diversificar sus productos, contar con nuevos clientes y disminuir las necesidades familaires.
texts.en:
Two years ago Yancy started a business producing and selling crockery. Her mother taught her this work from a young age and now Yancy works from 8am until 5pm. The strength of her business is that she has regular customers and that her products are popular on the market. Yancy lives with her partner but the couple does not have children yet. Yancy and her partner are known locally to be responsible and to have good values.

Yancy will use this entire loan to buy black dye, firewood, clay and mud in order to continue producing, pots, pans and hotplates. Yancy hopes to have the necessary materials in order to expand her business, fulfil seasonal orders and earn a higher income.

Yancy’s dreams are to diversify her range of products, to have new customers, and to provide more for her family.

loans.use: to buy black dye, firewood, clay and mud in order to continue producing, pots, pans and hotplates.

loans.name: Tulurani

texts.en:
Tulurani is a 27-year-old young married woman. She stays in a small kaccha hut (made of mud and straw) in the village of Babupara in Falakata at Alipurduar district. She is raising her only son with love and care. Her son is a toddler. She has received an education up to grade six and could not proceed further due to her family’s financial issues.

She and her husband Netai together are engaged in sewing work to earn their livelihood according to their ability. The couple has their own sewing machine. They buy the fabrics in bulk from the wholesale market and prepare different types of garments and they mainly stitch bags and sacks ordered by the market shops.  

There is a great demand for their products in her rural area. Both of them are very hardworking and talented and have been pleasing their clients over the years with their qualified service. As this is the sole source of income, Tulurani wishes to buy another sewing machine to increase their production and fulfill the market demands on time. So she requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase another sewing machine. 

Tulurani hopes that she will be able to expand her business with the outcome profit. She also has a vision of improving her family’s economic condition. Tulurani is grateful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for expanding her family-run business.

loans.name: Kasimu

texts.en: Kasimu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dankwaire Village. Kasimu joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Kasimu will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Kasimu now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to move to the city with his family.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Susan Andrea

texts.es: Susan es una de nuestras socias por mas de dos años. Actualmente se encuentra trabajando en un jardín de niños donde esta muy contenta por haber llegado a ese lugar. Ella sigue en la lucha por conseguir su sueño de tener su propio jardín. Ella solicito el préstamo para hacer sus estudios de maestría. Ella se siente feliz y quiere agradecer por el apoyo incondicional a los socios de Kiva, y por ayudar a cumplir sus metas.
texts.en: Susan has been a borrower for more than two years. She is currently working at a kindergarten, and is very happy to be there. Susan continues to fight for her dream of owning her own kindergarten. Susan is applying for a loan in order to pay for her Master's course. Susan is happy, and is grateful for the support of Kiva lenders who are helping her to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to pay for her Master's course.

loans.name: Umed

texts.en: Umed is a bright student. He was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1996. He is living in a village with his family. He is single and lives with his parents. After graduation from high school, he entered the university. Recently, he is studying finance. His attendance at university is good and he is active in the classes. He is well known among students and friends. He wants to be a specialist in his major. He is asking for financial support from IMON and Kiva lenders to pay his higher education costs. He wishes Kiva lenders compassion.

loans.use: to pay his higher education costs

loans.name: Sallau

texts.en: Sallau is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kunda Village. Sallau joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Sallau will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Sallau now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to buy improved farm machinery and hire skilled labour.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Sumitra

texts.en:
Sumitra is a young woman of 33 years.  A mother of three children (Two sons and one daughter), Sumitra is still very energetic, hardworking and optimistic.  Her husband does cultivation on their own land, which he received from his ancestors. They live in Falakata, West Bengal.  She is very much concerned about her children's education and they are in grades 10, 8 and 6, respectively.

Sumitra's husband is the only earning member in the family who always strives for the betterment of his family.  Sumitra, though a housewife, helps her husband with his agricultural activities. They mainly cultivate seasonal vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market.  But it is very difficult for them to run a family of five members in a decent way with such a small income. They decided to expand their business for more income. So they want to cultivate jute, which is a profitable crop.  To achieve the same they need capital.

Thus, Sumitra has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase jute seeds, fertilizers and other necessary farm supplies related to cultivation. She hopes it will be a lucrative business and will provide them with more profit to give her family financial stability.

She is grateful to Kiva and BJS for this financial support.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, manure, fertilizers and necessary farm supplies for jute cultivation.

loans.name: Ghali

texts.en: Ghali is a Babban Gona farmer from Kwalo Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Ghali no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to increase his farmland. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see her increase her income considerably.  This season, Ghali has ambitious plans to harvest 35  bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ghali now has the opportunity to buy improved farm machinery and hire skilled labour.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Janet Esther

texts.es:
Janet es una joven universitaria de 19 años. Actualmente  se encuentra cursando el tercer ciclo  de la carrera de Administración. Ella decidió estudiar esta carrera ya hoy en día las empresas su de mucha importancia para el desarrollo de nuestro país. Ademas de ser una joven muy aplicada en sus ratos libres se va al mercado a vender verduras.
Comenta que quiere especializarse en Finanzas.
Ella solicito el préstamo para poder pagar sus pensiones de sus estudios, ya le falta tres años y medio para terminar su carrera. Se siente muy agradecida con las personas que le ayudan a cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Janet, 19, is a young university student. Currently she is in the third stage of a degree in Administration. She decided to study this course since nowadays businesses see it as being very important for the country's development.

As well as being very hard-working, she also goes to the market in her spare time to sell vegetables. She says she wants to specialise in Finance. She is asking for the loan so she can pay the instalments for her studies. She still has three and a half years left to finish her degree.

Janet is very grateful to the people who are helping her to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to pay for higher education.

loans.name: Soma

texts.en:
Thirty-year-old Soma lives in Falakata with her husband and a daughter. Her daughter is in grade two in a local village school.  Soma has completed her secondary grade education. 

Her husband is a wholesale retailer by profession. He buys various food items, stationeries, and cosmetics from the wholesale market in bulk and distributes those items in his neighboring rural market shops comparatively at a cheaper rate. So there is a lot of demand for his products amongst his customers. 

Soma also helps her husband by selling some of these in-demand items to her relatives, friends and neighbors. In this way, they earn their livelihood but it is hardly enough to cover all their household expenses. Since it is their sole source of income, it is very crucial for Soma that the items are in abundant and of good quality. To achieve the same, she has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy more variety of items to run the business smoothly throughout the year.

She hopes it will enable her to increase the family's income and expand the business as well. She wants to save some amount for her family’s future to lead a secure life.

Soma is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of items for her husband’s retailing business.

loans.name: Wendbenedo Pade Group

texts.fr: Bernadette, responsable du groupe est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Agée de 48 ans, cette femme battante est transformatrice de manioc en attièké, un aliment très consommé par les burkinabé même s'il est d'origine ivoirien. Bernadette aimerait avoir ce prêt pour acheter la pate de manioc pour faire de l'attièké pour vendre. Après ses ventes, son bénéfice lui permettra d'aider à faire les depenses de sa famille mais aussi de continuer son activité.
texts.en:
Bernadette, the group leader, is married with four children. This 48-year-old woman processes cassava to make attieke (a dish made from fermented cassava), a foodstuff widely used by the Burkinabe, although of Ivorian origin.

Bernadette would like to have this loan to buy cassava dough to prepare attieke for sale. After sales, the earnings will enable her to deal with family expenditures but also to pursue her activity.

loans.use: buy 20 bags of cassava dough to make attieke for sale

loans.name: Maira Evelin

texts.es:
Maira, con el apoyo que ha recibido de créditos mantiene en el mercado la venta de pupusas, da a sus clientes un mejor servicio y cubre las necesidades que surgen en su hogar, por el momento no ha tenido problemas para continuar trabajando. 
Hace la solicitud de un nuevo crédito para comprar quesillo, chicharrón, aceite tomates, chiles, etc., tendrá disponibilidad de la materia prima para elaborar la venta de pupusas, espera tener buenos resultados de la inversión.
texts.en:
With the help of the loans she has received, Maira is keeping her business open, giving her customers a better service and covering any needs which arise in the home. At the moment she has not had any problems in continuing to work.

She is asking for a new loan to buy fresh cheese, pork rinds, oil, tomatoes, chillies etc. to have the raw ingredients available for making and selling pupusas [stuffed corn tortillas]. She hopes to get good results from this investment.

loans.use: to buy fresh cheese, pork rinds, oil, tomatoes, chillies etc. to have the raw ingredients available for making and selling pupusas.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PADRE URRACA”; la socia Felicitas  continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de productos de belleza como cremas, perfumes, colonias entre otros,  la socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa,  a la vez la socia continua trabajando en un estudio contable, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de perfumes entre otros para su negocio.
texts.en: Felicitas belongs to the loan group "Padre Urraca". She continues to make a living by selling beauty products such as lotions, perfumes, colognes and others. She is thankful for her previous loan through Kiva and again she promises to complete her loan payments in the allowed time. She is a responsible and diligent person. Simultaneously, she continues working in an accounting firm. This is how she supports her family. Felicitas is asking for a loan to buy perfumes and other things for her business.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and other things for her business.

loans.name: Vetza Martha

texts.es:
Vetza es una mujer de 34 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 1 hijo varón de 8 años y 2 hijas mujeres de 13 y 15 años, y su negocio es el tejido de mantas de vicuña y alpaca. 
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, sincera, Inteligente, generosa, comprensiva, paciente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Cosmos 79’, ubicado a 4.080 metros sobre el nivel del mar dónde se encuentra el estadio de futbol del mismo nombre. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Vetza es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela. viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es el tejido de mantas de vicuña y alpaca; su trabajo consiste en caminar largas distancias en el altiplano en busca de lana de vicuña, la cual limpia para luego hilvanarla, una vez que tiene suficiente lana se dispone a tejerla en un telar. Su trabajo es netamente artesanal y cada manta lleva un promedio de 2 a 3 semanas en terminarla. “inicié mi actividad hace mucho tiempo con mi mamá, actualmente tengo mi propio taller…” comenta. la ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes y ventas continuas, la desventaja son las distancias que debe recorrer en busca de lana.
