Su sueño es contar con lana suficiente para trabajar constantemente, Ella desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de lana de vicuña y alpaca por mayor, para contar con material de trabajo para trabajar constantemente sin problemas. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 7 años que lleva realizando esta actividad de forma independiente. 
Es por esos motivos que Vetza solicita un préstamo para la compra de lana de vicuña y alpaca por mayor para contar con material para trabajar constantemente sin descuidar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
34-year-old Vetza lives with her partner. She has a son aged 8 years and 2 daughters aged 13 and 15 years. She has a business weaving blankets from vicuña and alpaca. She is a good mother and is enterprising, sincere, intelligent, generous, understanding, patient, responsible and hard-working. Her business is based in the 'Cosmos 79' area, which is situated at 4,080 metres above sea level and has a football stadium of the same name. It has a cold dry climate with a temperature which varies between 0-12 degrees centigrade during the day . 

Vetza has a dark complexion, brown eyes and long dark hair which she wears in a plait. She is short and well-built, and wears traditional dress (hat, shawl and full skirt). Her mother tongue is Aymara which she speaks among the family and she speaks Spanish for everyday use and for carrying out her business. 

She shares her life with her partner who works in construction and their children who are at school. They live in their own house built of brick and cement with a zinc roof and wooden floor. It has drinking water, electricity, a domestic gas supply and sewerage.

Her business is weaving blankets from vicuña and alpaca. Her work entails walking long distances on the altiplano in search of vicuña wool, which she cleans and then spins. Once she has enough wool she starts to weave with it on a loom. Her work is completely handmade and each blanket takes 2-3 weeks on average to produce. 

"I started my work many years ago with my mum, and now I have my own workshop..." she says. The advantage of her business is that she has continuous customers and sales. The disadvantage is the distance she has to travel looking for wool. Her dream is to have enough wool to be able to work continuously. She wants to invest in her business by buying vicuña and alpaca wool wholesale, so that she has material available to work continuously without any problems.

These are the reasons why Vetza is asking for a loan to buy vicuña and alpaca wool wholesale so she has enough material to work continuously without neglecting her children. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 7 years which she has been working independently.

loans.use: to buy vicuña and alpaca wool wholesale so she has materials available to work continuously without neglecting her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm and hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce for sell and make more income.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a 23-year-old married woman; she is shown in the photo with her husband.  She deals in the business of selling animal sales. She looks after the animals, such as goats and calves, and is responsible for feeding them, while her husband sells them in different markets in the city. Their business is providing them with enough income to support their family. 

However, they need to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, health and clothing. In order to expand their earnings, Asma has availed a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR to buy more baby goats for resale purposes to make a good amount of profits.

loans.use: to buy more baby goats for resale purposes to make a good amount of profits.

loans.name: Raheela

texts.en:
Raheela is a 40-year-old married woman, with four children. For the past five years, she has been running a business of cattle sale and purchase, along with her husband who is also shown in the photo. She looks after the cattle and is responsible for feeding them, while her husband sells them to different markets in the city. Their business is providing them with enough income to support their family. 

However, they need to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, health and clothing. In order to expand their earnings, Raheela has availed a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR to buy more cattle for resale purposes. She is hopeful that expanding the business will help in improving her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for resale purposes.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is a 54-year-old entrepreneur who manufactures steel products. He has been an independent entrepreneur for 10 years, and now employs 7 to 8 workers in his workshop. One of the two aspects of his work he enjoys the most is training unskilled workers until they reach a point where he can recommend them for a government certificate. The other is designing machines and seeing that what he designs works. What is amazing about his workshop is that he designed all the tools he uses to make other machines – and they work!  However he is handicapped by them and needs good sophisticated machinery to speed up his production and make more complex machines.

Sam is asking for a loan to be able to buy tools and machines that will enable him to work more efficiently and develop his business. He has been making large gasifying improved cook stoves to help stop deforestation in Zambia and has orders for many more. These stoves require precision tools that he cannot afford without a loan. He is very keen on participating in this new technology and save the forests of his country.

Sam is a very outgoing and warm person involved in many things. He is an actor, does community work and loves meeting new people. He is also a father. His two daughters are finishing accountant college, and of his three sons, one is following in his father’s footsteps studying mechanical engineering and works with him on school break, another is studying hotel management and a third is still in high school.

loans.use: to buy tools and machines for his workshop

loans.name: Julio Albeiro

texts.es: Julio es un microempresario de 41 años,  residente en el municipio de Chocontá ubicado en el Departamento de Cundinamarca,  desde niño en compañía de sus padres y familiares estuvo involucrado en el cultivo de fresas, esta actividad ha trascendido de generación en generación  y él decidió continuar con el legado.  Hoy en día cuenta con seis años de funcionamiento,  distribuyendo semanalmente cajas de fresas a establecimientos de ventas de Fruver y comerciantes de abastos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  para comprar un motocicleta, vehículo que le permitirá mejorar sus tiempos para las solicitudes de pedidos y ser más productivo.  Julio ha tenido excelentes resultados en su negocio por ser muy dedicado y responsable, sus metas a largo plazo son educar a su hijo y arrendar otro lote para cultivar.
texts.en:
Julio is a 41 year old small-business owner. He lives in the town of Chocontá, located in the section of Cundinamarca. From the time he was a child, in the company of his parents and relatives, he was involved in the cultivation of strawberries. This job has transcended from generation to generation and he decided to continue with the legacy. 
Today he has been in operation for six years, distributing boxes of strawberries weekly to Fruver retail establishments and supply dealers. He is applying for a Credikiva, his first funding that he has made with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy a motorcycle. This vehicle will allow him to improve his times for order requests and to be more productive. Julio has had excellent results in his business from being very dedicated and responsible. His long-term goals are to educate his son and rent another lot to cultivate.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Samuel Eugenio

texts.es:
Samuel, se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en pollos recién nacidos, vitaminas y concentrado para aumentar la productividad de la granja, espera que sus demandas se mantengan y pueda tener mejores ingresos.
Con la ayuda del préstamo anterior a podido tener su negocio funcionando y ha generado los ingresos necesarios para subsistir junto a su familia y para cancelar su deuda.
texts.en: Samuel sees the necessity of asking for a new loan to invest in recently-born chickens, vitamins and extract to increase the production of the farm. He hopes that his demands endure and he can have a better income. With the help of the previous loan, he was able to have his business functioning and has generated the necessary income to survive with his family and to pay out his debt.

loans.use: to invest in recently-born chickens, vitamins and extract to increase the production of the farm.

loans.name: Nongtaaba De Bingo Group

texts.fr:
Mme EVELYNE est responsable du groupe NONGTAABA DE BINGO. Mariée, elle est mère de 05enfants. Le plus âgé a 25ans et le moins âgé a 13ans. 04 vont à l’école. Elle a 06personnes en charge.
Mme prépare et vend du dolo (bière de mil) et des céréales depuis plus de 07ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son village.
Elle veut s’acheter 01 sac de mil germé et une charrette de bois de chauffe.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut renforcer son activité. Elle ambitionne devenir une grande dolotière.
texts.en:
Evelyne is the person responsible for the Nongtaaba de Bingo Group. She is a married mother to five children, the eldest of whom is 25 years old and the youngest is 13. Four of them currently attend school. She has six people living under her care.

She has been making and selling dolo (millet beer) and grains for over seven years. She get her supplies at the village market and wants to purchase one bag of sprouted millet and one cartful of firewood. With these profits, she wants to strengthen her business. Her ambition is to become a successful dolo vendor.

loans.use: to purchase one bag of sprouted millet and one cartful of firewood

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Boniaba habite dans une commune  rurale du Mali, c’est elle qui tient la charrue en main.
Elle n’a pas été à l’école à cause  des travaux de sa maman. Boniaba est  malienne, âgée  de 50 ans, mariée, son mari est un cultivateur, mère  de  7 enfants  4 garçons et 3 filles dont tous sont scolarisés.
Les rêves  et les espoirs de Boniaba sont : acheter les matériels de culture, les animaux, satisfait les enfants pour qu’ils puissent étudiés  à l’aise.
.Elle fait recourt au RMCR à cause de la pauvreté. Elle s’approvisionne dans les différents marchés et revend dans ces mêmes marchés.
Boniaba cultive les champs d’arachides pendant l’hivernage et la saison sèche elle faite l’élevage pour aider son mari à nourrir la famille. Elle sème parfois 100 kg de semence d’arachide s’il pleut comme il faut elle recevra 700 kg  d’arachide.
Elle a commencé cette activité depuis son enfance. Avec ce prêt elle achètera la semence d’arachide pour cultiver  et des béliers en les engraissant. Souvent la sécheresse est un problème au quel elle est confronté.
texts.en:
Boniaba lives in a rural commune in Mali. She is the woman holding the plough in the photo. She didn't have the chance to go to school because of her mother's work. Boniaba is a 50-year-old married mother to seven children, four boys and three girls, all of whom are currently receiving an education. Her husband earns a living as a farmer.

Boniaba's hopes and dreams are to purchase farming equipment and livestock, as well as to meet her children's needs so they can continue their studies. She is turning to RMCR due to her poverty. She gets her supplies from different markets and then sells her produce at these same markets. Boniaba grows peanuts during the winter season, then during the dry season she raises livestock in order to assist her husband feed their family. She often sows 100 kg of peanut seeds and if it rains, she should be able to harvest around 700 kg of peanuts.

She has been doing this work since she was a child. With this loan, she will purchase peanut seeds for harvest and rams for rearing. Droughts are a common problem she is often faced with.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for their fields, as well as rams

loans.name: Bina

texts.en:
Bina is a 43-year-old entrepreneur, who lives with her husband and two sons in Falakata. Her husband works as a laborer on a daily wages basis. Her sons are engaged with electrical and carpentry work respectively. Bina is engaged with animal husbandry. 

Bina rears cows and sells the milk in her neighborhood. She also sells cow dung for additional income which is widely used as farm manure in her locality. 

Bina plans to develop her milk business by buying an extra cow. The extra milk from the cow will bring in an extra income per month. It will be a key step towards Bina's goal of earning more, saving better, and achieving the financial independence to provide a good future for her family. So she is seeking a loan to buy the cow. 

She appreciates her lenders' support.

loans.use: To buy a cow for her milk supplying business.

loans.name: Swapna

texts.en:
Swapna is a 43-year-old rural woman. She is illiterate and can sign her name only. She lives with her husband and two children (one son and daughter) in the small town of Falakata. Her daughter has got married and son is a student in a higher secondary grade.

Swapna's husband is a carpenter by profession but his income is very irregular. Swapna sells betel nuts to give her family additional support. Betel nut is a kind of mouth freshener that is used by the local people. She knows that the villagers are fond of betel leaves (taken with betel nuts) after their laborious work. So, there is a huge demand for betel nuts in her locality. As they have no betel nut trees she has to purchase raw betel nuts from the wholesale market and after removing the shells she cuts the sun dried betel nuts into small pieces to sell in the local market shops and nearby pan stalls.

Swapna is a hardworking entrepreneur who is always concerned with her family’s well-being. So, she is seeking a loan from BJS, a Kiva partner, to purchase more raw betel nuts in bulk. 

Her dream is to enhance the business and make more income that will enable her to provide a better education to her son. In the future she dreams of constructing a concrete house for them. Swapna is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw betel nuts in a bulk for her existing business.

loans.name: Rumpi

texts.en:
Rumpi is a 25-year-old young married woman. She is from Masala Patti village in Falakata, Alipurduar district. She lives there with her husband and a son. Rumpi and her husband ended their education at grade 9 and grade 8 respectively. Their little son is in grade 1 in the local school.

Her husband is a driver by profession. Being a hardworking lady, Rumpi helps her husband financially by running a humble grocery shop, after managing her household work. She sells food items like spices, rice, pulses, sugar, salt, oil, bread, eggs, biscuits etc. and daily essential commodities. Now she wants to grow her business to satisfy the demand of her customers. Thus Rumpi is taking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase more varieties of grocery items in a bulk to increase the stock of her grocery shop.

With the expansion of her business she hopes to have a better income which will help her to develop the financial condition of her family. She wants to save the profit for her child’s future and to restock her grocery shop with a variety of items.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Arati

texts.en:
Arati is a 48-year-old married woman. Her small family comprises her husband Nikhil and two children (one son and one daughter). Her daughter is married and her son is involved in a fast food business. She lives with them in a small village in Falakata of West Bengal. 

Her husband is involved in an agribusiness. Arati helps her husband in his farming activities. They grow different seasonal vegetables and crops on their farmland and sell them at the market. Now Arati decided to grow pointed gourd, as it is in huge demand in summer in West Bengal. 

Thus Arati is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s field partner) to buy better quality seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She wants to improve her standard of living, for which she is ready to work hard. With the profit money she wants to fulfill her dream of constructing a concrete house for them.

Arati is very happy with this loan and grateful to Kiva for this kind support.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other necessary resources for pointed gourd cultivation.

loans.name: Kalita

texts.en:
33-year-old Kalita is from Falakata. She is married with two sons. One of them is in grade 9 and the other one is in grade 7. Kalita works as a cook for additional income. She also looks after her child, does all the household work and in her spare time helps her husband in his agricultural activity work. 

Kalita’s husband is a farmer. He grows different types of vegetables and crops, mainly paddy on his farmland. He struggles hard to grow good quality products. He is a person who is looking after his family's well-being. Moreover he fights for his sons and wife in order to provide them with a good lifestyle. He wants to grow more paddy in order to earn more profits. 

So as a responsible wife, Kalita requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy good quality seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides for paddy cultivation. She believes that the loan will help them to provide all farming needs and obtain good revenues. Thus her husband will be able to ensure the financial stability of his family. Kalita wants to upgrade their agribusiness with the outcome profit generated from the business. 

She is thankful to her lenders BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase necessary farm supplies for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Songrebeyoodo Group

texts.fr:
Mme PASCALINE est responsable du groupe  SONGREBEYOODO. Mariée elle est mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé à 18 ans et le moins âgé a 09 mois. 02 enfants vont à l’école et elle à 07 personnes en charge.
Madame fait le commerce de chaussures et de sacs à main depuis 13 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans  les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle veut s’acheter 04 douzaines de chaussures et 06 sacs à main.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour agrandir son activité. Elle compte aussi payer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: Mrs PASCALINE is the group leader for SONGREBEYOODO group. She is the married mother of 3 children. The eldest is 18 years old and the youngest is 9 months old. 2 of the children go to school, and she takes care of 7 persons. Mrs PASCALINE has engaged in the trade of shoes and handbags for 13 years. She gets her supplies in the surrounding markets. With the money from the loan, she wants to purchase 4 dozen pairs of shoes and 6 handbags. She intends to use the profits of the loan to expand her activity. She also intends to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy shoes and handbags.

loans.name: Mujeres De Palabra Group

texts.es: Magali de 25 años de edad es separada y tiene 02 hijos. Ella Pertenece a la Alcancía Comunal “Mujeres de Palabra”  la cual lo conforman 05 socias con deseos de  trabajar honradamente. Magali  hace más de 1 año y medio  que se dedica a la venta de zapatos. Gracias a su constante dedicación Magali puede cubrir con los gastos del hogar.  Su mayor deseo es de tener su propio local .Solicitó el crédito para la compra de más zapatos. La Alcancía “Mujeres de Palabra” agradece a los Inversionistas Kiva por el apoyo brindado. Magali es la segunda del lado izquierdo, viste chompa color negro y pantalón negro.
texts.en:
Magali is 25 years old, separated, and has 2 children.  She belongs to the Community Group "Mujeres de Palabra" which is formed by 5 members who want to work honorably.  Magali has a year and a half experience selling shoes.  Thanks to her constant dedication Magali is able to cover the household costs.  Her greatest wish is to have her own store.  She requested the loan to buy more shoes.  

The group "Mujeres de Palabra" thanks the Kiva investors for the help they have provided. Magali is the second on the left, in a black sweater and black pants.

loans.use: to buy more shoes.

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.en:
Jumagul is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1965 and is living in a remote district with her family. She is married and has five children. Her husband is an emigrant. For more than 20 years she has been busy in agriculture keeping livestock. When she got married, her husband’s family was very poor. She is a bright and goal oriented woman who decided to improve the standard of living of her family. 

She took a loan from her neighbors and bought livestock for keeping and selling. After some years she returned the loan. She achieved her goal and now she has four heads of livestock. As she has been unwell, he appealed to IMON asking a loan to be treated at hospital. Her husband tries to help and support her in doing business and feeding their family. She knows that her husband will support her in any case. She hopes to be healthy again and continue her business.

loans.use: to be treated at hospital

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
Gulchehra is a careful mother. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1971 and is living in a small town with her family. She is married and has two children. In 1992 she graduated in Technology Technique with the major of an accountant. She has experience of working as an accountant at an  educational government agency from 1994 to 1997. Since 1997, she works as the head of Finance Department. She is an honest, bright and gentle person. 

She wants to educate her children. She is requesting financial support for her child’s tuition fee. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her child’s tuition fee

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more stocks such as noodles, eggs, rice and kerosene.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stocks of goods and products, such as cooking fat for sale to clients and meet client needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing his crops so as to get a better harvest and meet client needs.

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en: Kiran is a 35-year-old married woman. A year ago she started a business selling cloth in her locality. She purchases cloth of different varieties at low prices from the city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. Currently, Kiran has requested a Murabaha of 40,000 Pakistan rupees (PKR). She wants to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan. She is shown in the photo with her husband.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en:
Abigail is a 35-year-old married woman with one dependent child. She owns and operates a wax-prints, material and lace business. She has been doing this for five years. 

Abigail needs a loan to buy wax-prints, material and lace, and sell to customers. She hopes to use her profits to invest back into the business and help pay for her child's education. She became a member of ID-Ghana in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: To buy wax-prints, material and lace and sell to customers.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a 43-year-old married woman, with five children. She has been running a business of animal sales and purchasing for many years along with her husband who is also shown in the photo. She looks after the animals and is responsible for feeding them, while her husband sells them to different markets in the city. Her business is providing her with enough income to support her family. 

However, she needs to earn much more to meet her children's expenditures. For this reason she has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to buy more baby goats and calves for resale purposes, to bear her children’s expenses efficiently.

loans.use: to buy more baby goats and calves for resale purposes to bear her children’s expenses efficiently.

loans.name: Kereni

texts.en: Keren who lives in Bundibugyo-Uganda is a hardworking woman dealing in cocoa buying and selling. She got involved in the businesses to earn income to meet increasing family demands. She has a cocoa garden where she gets additional income. She is challenged by bad weather and limited capital that hinders expansion of her cocoa business.  Keren has requested for a loan to buy more cocoa for selling.

loans.use: to buy cocoa for selling.

loans.name: Markus

texts.en: Markus is a Babban Gona farmer from Kunda Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Markus no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to provide health care for his familyand children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see him increase his income considerably.  This season Markus has ambitious plans to harvest  56  bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Markus now has the opportunity to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Ingrid Magaly

texts.es:
Ingrid es una universitaria de 38 años. Actualmente se encuentra cursando el décimo ciclo de la carrera de Contabilidad. Ella es una mujer que ante tantos obstáculos en la vida a persistido en alcanzar sus metas. Ademas de ser una universitaria dedicada a la vez en sus ratos libres a dictar clases. Ella solicito el préstamo para poder pagar sus pensiones de estudios, ya se encuentra a medio año de terminar su carrera.
Se siente agradecida con las personas que le ayudaron a logras sus metas.
texts.en: Ingrid is a 38 year old university student.  She is currently in the 10th cycle of the accounting career.  She is a person who has faced many obstacles in life and has persevered to reach her goals.  Apart from being a university student she teaches class in her free time.  She is requesting a loan to make the payments for her studies, as she is half a year away from finishing her degree.  She feels grateful to the people who have helped her reach her goals.

loans.use: to make payments for higher education.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is 30 years old and married with two children, one child is still in school, Ana Marie works very hard to provide for them.

Ana Marie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, drinks milk, coffee, spices etc.

Ana Marie has been in this business for 1 year. 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, drinks milk, coffee, spices etc

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 43 years old, married with four children.

Alma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, milk, coffee, drinks etc.

Alma has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from poultry.

Alma aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, milk, coffee, drinks etc

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She has a home product retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more plastic-wares and home products to offer for sale.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like a restaurant business.

Analyn dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college

loans.use: to buy more plastic-wares and home products to offer for sale.

loans.name: Arcelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Arcelita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs and buy and sell recycled materials. Arcelita is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell for her buy and sell banana business.

Arcelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion is 64 years old, married and has four children.

Asuncion is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Asuncion requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Asuncion has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia is 47 years old and has four children. Clemencia is married and has two children who are still in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Clemencia requested a PHP16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Clemencia has been in this business for nine years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Joachim

texts.en: Joachim is married and living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a farmer who mainly grows cocoa. Besides that he decided to start a shop selling phone spares and phone accessories to meet his family's basic needs. He used the first loan to buy phone spare parts to sell. His dream is expanding his business to a big selling center, but competition and insufficient funds hinder his progress. He is a very hardworking man who requests a loan to buy more phone spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy more phone spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is 39 years old and a Teshie resident. She is an enterprising and active young woman. Patience earns her living by working by distributing at her residence. She buys and distributes saucepans, cooking utensils, plastic tables and chairs. This business allows her to generate sufficient income so that she can sustain herself and children. 

With the intent of strengthening her business and fulfilling her dream of expansion, Patience is requesting support with this loan so that she can buy inventory in bulk.  As a result, she will be able to offer her customers good service, as well as satisfy their needs and tastes. With this loan she will notice an improvement in her income, which would allow her family to enjoy a better quality of life over time.

loans.use: To buy and distribute saucepans, cooking utensils, plastic tables and chairs for her customers.

loans.name: Maryamu	Samaila

texts.en: Maryamu Samaila is a Babban Gona maize farmer from  Kunda Village. Maryamu Samaila  joined Babban Gona to expand her farm and grow her agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Maryam Samaila will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see her increase her household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Maryamu Samaila now has the opportunity to increase her yields and income and use her extra earnings to diversify her farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her maize yields

loans.name: Yohanna

texts.en: Yohanna is a Babban Gona maize farmer from  Bazai Village. Yohanna joined Babban Gona to improve the lives of his family and children. Since joining Babban Gona, he no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to repair his house. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Yohanna will have access to high quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. This year, Yohanna has set high goals of harvesting 70 bags of maize. With increased yields and incomes, Yohanna has made it his ultimate goal to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Bellafonte

texts.en:
Bellafonte is 20 years old and he supports 5 family members. 

He has been a farmer for the last 1 year and the business earns him KES 11,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing his crops so as to get a better harvest and meet client needs.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children. 

His hope is to be financially stable and expand his agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing his crops so as to get a better harvest and meet client needs.

loans.name: Neris Alcides

texts.es:
Neris, tiene su propio negocio de cultivo de granos básicos, crianza de ganado y aves de corral, las tareas agrícolas las realiza con apoyo de su hermano, el oficio lo heredo de su papá. Es una persona soltera, vive con su madre y sus hermanos, los ingresos que genera son de mucha utilidad para cubrir sus gastos personales y ser un apoyo económico para su familia.
Sus deseos de superación hacen que opte por solicitar un crédito para comprar abono, semilla y herbicidas, con los que podrá efectuar la siembra de granos básicos, de esta manera espera lograr tener cosechas más abundantes y de calidad.
Sus aspiraciones son tener estabilidad económica para continuar apoyando a su familia para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Neris has his own business cultivating basic grains, and raising livestock and poultry. He counts with the help of his brother for this work. The trade, he inherited from his father.

He is single and lives with his mother and siblings. The income from his work is of great help to cover his personal needs and to give his family financial support.

Looking to improve the business, Neris is applying for a loan to buy compost,  seeds, and herbicides for his basic grain crops, in order to obtain more abundant and high quality harvests.

His goal is to achieve economic stability and continue supporting the family to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy compost, seeds, and herbicides that he will use to plant basic grains.

loans.name: Vigie

texts.en:
Vigie is 53 years old and married with two children.  With one child in school, Vigie works very hard to provide for them.

Vigie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Vigie has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned good and other groceries. 

In the future Vigie would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell

loans.name: Clair

texts.en:
Clair is 33 years old and married with seven children.

She runs an agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Clair is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Clair has been in this business for 3 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Felix

texts.en: Felix is 55 years old and he is living in his own house.  Felix is still working as a public employee and this time he needs a loan to build a room at his house. As you can see the place in the picture is very humble.  Felix needs all the help he can get because he wants to improve his life quality and there is nobody that can help him.  Felix is healthy

loans.use: to add a room at his house

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan  is a Babban Gona farmer from Dankwaire Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realize better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, he no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to provide healthcare for his family and children. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see him increase his income considerably.  This season Hassan has ambitious plans to harvest 50 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Hassan now has the opportunity to diversify his farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs

loans.name: Enock

texts.en:
Enock is 37 years old, married to Margret and supports a family of 5 children. 

He has been operating in motorcycle transport for the last 2 years earning KES 7,000 per month. 

Enock has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk with his motorcycle for more income gain. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to open a retail shop in the area. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk with his motorcycle

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a hardworking female entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like snack foods, canned goods, school supplies, and other personal care products.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs and selling rice. 

Rosita dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money in order to support the financial stability of her family

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, canned goods, school supplies, and other personal care products.

loans.name: Leontine

texts.en: Leontine is 38 years old. She is married and has three children between the ages of 5 and 12. They all go to school. She sells minerals and has been in this business for the past two years. Her husband is a teacher. With the loan, she would like to buy more coalmine for mining. The profits from the business will be used to make savings and to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more coalmine for mining

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es: Flor es una joven universitaria de 21 años. Actualmente se encuentra cursando el séptimo ciclo de la carrera de Farmacia. Ella decidió estudiar esta carrera porque le gusta ayudar a las personas enfermas o que requieran alguna ayuda. Ademas de ser una joven muy aplicada en sus ratos libres sale a jugar voley con sus amigas. Para obtener algún ingreso extra trabaja en el mercado vendiendo verduras. Ella solicito el préstamo para poder pagar sus pensiones de estudios. Se siente muy agradecida con las personas que le ayudan cada día a cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Flor is a young university student, 21 years old.  Currently she is working on her seventh semester in the Pharmacy degree program.  She decided to study this major because she likes to help people who are sick or who need some help.  In addition to being a very hardworking young woman, in her free moments she goes out to play volleyball with her friends.  

In order to earn a little extra income, she works in the market selling vegetables.  She asked for this loan to be able to pay the fees for her studies.  She feels very thankful to the people who are helping her to achieve her goals each day.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Diosa

texts.en:
Diosa is 39 years old, married, and has six children.

She runs an agricultural business fattening pigs in the Philippines. Diosa is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Diosa has been in this business for two years and also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Purabi

texts.en:
Purabi is a 28-year-old, young, rural woman. She lives with her husband and two children in Falakata. She studied till grade 8. Their children are too small to go to school.

Purabi's husband is engaged with a betel nut business. Purabi also assists her husband in this business. Betel nut is a kind of mouth freshener that is used by the local people. They know that the villagers are fond of betel leaves (taken with betel nuts) after their laborious work. So, there is a huge demand for betel nuts in their locality. As they have no betel nut trees, they have to purchase raw betel nuts from the wholesale market, and after removing the shells, she cuts the sun-dried betel nuts into small pieces to sell in the local market shops and nearby stalls.

Purabi is a hardworking entrepreneur who is always concerned with her family’s well-being. So, to increase the family livelihood, Purabi is seeking a loan from BJS, a Kiva partner, to purchase raw betel nuts in bulk for sale. 

Her dream is to enhance the business and obtain more income that will enable her family to get ahead and will provide a better lifestyle to her family. It will enable her to earn a profit to a large extent. 

Purabi is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw betel nuts in bulk for the betel nut business.

loans.name: Anjana

texts.en:
Anjana is a very active lady of 33 years. She lives with her husband in a small village in Falakata, West Bengal. She had the opportunity to study till 10th grade in her young age. Now she is a homemaker. She has one son studying in grade 1. 

To make a living for the family, Anjana's husband has been farming paddy (rice) and other vegetables on their own plot of land. He has been doing this for many years. Anjana also helps her husband in agricultural work after managing her household jobs. They sell the harvested products from their agribusiness to the local markets. This agribusiness supplies them with the necessary finances to provide themselves with clothing, food, medicine, etc. 

Now they want to expand their business by cultivating more paddies. Being a staple food of west Bengal, paddy is in great favor in their locality and is widely used in India. Anjana applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to purchase good quality seeds, fertilizers and agricultural inputs that will help her to have smooth cultivation of the crop.

Her goal is to continue increasing the cultivation of the product and strengthening her family's economy.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivating paddy (rice).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a mixer for baking bread.

loans.name: Bhago

texts.en:
Bhago is a 32-year-old, married woman from Falakata. She is a mother of two children who are both students. Bhago is illiterate and can sign her name only. She lives in a small village, Dakshin Parengerpar in Falakata, Alipurduar district.

She is a dedicated housewife, raising her children and taking care of her family. Her husband, Ramani Kanta, is engaged in agricultural activities. He cultivates potatoes, carrots, beans and gourds on his farmland and sells his produce in the local markets. However, a major part of the harvest is sold to the wholesale dealers in the market. 

Though Bhago is a housewife, she tries to help her husband in his farm work. Now with the growing costs of the family, they need to increase their harvest for more profit. So, they have decided to cultivate cucumber, a much demanded crop in the region.

Bhago has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to purchase cucumber seeds as well as chemical and organic fertilizers so that they have a good harvest this year. Her biggest dream is to buy more farmland to get more production. She would like to see her children get a proper education and grow into professionals in the future.

She is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for cucumber cultivation.

loans.name: Bijoya

texts.en:
Bijoya is a young woman of 24 years. She is married and lives in Dakshin Parengerpar village in Falakata. She is the mother of two children (one son and one daughter) and a responsible wife of Nripen. She lives with her family in their mud and straw made house. Unfortunately, for lack of economic resources, Bijoya attended school up to grade 6 only. 

Her husband is a driver; he carries people and goods from one place to another throughout the village. Due to his inconsistent income, Bijoya started dairy farming for additional income. She owns a dairy cow and sells milk in her neighborhood to help her husband financially. The couple works tirelessly from dawn to dusk, but their income is insufficient to cover the basic needs of the family. Bijoya wants to strengthen the family economy, so she has taken a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to purchase one more dairy cow to grow her dairy business. 

With this, she can start producing more milk, milk products and cow dung to sell and satisfy her customers. As there is a great demand for her milk in her rural area for family feeding, she hopes that she can ensure a financial stability to her family. Her dream is to buy more dairy cows in the future with the profit from her business.

She is thankful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her existing milk-selling business.

loans.name: Ujjbalarani

texts.en:
Ujjbalarani is a 46-year-old woman who lives in a remote village of Falakata in West Bengal. She is married to Kalidas. She has two daughters; both are married.

Ujjbalarani’s husband is an enterprising man who is engaged in a business of selling medicine from his house. Ujjbalarani also helps her husband in this business. Medicine has a very good demand in their area, as in their locality, medicine shops are very far away. They need to develop their stock of medicines, but they do not have sufficient capital to invest in their business. 

Ujjbalarani is requesting the loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to purchase medicines from the medicine wholesalers. She hopes this loan will give a boost to their business and attract more customers.

Her dream is to expand her business in order to strengthen the family's economy.

She is grateful to the lenders (and BJS and Kiva) for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more medicines for the business.

loans.name: Mamoni

texts.en:
Mamoni is a 24-year-old lady. She lives in a village of Falakata, West Bengal. She has two children (a son and a daughter). Her children are kids now. She belongs to a poor family. 

Mamoni's husband has been running a "kulfi" making and vending business for a few years. Kulfi is a popular frozen dairy desert in India. Kulfi has similarities with ice cream, but it is denser and creamier. The ingredients required are milk, sugar, cardamom, saffron, etc.  The boiled and thickened milk is poured into small molds after adding all the ingredients and is chilled in the refrigerator for hours to make kulfi. She and her husband manage the business. Her husband goes to a wholesale market to bring the stock of ingredients for making kulfi, and Mamoni prepares it. 

There is a lot of demand for their product in their locality, and in the summer season, the demand grows high. But due to lack of capital, they have a shortage of stock and so are unable to meet the customers’ demands. So, she has approached to BJS (Kiva's partner) for a loan to buy more stock of ingredients to increase their production level and make tasty kulfi to attract their customers. 

She hopes this loan will help them to increase their income to lead a secured life. She is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more necessary ingredients to enhance their kulfi (frozen dairy dessert) business.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia works hard to support her family. Emelia is married with two children and has a business buying and selling personal care products in the Philippines.

Emelia has requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional beauty products like beauty soap, body lotion, perfume and other personal care products to sell in her stall.

Emelia has been in this business for one year now, and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional beauty products like beauty soap, body lotion, perfume and other personal products to sell in her stall

loans.name: Parul

texts.en:
Parul is a very active lady of 24 years. She lives with her husband and two sons in the small village of Raychenga in Falakata. She had the opportunity to study till grade 5 in her childhood. Now she is a homemaker and raising her two kids.

To make a living for the family, Parul's husband has been farming different vegetables on their own plot of land. He is the only breadwinner for the family. Though Parul is a housewife, she tries to help her husband in his farm work. Together, the couple has been working hard, since this is their sole source of income. They have been selling the produce in the local town market. 

Now they want to expand their business by cultivating paddies (rice) as paddy is a staple of the region, and the demand for it has always been good. So Parul has taken a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to purchase good quality paddy seeds, fertilizers and other agricultural inputs. Parul expects a good harvest in this year with the help of this loan. 

Her goal is to strengthen her family's economy and save money for the future to expand her business.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other necessary farm resources for cultivating paddies (rice).

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Tawakiri Village. Haruna joined Babban Gona to improve the lives of his family and children. Since joining Babban Gona, he no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to repair his house. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Haruna will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the national average of 14 bags per hectare. This year, Haruna has set high goals of harvesting 50 bags of maize. 

With increased yields and incomes, Haruna has made it his ultimate goal to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm's yields

loans.name: Shikha

texts.en:
Shikha is a 29-year-old lady who lives in Harinathpur in Falakata of West Bengal. Her family consists of her husband and two children (one son and one daughter). Her son reads in the local village school, and her daughter got married. 

Shikha is a housewife, and her husband is associated with a wood business. He purchases timber from the villagers, cuts it into pieces and resells it to the retail customers and different furniture shops. Shikha also helps her husband in this business after managing her household work. Their major problem is the lack of capital, as the prices of wood are increasing day by day.

Shikha applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to invest in their business. She plans to utilize the loan to buy more timber from the villagers to resell.  She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her family's living conditions. In the future, she plans to expand her business and construct a concrete house.

She thanks her lenders (and BJS and Kiva) for their support.

loans.use: to purchase more timber for the existing wood business.

loans.name: Tinku

texts.en:
Tinku is a 43-year-old, rural housewife who lives at Raychenga village in Falakata. She lives there with her husband and a son who is a student of graduation grade. She attended school till grade 5 in her childhood. 

Tinku’s husband, Shyamal, makes wooden furniture such as beds, chairs, shelves, tables, wardrobes, etc., as per customers' orders. In order to construct the furniture, he requires materials such as logs of wood, nails, paint and good modern tools. So Tinku wants to invest money to buy all the required materials of good quality for increasing the rate of production and making the products more attractive for sale. The family’s income depends on this business, as this is the only source of income to earn a livelihood. 

With the aim to improve the business, Tinku applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy good quality wood and necessary modern tools for manufacturing modern furniture, which will attract more customers. 

Tinku hopes that the loan amount will allow her to supply more beautifully designed furniture on time as per the orders. She also hopes that this business will generate more income to offer them a better quality of life and good educational opportunities for her son. 

Tinku is grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase wood and necessary materials for the furniture manufacturing business.

loans.name: Mwambisi Group

texts.en:
Zena, who is in her mid 30s is married with two children, one is still in school and the other one is still small.  She has been selling fruits and vegetable for seven years now.  She works from 6am to 10pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Zena's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to increase on the genge stock and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loan and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in her genge store. She dreams of building her own house.

Zena will share this loan with her loan group MWAMBISI which consist of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in her genge store.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Dolores works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs. Dolores is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell for her charcoal retailing business.

Dolores has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Obra Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Obra and they are beginning their first loan cycle with ID-Ghana. The group is composed of two members and is represented by Florence. The businesses that the members have are foodstuff, beans, bread and second hand clothing. The loan that they will take out will benefit these micro-entrepreneurs, of whom Florence (standing in the middle of the photo) is one. She says that she joined ID-Ghana a years ago. She joined at the invitation of a friend from the institution, who came to visit her in her home. She now has a business selling onion, pepper, fish, spices, tomatoes. She lets it be known that she learned this business from her mother, and when she grew up, she decided to set up an independent business. 

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital to buy onion, pepper, fish, spices, tomatoes and sell to customers. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family. When she was asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she responded that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: To buy onion, pepper, fish, spices, tomatoes and sell to customers.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is a 34-year-old, hardworking woman who has four children. Her husband is also shown in the photo. For the last two years, she has been providing the service of sewing clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. Shameem’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. 

Currently, she has availed a Murabaha loan of 15,000 PKR to purchase a new sewing machine with some spools of threads and laces. She dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine with some spools of threads and laces.

loans.name: Pramila

texts.en:
Pramila is a hardworking woman of 45 years from Falakata. She is married and a mother of two children (a son and a daughter). Her children are in different grades. Pramila studied till grade 4. They live in a small village called Mill Road in the district of Alipurduar, West Bengal, India.

Pramila's husband, Jatish, pulls a tractor on farmland. For additional income, Pramila deals with betel nuts (a kind of mouth freshener used in rural areas of India). As they have no betel nut trees, she has to purchase raw betel nuts from her own villagers and from the neighboring villages. Then, removing the shells, she cuts the sun-dried betel nuts into small pieces for selling to the retailers. She wants to give her family financial stability; that is why she needs capital to expand her existing business.

Thus, Pramila applied for a loan from Kiva's field partner BJS to purchase more raw betel nuts. 

Her dream is to enhance the business for better income that will enable her family to get ahead and provide good education to her children so that they can be established in the future. 

She is grateful to both Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: to purchase raw betel nuts in bulk to expand her betel nut business.

loans.name: Prospero Javier

texts.es: Prospero de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, él se dedica cultivo de granos básicos (maíz y maicillo) desde hace 7 años, su esposa le ayuda en el trabajo, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono, herbicida, insecticidas, semillas, etc. y así poder tener un buen cultivo y seguir con sus ventas que le generan buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Prospero, 32, lives with his wife and four children in a house that they own.  He has operated a farm, growing maize and maicillo, for 7 years.  His wife helps him with the work and he sells what he harvests to buyers in the area.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to buy the supplies he needs--fertilizers, insecticides, seeds, etc.--to carry on the business.  The investment will allow him to maximize his yields and his income.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en:
Jameela is a 45-year-old married woman. She is shown in the photo with her husband. 2 years ago she started a business selling cloth in her locality. She purchases cloth of different varieties at low prices from the city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base.

 Currently, Jameela has requested a Murabaha of 35,000 Pakistan rupees (PKR). She wants to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan.

loans.name: Sonali

texts.en:
Sonali is 33-year-old lady, who lives with her husband and one son in a small village in Falakata, West Bengal. Her son is in grade 12. Sonali’s husband has a small watch repairing shop, but his income his inadequate to bear all household expenses as well the educational cost of their son. 

Sonali is an enterprising lady. She runs a clothing business to provide uninterrupted education to her son. She purchases new clothing stocks according to the seasonal demand from wholesale market and resells it in their village. Now she wants to buy new stocks of clothing for her business, but she has a lack of capital to invest in her business. 

Thus Sonali requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy more stocks of clothing to meet the demand of her customers. She is hopeful that she will get a good market in their locality which will enable her to get good profit.

Sonali wishes for a bright future for her son and wants to save money for him. She is very thankful to Kiva and their field partner, BJS.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of clothing for her business.

loans.name: Emethelyn

texts.en:
Emethelyn is 43 years old and married with three children. With two children still in school, Emethelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Emethelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil and etc.

Emethelyn has been in this business for 5 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil.

loans.name: Engelina

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Engelina works hard to support her family.

She has a business raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Engelina is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Engelina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Arabela

texts.en:
Arabela is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is now borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings from her general store business.

Arabela dreams that one day, she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Erlina

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Erlina works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell fruits business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Erlina is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to  buy more fruits like mango, water melon, banana and other fruits to sell in her food stall.

Erlina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits like mango, water melon, banana and other fruits to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jenny is 36 years old and has two children are currently in school.

Jenny has a manufacturing furniture business in the Philippines. Jenny requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional wood, plastic varnish, latches and other material for her business.

Jenny has been in this business for 8 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional wood, plastic varnish, latches and other material for her business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman, 58 years old with five children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. 

Jocelyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in the market.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 1 year. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 25 years old and married with two children, two children presently in school, Jonalyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jonalyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, milk, coffee, drinks, noodles etc.

Jonalyn has been in this business for 2 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, milk, coffee, drinks, noodles etc

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven  children, Emelia works hard to support her family.

She has a firewood retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from recycled materials. Emelia is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of firewood to sell.

Emelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo, vive con su grupo familiar compuesto por su esposa y tres hijos con edades de 19, 17 y 12 años, toda la familia es dependiente de don Pablo; se dedica a la siembra de loroco tecnificado, maíz y frijol, trabaja de lunes a sábado y lo práctica desde hace 18 años.
Tiene programado utilizar el crédito en la compra de insumos agrícolas, semilla de loroco, maíz y frijol para poder sembrar en el tiempo justo, la finalidad de la inversión es tener un área de siembra mucho más grande y obtener cosechas más abundantes, de esta manera podrá atender a nuevos clientes.
Los sueños que desea ver hechos realidad son que sus hijos sean profesiones y tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Pablo lives with his family—his wife and three children, ages 19, 17 and 12. The whole family is dependent on Pablo; he makes his living growing corn, beans, and hybrid loroco [an edible flower native to Central America]. He works Monday through Saturday and has been doing this for 18 years.
He plans to use the loan to buy agricultural supplies, loroco seed, corn, and beans in order to plant at the right time. The goal of the investment is to have a much larger growing area and get higher yields, so that he can serve new customers.
The dreams that he would like to see come true are for his children to become professionals and have a better future.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, loroco seed, corn, and beans in order to plant at the right time.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is 22 years old, married with three children.

Karen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drink, bread, spices, cooking oil, juice etc.

Karen has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from raising pig.

Karen aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drink, bread, spices, cooking oil, juice etc

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita is 52 years old and married with one child.

Marianita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drink, bread, spices, cooking oil, juice etc.

Marianita has been in this business for 25 years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drink, bread, spices, cooking oil, juice etc

loans.name: Jose Dolores

texts.es:
José, de 33 años de edad, nunca tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, ya que su papá murió cuando el tenia 8 años de edad, está acompañado, su pareja le ayuda a sembrar maíz y tiene 2 hijos.

José, se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenia 10 años de edad, este oficio lo aprendió gracias a sus vecinos, que al ver la necesidad que ellos vivían, los comenzaron a llevar a trabajar y fue así como aprendió todo lo que sabe,; a José, también le gusta la crianza de ganado, de esta manera ayudo a su mamá a sacar adelante a su familia.- Hoy en día siembra maíz, pipían y maicillo y para llegar hasta donde tiene sus cultivos camina 1 kilómetro, su día comienza a las 4:00 a.m. por que tiene que llevar su ganado al potrero y luego trabajar en su cultivo de 6:00 a.m. hasta 11:00 a.m.

El crédito sera invertido para comprar semilla, abono, pesticidas y una yunta de toros.

Su sueño es, que sus hijos se preparen academicamente para que tengan mejores oportunidades; tambien sueña con construir una casa de ladrillo, porque donde actualmente viven es de barro.
texts.en:
José is 33 years old and never had the opportunity to study as his father died when he was 8 years old. He is in a relationship and has two children. His wife helps him with growing corn.

José has worked in agriculture since he was 10 years old. He learned this work from his neighbors. As his family had to survive he went to work and this was how he learned all that he knows. José also liked to raise cattle and in this way helped his mother get his family ahead.

Today he grows corn, squash and sorghum and to get to where he plants he walks one km. His day begins at 4 am as he has to take the cattle to pasture and works his crops from 6 am until 11 am. The loan will be invested in buying seed, manure, pesticide and a pair of bulls. His dream is for his children to study so that they have better opportunities. He also dreams of building a brick house as where they actually live is made of adobe.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, pesticides and a pair of bulls.

loans.name: Saraswati

texts.en:
Saraswati is 45 years old, married and is blessed with two children (one son and one daughter).  She and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names. Their son works as a daily laborer and their daughter is married. They live in their own small house in Falakata.

Saraswati's husband is a cycle van puller by profession. His inconsistent income is insufficient to cover all the family's household expenses. Saraswati is a responsible and hardworking woman. To help her husband in running the family smoothly, she is engaged with a milk selling business. She rears cows and sells milk to her neighbors. She has attained a good number of customers. Now she wants to purchase one more cow to satisfy her customers' demands. 

She heard that Kiva’s partner, BJS give business loans to rural women. She has asked for a loan with the aim of further developing her business by buying one more cow. She hopes that now her business will help her to generate more income to give financial sustenance to her family. In the future she wants to purchase a cycle van for her husband. 

She gives hearty thanks to her lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to grow her existing dairy business.

loans.name: Phuli

texts.en:
36-year-old Phuli is a rural woman from a small village in Falakata. Her family consists of four members. Her husband Dulal is a tailor by profession and she takes care of her own animal husbandry. She is a loving mother of two sons who are students of grade 7 and 9 respectively.
 
Phuli rears dairy cow to sell milk in her local area and to her neighbors. She helps her husband to earn their livelihood. Together the couple’s income is not sufficient to meet the family’s household expenses along with their children’s education costs. 

So Phuli wants to buy a dairy cow to sell more milk for her family’s financial improvement. She hopes to sell cow dung also in her local area because the rural people use it as fuel for cooking. That is why she requested a loan to Kiva’s partner, BJS. 

She hopes the profit level will increase and that her family will have a financial stability. In the future she dreams of buying more dairy cows with her profit and enhancing her business.

Phuli conveys her gratitude to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her milk selling business.

loans.name: Bendicion De Dios Group

texts.es:
La Asociación comunal Bendición de Dios, está conformada por diez integrantes nueve mujeres y un hombre, padres de familias responsables de quince hijos, menores de edad, los cuales dependen cien por ciento de ellos, son originarios del sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región, se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar, para ayudar con los gastos económicos de su familia.
Actualmente la coordinadora es Heydis y tiene por actividad económica la venta de cosmético por catálogo de algunas casas comerciales, el negocio lo desempeña de forma ambulante y por encargo en su casa de habitación. Tiene cinco años de dedicarse a dicha actividad,  su rutina de trabajo es de unas ochos horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra de cosmético para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, y aumentar su clientela, los productos que venden son: perfumes, body, cremas, tratamiento de cabello, labiales, delineadores, máscaras, rubor, vanidades, etc. La asociación comunal Bendición de Dios agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos  y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Bendición de Dios community bank, nine women and one man, are parents to fifteen young children.  The members live in El Sauce, a town in northern Nicaragua.  The members are hard-working and responsible, determined to overcome the obstacles they face.  None were able to finish school because their families couldn't afford for them to go on studying and all went to work very young to help support their families.  
Heydis is the leader of the group now.  She has operated a cosmetics sales business for 5 years.  She works as a street vendor, going from block to block, selling her merchandise.  Other customers come to her house to buy from her.  She normally works 8 hours a day.  
Heydis is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her business with the products that her customers most want: perfumes, lotions, creams, hair treatments, lipstick, eye-liner, mascara, etc.  
The members of the Bendición de Dios community bank are grateful for the support that Kiva investors provide to them and to other small business owners with few resources of their own.  Your help for people in poor countries like Nicaragua give them a chance to make decent livings.

loans.use: to stock her cosmetics sales business.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 41 years old and married with three children.  With two children in school, Marites works very hard to provide for them.

Marites runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Marites has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Marites would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 35 years old and married with two children.

She runs an agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Maribel is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Maribel has been in this business for 10 years and also earns additional income from poultry.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 51 years old, married, and has three children.

She is in the agricultural business, doing poultry in the Philippines. Mary Ann requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase sacks of feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her chickens.

Mary Ann has been in this business for six years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her chickens

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Rosemarie works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending.  Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy an additional stock of groceries to sell in her general store business.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 31 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 46 years old, married with five children.
