Lucy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drink, bread, spices, cooking oil, juice etc.

Lucy has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from raising pig.

Lucy aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drink, bread, spices, cooking oil, juice etc

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 42 years old and has three children.  Maribel is married and has two children who are in school.

Maribel is in the agricultural business, pig fattening  in the Philippines. Maribel requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase sacks of feeds, vitamins, vaccine  and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Maribel has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of feeds, vitamins, vaccine  and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Mary Jane works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to  purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell in the market.

Mary Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Mary Joan

texts.en:
Mary Joan is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mary Joan is 47 years old and has one child still in school.

Mary Joan has a buy-and-sell beauty product business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional beauty products to sell like make-up, beauty soap, body lotion, perfume and other personal care products.

Mary Joan has been in this business for three years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional beauty products to sell like make-up, beauty soap, body lotion, perfume and other personal care products to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman, with 6 children. She operates a retail business where she sells cows and milk. She has been involved in this business for 5 years and her primary customers are locals. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more cows and animal feeds. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more cows and animal feeds so as to able to educate her children

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell for her general store business.

Ana Marie successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is relisting Ana Marie's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, snack foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: Hector de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace 25 años vende sus productos en los pueblos aledaños, con las ganancias que obtiene es como ha podido solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono, herbicida, insecticidas, semillas, controles de plagas, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Hector, 41, and his family live in a house that they own.  He has operated a farming business, growing maize, for 25 years.  He sells his crop to buyers in the area and his earnings cover the family's expenses.  Hector is applying for a loan that he will use to buy the supplies he needs--fertilizers, herbicides, insecticides, seeds, etc.--to carry on his business.  The investment will allow him to earn more from his next harvest.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Delia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane and fattening pigs. Delia is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell for her general store business.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rhorie

texts.en: Rhorie is 29 years old and married. She works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store for four years in the Philippines, and she also earns an income from farming rice and selling gasoline. Rhorie requested a 17,000 PHP loan through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF), to purchase more grocery items to sell. Rhorie has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. Rhorie aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 43 years old.  She is widowed and has two children.

Melanie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, etc.

Melanie has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from fishing.

Melanie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Norlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Norlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from general store.  Norlinda is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to  purchase more nipa to sell.

Norlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more nipa to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Rebecca works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell school supplies business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Rebecca is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to  purchase more stocks of school supplies like bags, notebooks, pencils, crayons and other school supplies to sell.

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of school supplies like bags, notebooks, pencils, crayons and other school supplies to sell

loans.name: Rocel

texts.en:
Rocel is 45 years old and widowed with three children, two children are presently in school, Rocel works very hard to provide for them.

Rocel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks etc.

Rocel has been in this business for 20 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks etc

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 42 years old and married with five children, three children are still in school, Teresa works very hard to provide for them.

Teresa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, spices etc.

Teresa has been in this business for 3 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, spices etc

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a hardworking man living in Masindi, Uganda. He runs a salon to generate income for his family's needs.Inadequate capital and seasonal customers are a challenge. He is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics and hair braids to sell in his salon. He desires to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and hair braids to sell in his salon.

loans.name: Verlita

texts.en:
Verlita is 50 years old and married with seven children.

She runs an agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Verlita is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Verlita has been in this business for 2 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 31 years old, married with two children.

Vivian works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks etc.

Vivian has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from buy and sell personal collection.

Vivian aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks etc

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 52 years old and has nine children. Yolanda is married and has four children are presently in school.

Yolanda is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Yolanda requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Yolanda has been in this business for 1 year now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is a hardworking married man with 9 children living in Masindi,Uganda. He deals in carpentry business where by he makes desks and beds among other items and does farming to supplement his incomes. He faces a challenge of seasonal market.However he hopes to diversify his business and start up a retail shop so as to have several sources of income. He is requesting for a loan to buy timber for his work shop.

loans.use: to buy timber for his work shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tables and chairs, meat, sausages, basic grains, and vegetables, etc

loans.name: Victor Misael

texts.es:
Víctor, es propietario de un taller de enderezado y pintura para vehículos, el cual atiende con un horario de siete de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde, lo fundo hace 12 años y lo aprendió con ayuda de familiares, no representa dificultades para desarrollar sus actividades debido a la experiencia que lo respalda, de esta manera tiene la oportunidad generar los ingresos con los que cubre los gastos familiares. Él es casado, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, la familia no tiene ayuda económica del extranjero.
Tiene la necesidad de capital de trabajo para comprar pinturas, lijas, un gato hidráulico, entre otras herramientas útiles para desarrollar sus actividades diarias, tendrá la oportunidad de darles a sus clientes un mejor servicio y tener un negocio más popular con el que pueda cambiar su situación financiera.
 Los objetivos que tiene en la vida don Víctor son reparar su vivienda, darles a sus hijos preparación académica y abrir un nuevo local de atención.
texts.en:
Victor has operated an auto repair and painting business for 12 years.  He was able to start the business with little trouble because he learned auto repair growing up and an auto repair business was an easy step for him.  He normally works from 7:00am to 4:00pm.  Victor is married and lives with his wife and children.  His earnings from the business cover the family's expenses and they have no outside sources of income.
Victor is applying for a loan that he will use to buy the tools and other supplies he needs--a hydraulic lift, paints, polishing supplies, etc.--to carry on his business.  The investment will allow him to deliver a better service to his customers and build the reputation of his business.  A better business will, in turn, lead to a stronger financial situation for his family.
For the future, Victor wants to make repairs to his house, see his children finish school and open a new workshop.

loans.use: to buy tools and other supplies for his auto repair business.

loans.name: Brenda Yamileth

texts.es: La vivienda en la que habita Brenda es muy humilde, y desde hace 5 años ha instalado en ella una tienda de productos básicos, la cual le permite sostener a su familia, por lo que siempre está buscando la manera de brindar lo mejor a sus clientes. Brenda cuenta con 21 años de edad y vive junto a su grupo familiar, como son su abuelo, sus padres y sus 3 hermanos a los que apoya con los gastos del hogar. Brenda desea invertir en su tienda, ya que cada día sus clientes solicitan una mayor variedad de productos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: bebidas frías, lácteos, embutidos, granos básicos, entre otros productos para surtir su tienda.
texts.en: Brenda, 21, started a retail business five years ago in a space in the small house that she shares with her grandfather, her parents and her 3 siblings.  Brenda's earnings from the business help to support her family and she is always looking for ways to attract more customers.  She is applying for a FUSAI loan that she will use to stock a wider range of merchandise: grains, canned goods, dairy products, cold drinks and other merchandise that her customers often ask for.

loans.use: to stock her retail business.

loans.name: Rosfel

texts.en:
Rosfel is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosfel is 42 years old and has three children are currently in school.

Rosfel has a t-shirt printing business in the Philippines. Rosfel requested a PHP 17000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials like ink, t-shirts and maintenance for her machine.

Rosfel has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials like ink, t-shirts and maintenance for her machine

loans.name: Maurita

texts.en: Maurita is 65 years old, married and has five children. For 20 years, she has farmed rice in the Philippines. Maurita requested a 17,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase sacks of fertilizer and other farm supplies. She has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a hardworking married man with six children.  Their ages are 7-17, and all are able to acquire an education. He does a produce business so as to take care of the family.  Due to low earnings, he built houses for rent to generate more income. 

He desires to educate his children, though the price fluctuation of produce and seasonality changes are challenges he still faces. He wants a loan to buy produce, like maize, to sell.

loans.use: to buy produce, like maize, to sell.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 53 years old and widowed.  She has three children.  She runs an agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Melinda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Melinda has been in this business for two years and also earns additional income from food vending.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Sylvia works hard to support her family.  She has a purified drinking water retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from poultry.  Sylvia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of purified drinking water to sell to customers.

Sylvia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of purified drinking water to sell.

loans.name: Sulait

texts.en:
Sulait is 37 years old, married, and has four children. He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He operates a butcher shop, which is his major source of income. He earns additional income from a cocoa garden. 

Sulait is a hardworking man who looks after his family very well and pays school fees for all his children. His challenge is limited capital. He used his previous loan to buy goats for butchering and now is requesting another loan, which he will use to buy building materials such as cement, sand, and timber to construct his dream house.

loans.use: to purchase building materials such as cement, sand, and timber

loans.name: Yokonia

texts.en:
Yokonia is 44 years old, married, and has seven children, three of whom attend school. He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a farmer who has been growing cocoa for eight years. The income has helped him to meet his family's daily expenses. 

Yokonia used his first loan to buy cocoa and rent a cocoa garden to harvest and sell. He is requesting another loan, which he will use to buy building materials such as sand, bricks, and timber to construct his family house. He dreams of expanding his farming by buying a big piece of land and yielding big quantities, though he complains of harsh weather conditions.

loans.use: to purchase building materials such as sand, bricks, and timber

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a mother of four young adults. She lives in Nairobi’s Kiambiu informal settlement where she grew up and also raised her children.

Being the breadwinner in her family, she has ventured in several business including rental units and a charcoal business.

As Hannah recalls, her family has experienced poor sanitation characterized by the lack of toilet facilities. In the recent past, flying toilets have been frequent on pathways due to limited and inaccessible toilet facilities versus the growing population.

Fresh Life Toilets were introduced to her during a marketing and sales campaign in her area.  While she was attracted by the clean and hygienic features of the facilities, this information came handy as she was also on the verge of launching phase three of new rental units in the area.
Hannah anticipates to provide clean, hygienic and easily accessible Fresh Life Toilet facilities for eighteen households. Please help her in her quest to acquire one Fresh Life Toilet!

loans.use: To pay for one Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.name: Endang

texts.en:
Mrs. Endang has a family of three and lives in a town in Malang Regency in Java, Indonesia's most heavily populated island. In Indonesia.  You cannot drink city water and most people don't even have access to piped water. Therefore, most Indonesians depend on purchasing or boiling water. 

Mrs. Endang heard of a new option for disinfecting water when the promotion crew from Nazava water filters held a safe water training in her vicinity. Nazava Water Filters filter well, rain and city water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling and without using fuel or electricity. Mrs. Endang who is also a health worker in  her neighborhood seized the opportunity and became the sales representative of Nazava in her area. 

Mrs. Endang will use this loan  to buy about 20 filters and sell them on to her neighbors on credit  making safe drinking water available to 100 people.

loans.use: To buy water filters in order to provide her neighbors with safe drinking water

loans.name: Lela

texts.en:
Lela is 37 years old, a married woman, from Tsalka district, who lives with her husband and children. Lela's husband is an operator at a private company and gets a fixed salary. His income, however, is not enough to meet the basic needs of the family. 

With the help of family members Lela is extensively engaged in agribusiness. She has been involved in cattle breeding and in cultivation of potatoes. As it becomes harder to earn a living over time, Lela wants to expand her agribusiness in order to more effectively meet the daily costs of her family. 

A loan of 2000 GEL will be a great support to this hard-working woman and her family, enabling her to purchase 80 chickens and set up a poultry farm. She will sell eggs and also a special breed of chickens at the local market.  Lela and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will highly appreciate their support, as the family's income will greatly increase and they will have better living conditions.

loans.use: To set up a poultry farm and expand her agribusiness, for the welfare of her family

loans.name: Biktor

texts.en:
Biktor, who is 22 years old from Kutaisi city, lives with his student wife. They are a newly married couple who have no source of income except Biktor's parents' assistance from the region.  For lack of economic resources, Biktor was unable to study for a professional career. He has no recent activity and requires financial support to start his own business. He sought credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. The startup program which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 4000 GEL and open a general store locally.  Biktor will renovate the place and will purchase stock of various kinds of products.

After the general store is opened, the family will have a stable income which will enable them to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in future.  With the support of the Start Up program, Biktor will get an opportunity to be involved in his own business and tackle the financial difficulties.

loans.use: To make the only source of income and open a general store

loans.name: Jujuna

texts.en:
Jujuna is a 55 year old woman, from Kutaisi city. She lives alone and gets income from the social assistance of the local government and also an age pension. The income is hardly enough for her to meet all family expenses and she wants to start her own business. 

All the financial institutions rejected her loan requests because of her unstable financial conditions and lack of experience.  After several unsuccessful attempts, Jujuna applied for the credit to MFO Credo. Her request was approved in the framework of Start Up program, which is joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. 

With the requested amount of 550 USD, Jujuna will purchase stocks of various kinds of home products and clothing at wholesale prices in the country's biggest market, that is located in the capital. Jujuna will sell the products with price mark-ups and make a profit. 

She will be very thankful for the financial support and kindness from Kiva lenders

loans.use: To start trading with home products and clothing, to meet her daily expenses

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is 34 years old, widowed, and has children. She lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. For a long period, Peninah has been a businesswoman, dealing in textiles. She earns additional income from tailoring. She was inspired to begin the business to earn a living and meet the needs of her children. She faces a challenge of high transportation costs. 

Peninah is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more pieces of cloth for her shop. Her dream is to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more pieces of cloth for her shop.

loans.name: Marsudi

texts.en:
Mrs. Marsudi has a family of two and lives in a town in Sidoarjo Regency in Java, Indonesia's most heavily populated island. In Indonesia.  You cannot drink city water and most people don't even have access to piped water. Therefore, most Indonesians depend on purchasing or boiling water. 

Mrs. Marsudi heard of a new option for disinfecting water when the promotion crew from Nazava water filters held a safe water training in her vicinity. Nazava Water Filters filter well, rain, and city water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling, without using any fuel or electricity. Mrs. Marsudi who is also a health worker in  her neighborhood seized the opportunity and became the sales representative of Nazava in her area. 

Mrs. Marsudi will use this loan  to buy about 20 filters and sell them to her neighbors on credit  making safe drinking water available to 100 people.

loans.use: To buy water filters in order to provide her neighbors with safe drinking water

loans.name: Las Brisas Group

texts.es: Esta es la Alcancía “Las Brisas” La cual  está constituida por 05 socios con muchas ganas de trabajar y prosperar. Sarina de 32 años de edad es separada con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica  a la venta de comidas como salchipapas y pollo broster. Hace más de 3 años que se desempeña en dicho negocio.  Su mayor deseo es poder terminar de construir su casa. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de pollo, aceite, papas y lechuga. La Nueva Alcancía “Las Brisas” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por facilitarles este crédito.Sarina es la primera del lado derecho viste casaca color negra y pantalon negro.
texts.en:
This is the "Las Brisas" communal bank which is made up of 5 members who are eager to work and prosper. Sarina is 32 years of age, separated, and has two dependent children. She makes a living in the sale of food like salchipapas (french fries with hot dogs) and fried chicken. She has been working in this business for more than 3 years. Her greatest wish is to be able to finish building her house. 

She requested the loan to buy chicken, oil, potatoes, and lettuce. The new communal bank "Las Brisas" is grateful to the Kiva investors for providing them with this loan. Sarina is the first one on the right, dressed in the black sweater and black pants.

loans.use: to buy chicken, oil, potatoes, and lettuce.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es: Jose de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos, el posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia y también se dedica a la profesión de anestesiología, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo y repellando las paredes, pero como no tiene de suficiente capital está solicitando un crédito para la compra de polines,laminas, cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra para tener una mejor vivienda digna.
texts.en: Jose is 42 years old and lives in his own home with his life partner and their three children. He has a store in the front of his home and also works as an anesthesiologist. With what he earns from his work, he manages to pay for some household expenses. He wants to improve his house by changing the roof and plastering the walls. Since he does not have sufficient resources, he is requesting a loan to buy beams, metal sheets, cement, sand, and labor so that he can have a better, more respectable, home.

loans.use: pay for beams, metal sheets, cement, sand, and labor.

loans.name: Martha Lucia

texts.es: Martha, inspirada en su deseo de ser una trabajadora independiente y tener su propio negocio, estudió Marroquinería en una escuela de artes y oficios, al finalizar sus estudios y poseer las habilidades suficientes para elaborar billeteras, maletines, bolsos y calzado, ofreció a sus familiares, amigos y referidos sus artículos de cuero, con gran acogida que el éxito no se hizo esperar; sus solicitudes de pedido cada día son mayores, puesto que sus productos son de excelente calidad, diseños novedosos y lo mejor a precios asequibles. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra de una máquina plana y materia prima como cuero, sintéticos, forros, hebillas y demás, esta inversión está enfocada en mejorar la calidad del producto, así mismo captar nuevos mercados para lograr aumentar su cobertura y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Su meta es poder estar en compañía de su madre y recibir grado por parte de la academia donde estudió.
texts.en:
Martha inspired by the idea of being an independent worker and having her own business studied leather-work in an Arts and Trade school. When she completed her studies and had enough ability to make wallets, briefcases, handbags and footwear she offered her leather products to family members, friends and people referred to her. They have been accepted and she wasn't expecting as much success. She gets more requests every day as her products are of excellent quality, new designs and accessibly priced.

She is currently applying for her first loan from Kiva through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo which she will invest in buying a flatbed sewing machine and raw material like leather, synthetic fabric, lining, clasps and others. This loan is looking at improving the quality of her products so she can capture new markets and increase her exposure and improve her quality of living. Her goals are to be able to be with her mother and to receive a degree from the Academy where she studied.

loans.use: to buy a flatbed sewing machine and raw material like leather, synthetic fabric, lining, clasps and others.

loans.name: Evelyn Yamileth

texts.es:
Yamileth, de 20 años de edad, depende de una familia trabajadora,  está casada y estudio hasta noveno grado, dejo de estudiar porque la escuela estaba muy lejos y muy peligroso.

Yamileth, se dedica al cuido de ganado, tiene 4 vacas propios y los demás son de un tío de su esposo, su trabajo es darles comida, llevarlos al potrero y llevarlos al rio a tomar agua; su esposo se dedica a repartir recibos del agua en la comunidad y a reparar las tuberías de agua potable; además cultiva maíz y frijol, mientras su esposo trabaja ella también pasa ocupada cuidando el ganado.

El dinero del crédito lo necesita para comprar más ganado, ella quiere aprovechar que su tío le vende una ternera a buen precio.

Su sueño es, tener mucho ganado y construir su propia casa porque donde vive actualmente está alquilando.
texts.en:
Yamileth, age 20, is from a hard-working family.  She is married, and she went to school through the ninth grade.  She left school because it was very far away and very dangerous.

Yamileth cares for cattle.  She has four of her own cows, and the rest of them belong to an uncle of her husband.  Her job is to feed them, take them to pasture, and to take them to the river to drink water.  Her husband delivers water in the community, and he repairs potable water pipes.  He also grows corn and beans.  While her husband is working, she is also busy caring for the livestock.

She needs the money from the loan to buy more livestock.  She wants to take advantage of the fact that her uncle will sell her a calf for a good price.

Her dream is to have a lot of livestock and to build her own house because she currently rents where she lives.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Joel

texts.fr: Joël est âgé de 32 ans. Il vit en union libre et est père d’un enfant. Il vend de produits alimentaires pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Son rêve est de parvenir à augmenter ses revenus pour améliorer sa condition de vie et celle de sa famille. Il demande un microcrédit pour doubler son stock de jus en poudre.
texts.en:
Joël is thirty-two years old, lives with his partner and has one child.  In order to support his family, he sells food products.  His dream is to increase his earnings and improve his standard of living and that of his family.

Joël has requested this loan to double his stock-holding of powdered fruit juice.

loans.use: to buy a stock of powdered fruit juice for sale.

loans.name: Léonie

texts.fr: Léonie, âgée de 30 ans, est une femme mariée qui a un enfant commençant à peine à être scolarisé. Afin de générer des revenus pour prendre soin de sa famille, elle exerce un petit commerce de vente de produits alimentaires chez elle. Dans la petite boutique logée dans un coin de sa maison, on trouve du riz, du pois, du maïs, du sucre, des boissons etc. Elle souhaite agrandir cette activité, c'est pourquoi elle cherche un financement.
texts.en:
Léonie is thirty years old, married and has one child who has just started at school.  In order to make money to take care of her family, Léonie sells food products from her home.  Her shop is located in a corner of her house and she sells rice, peas, maize, sugar, drinks, etc.

Léonie would like to expand her business so she has requested this loan.

loans.use: to buy fizzy drinks and sacks of rice for sale.

loans.name: Yacquelin Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia, de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 10 y 1 año de edad y el mayor está estudiando cuarto grado.

Patricia, trabaja en un pequeño restaurante en frente de la bahía desde hace 5 años, aprendió a atender clientes desde que tenia 12 años de edad, cuando le ayudaba a una señora a vender comida, luego trabajo en oficios domésticos y ahora está en el restaurante; su deseo siempre ha sido colocar su propia  tienda en su casa, por así pasaría más tiempo en su casa con sus hijos.- En el restaurante trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m. hasta las 4:00 p.m. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar un estante para poner azúcar, arroz, maíz, frijoles y aceite para tener un poco de todo para la venta.

El sueño de Patricia, es poder ver a sus hijos graduados de una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Patricia, age 29, studied until the sixth grade and is a single mother of two children, ages 1 and 10. Her eldest child is currently in the fourth grade.

Patricia has worked at a small restaurant in front of the bay for the last 5 years. She learned how to serve customers while she helped a woman selling food at the age of 12. After that she worked carrying out different household chores, and now she works at the restaurant. 

Her wish is to establish her own store at her house. That way she’d spend more time at home with her kids. At the restaurant she works from 7:00 am to 4:00 pm.

She is requesting a loan to buy a shelf to put sugar, rice, corn, beans and oil to have more products for sale. Patricia’s dream is to see her children getting a college degree.

loans.use: to buy a shelf to put sugar, rice, corn, beans and oil.

loans.name: Yere Madjigui Group

texts.fr: Agathe et son groupe vient de finir leur 1er prêt kiva et remercie tout le personnel ainsi que les prêteurs. Agathe avec son prêt avait pu acheter du bois pour vendre et son bénéfice lui a permis de payer la scolarité de ses enfants. Agathe a besoin d'un nouveau prêt pour continuer son activité. Cette brave dame, âgée de 41 ans se bat au quotidien pour assurer un avenir à ses enfants. Son activité marche bien car elle propose du bois de qualité à ses clients. Après ses ventes, son bénéfice lui permettra de contribuer aux dépenses de la famille et aussi de commencer à préparer l'année scolaire avenir.
texts.en:
Agathe and her group have just finished repaying their first loan and would like to thank all the field partner personnel as well as the Kiva lenders.  Agathe used her loan to buy wood to sell and she used her profit to pay for schooling for her children.  

She needs this new loan to continue her business.  She is forty-one years old and works hard every day to provide a future for her children.  Her business is successful as she sells good quality wood to her customers.  Her earnings will allow her to contribute to the household expenses and prepare for the new school year.

loans.use: to buy wood for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay workers who are harvesting his coffee.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a thirty-three-year-old hardworking married man with two children aged six and two years old, living in Kamwenge Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy more items like soap, salt, sugar and others to boost his business. He still owns a retail shop as his main source of income as well as riding a motorcycle to earn himself an extra income. He started this business so as to earn a living and improve on his standard of living. He hopes to become rich and buy another motorcycle; however, his main challenge is price fluctuations. 

Godfrey is requesting for a loan to buy more items like soap, salt, sugar and others to boost his business.

loans.use: to buy more items like soap, salt, sugar and more to boost his business.

loans.name: Gjin

texts.en:
Gjin needs your consideration and financial help of 100,000 ALL to pay for a scheduled surgery. He is 52 and a married father of two in their late teens.  He already had a surgery sometime back; however, this time, the procedure will be performed for something else.
 
Their family income is as follows: $191/month disability income, $250/month employment income from his oldest son, very little money they generate from selling some fruits and veggies and approximately 30 piglets that they sell on an annual basis.

loans.use: to pay for a scheduled surgery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a milking cow.

loans.name: Luciano

texts.en:
Luciano is a small Mexican farmer who owns a few animals, works on his farm and also as a mason in his community. He was very curious about biodigesters and decided to invest in this waste-to-energy system in order to save money. Indeed, increasing LP gas prices and the wood his household needs to cook are costly expenses. By inputting his animals' manure into the system, natural bacteria will treat it and transform it into biogas and organic fertilizer. The biogas will be connected directly to the cookstove and boiler in the house, displacing the unsustainable LP gas and wood he used to buy. 

Using biogas will improve Luciano's family's health situation, as his wife and children will not inhale toxic smoke produced by burning wood anymore. In addition to economic savings, Sistema Biobolsa gives Luciano the opportunity to protect his direct environment by treating the raw manure instead of contaminating water sources and letting it emit dangerous greenhouse gases in the atmosphere. 

With his savings, Luciano plans to buy additional animals to expand his farming activities.
This loan represents 24% of the full cost of the biodigester. The remaining part is being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 6m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Annause

texts.fr: Annause est âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mariée. Elle vit avec son mari et leurs trois enfants dans la ville de Hinche. Elle fait le commerce de viande de porc et de bœufs depuis près de vingt ans.  Cette activité lui procure les revenus nécessaires pour faire vivre sa famille. Elle demande un prêt pour acheter des porcs.
texts.en: Annause is 47 years old. She is married. She lives with her husband and their three children in the town of Hinche. She has been trading in pork and beef meat for almost twenty years. This activity supplies her with the necessary funds to support her family. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase some pigs.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Yvrose

texts.fr: Yvrose, 30 ans, vit en union libre et est mère de quatre enfants qui sont régulièrement scolarisés. Elle habite dans la ville de Hinche avec son compagnon et les enfants. Elle vend du sucre, du riz, de la farine en gros. Elle travaille dur afin d’améliorer sa situation financière. Elle demande un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock de marchandises.
texts.en: Yvrose, 30 years old, lives in a common-law relationship and is the mother of four children who regularly attend school. She lives in the town of Hinche with her partner and the children. She sells sugar, rice and flour wholesale. She works hard in order to improve her financial situation. She is asking for a micro-loan in order to increase her stock of goods.

loans.use: to buy flour and rice

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Sur la photo  c’est  Issa  qui  tient la corde et la tête du bœuf au bout sur la photo.
Il est âge de 43 ans, il est marié  avec 7 enfants, âgés de 1 ans a 19 ans dont  1 est  à école coranique.  il est gentils  avec  tout  le  monde  dans  son  domicile.       
Sa  femme  est  ménagère  elle fait  embouche ovins (moutons)  
Il fait  son  approvisionnement   dans  le marché de sa localité. Il peut  avoir 25000 FCFA comme  bénéfice  mensuel.
Il fait  recourt  au R M C R  pour  augmenter  son  fond  dans  activité d’élevages bovins  afin d’acheter  beaucoup de bœufs. 
Il exerce  ce  travail  depuis  11 ans.  Les  revenus  qu’il gagne  lui  permettent  de satisfaire  les  charges  familiales. Son rêve est de devenir un grand emboucher.
texts.en:
In the photo, Issa is holding the bull's rope.  He is forty-three years old, married and has seven children, aged between one and nineteen years.  One of his children currently attends an Islamic school.  He is a caring man with everyone around him.  His wife looks after the home and rears sheep.

Issa buys his livestock at the local market and can earn 25,000 francs CFA per month.  He works with the field partner, RMCR, to increase his working capital and be able to buy many cattle.  Issa has been rearing cattle for eleven years.  Thanks to his income, he can provide for the expenses of his family.  His dream is to one day be a major cattle farmer.

loans.use: to buy cattle for later resale.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 49 years old, married and has one child.

Cecelia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Cecelia requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Cecelia has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Sheryl is 31 years old, and two of her children are presently in school.

Sheryl has a buy-and-sell fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables such as potatoes, bananas, sweet potatoes, and other fruits and vegetables to sell.

Sheryl has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables such as potatoes, bananas, sweet potatoes, and other fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 45 years old, married with three children.

Elvira works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like breads, shampoo, canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks etc.

Elvira has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from buy and sell fruits.

Elvira aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like breads, shampoo, canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks etc

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gina is 47 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Gina has a farming citrus business in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 14000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Gina has been in this business for 12 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Hydie

texts.en:
Hydie is 52 years old and has seven children. Hydie is married and has two children currently in school.

Hydie is in the agricultural business, farming citrus in the Philippines. Hydie requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Hydie has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Janelyn

texts.en:
Janelyn is 44 years old and married with two children, one children still in school, Janelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Janelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase groceries to sell like canned goods, drinks, milk, coffee, spices etc.

Janelyn has been in this business for 12 years. 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell like canned goods, drinks, milk, coffee, spices etc

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes works hard to support her family. Mercedes is widowed with one child and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Mercedes requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, chicken meat, spices, cooking oil and other utensil and materials for her food business.

Mercedes has been in this business for 15 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, chicken meat, spices, cooking oil and other utensils and materials for her food business

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 65 years old, married with four children.

Thelma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care product, drinks, bread, milk, coffee, noodles etc.

Thelma has borrowed and paid 1 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Thelma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy item to sell like canned goods, personal care product, drinks, bread, milk, coffee, noodles etc

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is a hardworking man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is farming; he mainly grows coffee. He started this business to get money and earn a living.

He has hardships of pests and diseases like coffee berry disease that affect his coffee farm. However, he has a vision of increased crop output.

He is requesting a loan to buy more seedlings and manure for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more seedlings and manure for his farm.

loans.name: Amon

texts.en:
Amon is a forty-four-year-old hardworking, married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in cattle rearing and fattening as his main source of income and also earns an extra income from a retail shop. He was inspired by the need to get money and cater for his family's needs.

He faces a challenge of scarcity of pasture and water, which is brought about by prolonged drought. He has hopes of increasing the number of animals on his farm.

He intends to use the loan to buy more bulls for fattening to sell.

loans.use: to buy more bulls for fattening to sell.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is a thirty-seven-year-old, hard-working, married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She used her previous loan to buy manure and mulch for her coffee farm. She still deals in agriculture as her main source of income though she has other side businesses, including selling produce for extra income. She started this business to sustain her family and improve their standard of living. She still faces the challenge of seasonal changes that affect her agricultural production. Her dream is to construct a big, permanent house in the future.

She is requesting a loan to buy more manure and mulch for her coffee farm to increase soil fertility.

loans.use: to buy more manure and mulch for her coffee farm to increase soil fertility.

loans.name: Evanise

texts.en:
Evanise used her previous loan to buy more shoes to sell during the Christmas season. She currently operates a retail shop as her main source of income. She earns additional income from farming. She started this business so that she can look after her family and educate her children. Her main challenges are inadequate capital, weather changes, and price fluctuation. 

Evanise requested a loan, which she will use to buy more sugar, salt, and soap to sell. She hopes to become rich and extend her farm to serve the increasing number of customers.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, salt, and soap to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more building materials for his house.

loans.name: Naómi

texts.en:
Naómi is a Babban Gona farmer from Gayya Village. She joined Babban Gona so that she could realise better yields on her farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Naómi no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to purchase better inputs to improve her yield. Through Babban Gona’s input loan she will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria. This will see her increase her income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Naómi now has the opportunity to ensure that all her children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmers' yields

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy zebu meat

loans.name: Anis

texts.en:
Mrs. Anis has a family of three and lives in a town in Sidoarjo Regency in Java, Indonesia's most heavily populated island. In Indonesia.  You cannot drink city water and most people don't even have access to piped water. Therefore, most Indonesians depend on purchasing or boiling water. 

Mrs. Anis heard of a new option for disinfecting water when the promotion crew from Nazava water filters held a safe water training in her vicinity. Nazava Water Filters filter well, rain, and city water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling, without using fuel or electricity. Mrs. Anis who is also a health worker in her neighborhood seized the opportunity and became the sales representative of Nazava in her area. 

Mrs. Anis will use this loan to buy about 20 filters and sell them on to her neighbors on credit making safe drinking water available to 100 people.

loans.use: To buy water filters in order to provide her neighbors with safe drinking water

loans.name: Mungu Tubariki Group

texts.en:
Ummy, who is in her mid twenties, is single with one small child. She has been running a beauty salon since 2012. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 7:30 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Ummy's fifth from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the salon products and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to take care of her child and repay her loan, and also bought a TV set, a radio, a fridge, a sofa set, and covered household expenses.

She will use this loan to buy up-to-date salon products to meet her customers' requirements. She dreams of increasing her salon to an international level.

Ummy will share this loan with her loan group, Mungu Tubariki, which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date salon products to meet her customers' requirements.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
As a married parent of one children, Marissa works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Marissa is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Marissa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to provide and secure for the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi works hard to support her family. Noemi is single with one child and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Noemi requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, chicken meat, flour, spices, cooking oil, additional utensil and other materials for her food production business.

Noemi has been in this business for 15 years now, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, chicken meat, flour, spices, cooking oil, additional utensil and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is 64 years old, married with eight children.

Pilar works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to purchase groceries to sell like canned goods, drinks, milk, coffee, spices, candies, bread etc.

Pilar has borrowed and paid 1 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Pilar aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell like canned goods, drinks, milk, coffee, spices, candies, bread etc

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion works hard to support her family. Salvacion is single and has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines.

Salvacion requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Salvacion has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Didas

texts.en:
Didas used his previous loan to buy maize which he ground into maize flour to sell. He is a 38-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda.  Didas still has a personal goal of educating his children up to the university level. He has a maize milling business that he has been operating for sometime and with the proceeds he has been able to pay school fees for his children.

He has now started a charcoal business. He still faces a challenge of inefficient supply of electricity and lack of skilled labor. However he has a vision of expanding his business to new markets and hiring employees to help him in processing. 

Didas is requesting for a loan to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Bony

texts.en:
Bony is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in a carpentry shop alongside crop farming. He started these businesses in order to earn a living.

He faces a challenge of unstable weather changes that destroy his furniture, though he hopes to expand his business and produce improved products.

He needs a loan to buy raw materials like timber for his carpentry shop.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like timber for his carpentry shop.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola used her previous loan to buy more chicks to rear and sell. She is a hardworking married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She still deals in poultry where she rears chicken and also rears cattle and owns a bar as her side income. 

She started this business to generate more income to sustain her family. Her main challenges are poultry diseases that attack her chickens and cause their death, and inadequate capital to buy modern equipment. She has hopes that in the future, she will have a big farm.

She is requesting a loan to buy more chicks to rear and sell.

loans.use: to buy more chicks to raise and then sell.

loans.name: Meria

texts.en:
Meria is a thirty four year-old hardworking widow with two children aged fourteen and four living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She runs a bar as her main source of income though she also practices farming to earn herself an extra living. She started this business to increase her income and look after her children as a single mother. She faces challenges of inadequate capital to meet the high and low demand while her dream is to diversify her business.
 
She intends to use the loan to buy more crates of beer, sodas and cartons of water to sell.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer, sodas and cartons of water to sell.

loans.name: Yuyun

texts.en:
Mrs. Yuyun has a family of two and lives in a town in Sidoarjo Regency in Java, Indonesia's most heavily populated island. In Indonesia.  You cannot drink city water and most people don't even have access to piped water. Therefore, most Indonesians depend on purchasing or boiling water. 

Mrs. Yuyun heard of a new option for disinfecting water when the promotion crew from Nazava water filters held a safe water training in her vicinity. Nazava Water Filters filter well, rain, and city water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling, without using any fuel or electricity. Mrs. Yuyun who is also a health worker in  her neighborhood seized the opportunity and became the sales representative of Nazava in her area. 

Mrs.Yuyun will use this loan to buy about 20 filters and sell them to her neighbors on credit, making safe drinking water available to 100 people.

loans.use: To buy water filters in order to provide her neighbors with safe drinking water

loans.name: Salina

texts.en:
Salina is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Sabon Garin Kuzuntu Village. Salina joined Babban Gona to create a better life for her children.  In the past, Salina suffered from poor yields that crippled her ability to pay her children's school fees. Now that she has joined Babban Gona, Salina has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria, and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, she will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase her yields and income considerably. With an ambitious goal of harvesting 30 bags of maize this year, Salina can now ensure that her children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmers' yields

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs.

Rosemarie dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Joevina

texts.en:
Joevina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Joevina is 43 years old and both of her children are in school.

Joevina has a food vending business in the Philippines. Joevina requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Joevina has been in this business for three years. In the future, Joevina would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Rabeka

texts.en: Rabeka is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Marmara Village. Rabeka joined Babban Gona to improve the lives of her family and children. Since joining Babban Gona, she no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to increase her farmland. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Rabeka will have access to high quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. This year, Rabeka has set high goals of harvesting 50 bags of maize. With increased yields and incomes, Rabeka has made it her ultimate goal to provide employment to members of her community through her farm.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her maize yields

loans.name: Ellene

texts.en:
Ellene is 32 years old and has two children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

Ellene is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Ellene requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She has been farming rice for three years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ellene would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 47 years old and has four children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

Jesusa is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Jesusa requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jesusa has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jesusa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en: Rahila is a Babban Gona farmer from Marmara Village. She joined Babban Gona so that she could realise better yields on her farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Rahila no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to feed her family and children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan she will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see her increase her income considerably. This season Rahila has ambitious plans to harvest 50 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Rahila now has the opportunity to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase maize yield

loans.name: Ambiya

texts.en:
Ambiya lives in a small village of Falakata. She is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She lives with her husband and a son, who works in a plywood mill. On the other hand, her two daughters are married.

Ambiya's husband Jabbar is associated with agribusiness; he grows seasonal vegetables on their farmland. Ambiya helps her husband in agricultural activities and especially at the time of harvesting and selling their products to the local markets. Due to the seasonal nature of his job, his income is unsteady and insufficient for the family's household. In this season, Ambiya plans to cultivate paddy because paddy is an all-season crop and has a high demand in the market. They are looking for a loan to purchase necessary agricultural supplies.

Thus, Ambiya has applied for a loan from BJS. She wants to utilize the loan to purchase good-quality paddy seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, and other necessary farm supplies for paddy cultivation. The loan will help Ambiya keep her family afloat and stable financially and expand her agribusiness. Her future plan is to cultivate potatoes next time with the profits from this business.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva for their financial help.

loans.use: to purchase necessary farm supplies for cultivation of paddies.

loans.name: Eli

texts.en: Eli is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Marmara Village. Eli joined Babban Gona to expand her farm and grow her agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Eli  will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see her increase her household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Eli  now has the opportunity to increase her yields and income and use her extra earnings to provide employment to members of her community through her farm.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her maize yields

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her maize yields

With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase her net income, Rhoda  would like to use her extra earnings to provide employment to members of her community through her farm.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her maize yields

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Gaoussou

texts.fr:
Gaoussou est un grand éleveur  au Mali, il a 49 ans marié père de 9 enfants âgée de 1 à 18 ans. Ces enfants vont tous à l’école.
Après le ménage sa conjointe  fait  élevage ovins (moutons) et petit commerce à coté  
Le vente  et l’  approvisionnement   de Gaoussou s’effectue dans  le marché de sa localité, où il peut gagner 70 000 FCFA  par  mois  comme  bénéfice  mensuel .  
IL fait  recours  au R M C R  pour  avoir plus   de  fond  pour financer son  activité d’élevages (bovins, ovins)   
Il exerce  ce  travail  depuis  20 ans,  les  revenus  qui’ il gagne  lui  permettent  de satisfaire  les  besoins  familiaux ainsi que les frais de scolarité des enfants 
Dans  les  jours  à  venir  son rêve est de construire une maison en dur pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Gaoussou is a great livestock breeder in Mali. He is 49 years old, married and the father of 9 children aged 1 to 18 years. His children all attend school. After attending to household duties, his wife rears sheep and engages in petty trade besides. 
Gaoussou's sales and purchases are done in his local market, where he can earn 70,000 FCFA in monthly income. He has reached out to RMCR in order to obtain more funds to finance his breeding activity (cattle, sheep). He has been in this trade for 20 years. The income he earns allows him to satisfy the family's needs as well as pay his children's school fees. In the days to came, his dream is to build a brick house for his children.

loans.use: to buy animals for resale

loans.name: Jingin

texts.en: Jingin is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Sabon garin Kuzuntu  Village. Jingin joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Jingin suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to move into a bigger house. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Jingin has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 70 bags of maize this year, Jingin can now ensure that his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yield

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina is a Babban Gona farmer from Sabon garin Kuzuntu Vilage. Paulina joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn operates a glass and aluminum services.  She sells aluminum glass designed for house decoration, aquarium glass and other related services. She is 32 year old, a married woman with 5 children. Her oldest child is 13 and the youngest is 1 year old.
Together with her family, she lives in Talibon, Bohol.

She has requested a loan to buy supplies like aluminum glass, tools and other materials. These will help Jocelyn purchase additional materials needed and able to deliver the orders of her respective customers on time. Thus, boost its business production and able to improve her income. She could now provide her family with healthy diets and better living condition.

 Jocelyn would like to improve her business by handling it properly for sustainable living in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy supplies like aluminum glass, tools and other materials

loans.name: Yohanna

texts.en:
Yohanna is a Babban Gona farmer from the village of Kugawa. He joined Babban Gona to realize better yield from his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Yohanna no longer worries about having inadequate income to provide healthcare for his family and children.  He will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicides, and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  His income will incease considerably.  Johanna  plans to harvest 70 bags of maize. 

Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Yohanna now has the opportunity to diversify his farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites has engaged in fishing for eight years now. She sells fresh fish and crabs to the locals in her area. She is a 48 year old married woman with 4 dependents. Her oldest is 19 and the youngest is 11 year old respectively.  
She needs additional capital to finance her fishing livelihood.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP to purchase crab nets and pay for pump boat repair. Marites could now improve her yield and able to sells more fish and crabs. Thus, it helps improve her earnings and starts to balance her finances. She could now support the needs of her children and able to continue send them to school.

In the future, she dreams to expand her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to purchase crab nets and pay for pump boat repair

loans.name: Safiya

Safiya will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizer, herbicide, and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. Her household income will increase considerably. 

Safiya now has the opportunity to increase her yield, income, and use her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr: Sur la photo, Korotimi est la femme assise en tenant le tourteau dans un récipient. Elle a 39 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont  4 écoliers. Elle fait l’élevage bovin et ovin, son mari est un cultivateur. Korotimi fait recourt au prêt pour acheter plus de bœufs et moutons pour son élevage enfin de gagner beaucoup de bénéfices. Elle exerce ce travail depuis 8 ans. Korotimi est analphabète mais elle se souci de la  scolarisation de ses enfants. Le prêt lui aide à subvenir à ses charges familiales ainsi que les frais de scolarité de ses enfants  grâce aux bénéfices générés. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de n’Togonasso et ses ventes se vont en détail au marché de sa localité. Elle réalise un bénéfice mensuel de 5 000f CFA après ses dépenses. Les obstacles auxquels se heurte Korotimi est que souvent aliment bétail devient un peu chère au marché.
texts.en:
Korotimi is the one seated and holding a dish in the photo. She is 39 years old, married and the mother of seven children, four of whom are in school. She raises cattle and sheep. Her husband grows farm crops.

Korotimi is taking out this loan to buy more cattle and sheep for her livestock business so as to increase her revenues. She has been in this business for eight years. Korotimi is illiterate, but she cares about her children’s education. This loan will allow her to cover family expenses, such as the school fees of her children, thanks to her revenues. She stocks up at the n’Togonasso market and sells retail at the local market. Her monthly revenue, after her business expenses, is 5,000 CFA francs.  The rising market prices on animal feed are often a challenge for her.

loans.use: to buy livestock for resale.

loans.name: Jummai

texts.en:
Jummai is a Babban Gona farmer from the village of Sabon Garin Kuzuntu. Jummai joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer.  Jummai will have access to fertilizer, herbicides, and improved seeds. This loan will help to increase production of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. 

Jummai would like to use her extra earnings to ensure that all of her children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs.

loans.name: Angel Humberto

texts.es: Don Angel de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus cuatro hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos desde hace 30 años vende sus productos durante todo el años en los mercados que están cerca de su casa y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, pesticidas, entre otros insumos y así seguir con sus cultivos para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Angel is 51 years old and lives in his own home with his partner and his four children. For 30 years he has earned a living growing basic grains and he sells his produce throughout the year in the markets close to his home. With what he earns he manages to pay some household expenses. He is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertiliser, manure, pest control, pesticides, among other supplies and thus continue growing in order to earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertiliser, manure, pest control, pesticides, among other supplies.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
37 year old Julie engages in fishing.  She sells fish to the locals in her community.  A mother of 4 children ages 8-17 year old respectively, her husband is a fisherman. She is the one who sells her husband's catch. In addition to that, she also engages in seaweed farming. She grows and sells seaweed, for supplemental income.

Julie is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets and seaweed seedlings, and materials like straw and tissue paper. With these, Julie could now produce higher yield of seaweeds and able to improve her husband's daily catch. This could cause to augment her income and start to expand her business. Thus, enables Julie to pay her obligations and provide her family with good food.

Julie is very grateful for availing the funds, and she is determined to properly handle it for the improvement of the family's status of living.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and seaweed seedlings, and materials like straw and tissue paper

loans.name: Elina

texts.en:
Elina is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from her general store business.

Elina dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

texts.en: Alhaji Basiru is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kwari Village. Alhaji Basiru joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Alhaji Basiru suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to increase hi farmland. Now that he  has joined Babban Gona, Alhaji Basiru has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 40 bags of maize this year, Alhaji Basiru can now ensure that his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en: Haruna is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kofar Gabas Village. Haruna joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Haruna will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Haruna now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to build a better home for his family.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en: Jolly is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kofar Gabas Village. Jolly joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Jolly suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to feed his family and children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Jolly will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Jolly now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Sule

texts.en: Sule is a Babban Gona farmer from Kugawa Vilage. Sule joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer.
