Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Sule will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Sule would like to use his extra earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en: Yahaya is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kofar Gabas Village. Yahaya  joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Yahaya suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Yahaya will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Yahaya now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a 35-year-old married woman with 3 children who lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol.  She raises and sells hogs to support the needs of her family. She also has a food vending business. Her husband is a carpenter. 

She needs funds to support her ongoing livelihood. Jessica asked for a loan to buy feed and borrow capital for her food vending business. She will be able raise the quality of her  pigs and improve her food vending business as well. She could now start to settle her obligations and balance her finances. 
She wants her income to increase so that she can provide  for the needs of her growing children. 

Jessica hopes to be successful in handling her income and  finance  her children's education.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru: Эту дружелюбную и трудолюбивую женщину зовут Мархабо. Ей 48 лет, замужем и мать двоих детей. Она живет со своей семьей в городе Душанбе. Она одна из самых лучших портних в своем городе. Она имеет 30 летний опыт работы в этом сфере. Благодаря её упорной работе, она имеет много клиентов  и доход. Мархабо очень рада, что сама может обеспечить своих детей. Месяц назад у Мархабо сломалась швейная машинка, и она не смогла работать, так как у неё не было швейной машинки. Теперь  она купила новую швейную машину и  сейчас ей нужно тканы,  и новые швейные принадлежности. Все свои деньги она потратила на покупку швейной машинки, и на данный момент  у нее нет денег, чтобы купить швейных принадлежностей. Поэтому она обратилась за кредитом, надеясь, что ей не откажут.
texts.en:
This friendly and hard-working woman’s name is Marhabo. She is 48 years old, married and the mother of two. She lives with her family in the city of Dushanbe. She is one of the best seamstresses in her city and has 30 years of experience. Thanks to her hard work, she has many customers and a steady income. Marhabo is very glad to be able to provide for her children on her own. 

A month ago Marhabo’s sewing machine broke down, and Marhabo was unable to continue her work without it. Now she has bought a new sewing machine and  needs to restock fabric and sewing supplies. She has spent all of her funds to buy a sewing machines and presently lacks the funds to buy other supplies. This is why she has applied for a loan, hoping that her request will not be denied.

loans.use: to purchase sewing supplies.

loans.name: Lory

texts.en:
Lory is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lory is 49 years old and has one child who are in school.

Lory has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. Lory requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

Lory has been in this business for thirty years. In the future, Lory would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
Suzette is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She hass a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. 

Suzette dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Shirley is 45 years old and has four children who are in school.

Shirley has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. Shirley requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

Shirley has been in this business for two years. In the future, Shirley would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.en:
Felicita is a married woman with eleven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Felicita is 49 years old and has six children who are in school.

Felicita has a general store business in the Philippines. Felicita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like canned goods, snack food and other groceries to sell.

Felicita has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Felicita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, snack food and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mariyam

texts.ru: Мариям, 62 года, не замужем, вырастила 3 детей, сейчас помогает в воспитании внуков. У нее средне-специальное медицинское образование, на протяжении 13 лет она занимается торговлей канцелярскими товарами и сладостями возле школы. В обороте есть товар на сумму 100,000 сом (KGS). Ежемесячная прибыль составляет до 19,000 сом (KGS), точка проходная, клиентов достаточно. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Мариям обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товара в обороте. Мариям доходы от кредита планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса и приобретение автомобиля.
texts.en: Mariyam is 62 years old and unmarried. She has raised three children. Now she is helping to raise her grandchildren. She has a secondary medical specialist education. For 13 years she has been selling stationery goods and sweets near a school. She has goods in stock to the value of 100,000 som (KGS). Her monthly profit is up to 19,000 som (KGS), her sales outlet has good footfall, and she has enough clients. In order to develop her business further, Mariyam has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to increase her stock of goods. Mariyam plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in further growing her business and buying a car.

loans.use: to buy goods for resale in her shop to increase her product range.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cresencia is 35 years old and has three children who are in school.

Cresencia has a firewood sales business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more firewood to sell.

She has been in this business for four years. In the future, Cresencia would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Zina

texts.en: Zina wanted to add some goats of a good breed, since she has heard from other people in her village that these goats produce almost triple of the regular breeder goats.

loans.use: to buy four goats of a good French breed

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a Babban Gona farmer from Kugawa Village. She joined Babban Gona so that she could realise better yields on her farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Lydia no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to pay for her children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan she will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see her increase her income considerably.  This season Lydia has ambitious plans to harvest 50  bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Lydia now has the opportunity to provide employment to members of her family through her farm.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her maize yields

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en: Abubakar is a Babban Gona farmer from Kampa-Murga Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Abubakar  no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to feed his family. Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see him increase his income considerably.  This season Abubakar has ambitious plans to harvest  45  bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Abubakar now has the opportunity to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Rabeccah

texts.en: Rabeccah is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kugawa Village. Rabeccah joined Babban Gona to create a better life for her children.  In the past, Rabeccah suffered from poor yields that crippled her ability to pay for her children's school fees. Now that she has joined Babban Gona, Rabeccah has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, she will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase her yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 30 bags of maize this year, Rabeccah can now ensure that her children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her maize yields

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is a Babban Gona maize farmer from the village of Kugawa Kwalbatti. Tabitha joined Babban Gona to create a better life for her children. 

Tabitha suffered from poor production which negatively impacted her ability to pay her children's school fees. Tabitha will have access to fertilizer, herbicides, and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see her increase her household income considerably. 

Tabitha now has the opportunity to increase her yield, income, and use her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is married with four children, and three of them attend school. She takes care of additional family members. She sells used shoes at the market on a retail basis. She works six days a week and has been in this business for 12 years. She has applied for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used shoes. She gets additional income from roasting maize at the market. Her major business challenges include the seasonality of used shoes. She aspires to build rental houses to supplement her income. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and does not have piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used shoes.

loans.name: María Josefa

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Jaime Roldos se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 27 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 13, 11 y 6 años, todos  estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido se dedica a la pesca.
Doña María es una gran ama de casa que realiza el crédito para que su esposo tenga los recursos necesarios para realizar un gran trabajo, su esposo se dedica a la pesca, el junto a otra persona se van a alta mar  en su pequeña embarcación, salen en la mañana y regresan a la tarde y en ocasiones hasta el otro día con los productos que el mar les da, una vez en la playa entregan los productos a comerciantes mayoristas para que estos los distribuyan a toda la provincia. Llevan más de 10  años  dedicados a esta dura labor con la cual el saca a su familia adelante.
Este crédito es para realizar ciertos arreglos en la lancha ya que está un poco deteriorada y para comprar redes, piolas y combustibles. Lleva 5 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda y los créditos adicionales que le brinda la institución. Sus sueños son tener un gran barco para que su esposo realice sus faenas de pesca.
texts.en:
The members of the Loan Group Jaime Roldos meet every 15 days in the region of Jaramijo. This place is known for its beautiful beaches, most of its residents are hard working people who work in the sea. This is where Maria lives. She is 27, she is in a relationship and has 3 children who are 13,11, and 6 years old respectively. They all attend school. Her husband is a fisherman.

Maria is a housewife, and she is requesting the loan to provide her husband with the necessary resources to do a good job. He is a fisherman, and together with another person they travel to the open sea in their little boat. They leave in the morning and come back in the evening, sometimes they even come back the following day with the fish caught in the sea. Once they arrive to the beach, they turn in the fish to the wholesalers  so they can distribute it around the province.

They´ve been working this hard for over 10 years, and this is how he supports his family.

He´ll use the loan to fix the fishing boat because it is a little bit deteriorated , and also to buy nets, rope, and fuel. 

She is being part of the loan group for over 5 years, and she likes it because the help and the additional loans she receives from the institution. Her dream is to own a big boat so her husband can go fishing.

loans.use: to buy nets, rope, fuel, and to repair the fishing boat.

loans.name: Costance

texts.en:
Costance lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children, both of whom attend school. She has no additional family members. She has been operating a retail shop from home for the last six years, working seven days a week. 

She has applied for a loan to buy bags of sugar, cartons of salt, cooking oil, rice, boxes of soap and flour. Her main challenges include seasonality and fluctuating prices of commodities. 

She would like to buy a plot of land in the future. She lives in a rented house with access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, cartons of salt, cooking oil, rice, and boxes of soap

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 55 years old, married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Delia has a frozen food retail business in the Philippines. Delia requested an 8,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of frozen food to sell. Delia has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Delia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of frozen food to sell

loans.name: Comer Nurses Group

texts.en:
Kadijatu is a member of Comer Nurses. She is married with four children, who are aged 15, 12, 7 and four years and all are school going children. In the group picture, Kadijatu is on the right.
  
Thirteen years ago Kadijatu established her medicines/drugs business to support herself and her children in school. She pays school fees, buys learning materials and provides food from the profit she gets from the business. She sells 6 days per week from 9am to 6pm.

Kadijatu plan to use the loan to buy different types of medicines for resale.  She will use the proceeds from the business to open a savings account which will be used to pay her children's school fees.

Kadijatu and her group members need a loan totaling 4,000,000 SLL of which she is entitled to 1,000,000 SLL. Kadijatu plan to build a house and live a happy life.

Kadijatu and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy different types of medicines for resale.

loans.name: Ludy

texts.en:
Ludy is 49 years old and married with six children. All of her children attend school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ludy is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. Ludy has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Rio

texts.en:
Rio is 31 years old and married. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rio has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.  

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of rice to sell. Rio has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 5 cartons of fish for her business.

loans.name: Jojie

texts.en:
Jojie is 33 years old and married. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jojie has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 9,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell. Jojie has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Jojie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is 24 years old and married with one child who is in school. Jenalyn works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jenalyn has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles and other groceries. In the future she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt and rice to sell.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María, ha utilizado con responsabilidad los créditos anteriores y de esa manera ha mantenido surtido su negocio con ropa, calzado y otros productos que sus clientes solicitan, manifiesta que los ingresos se mantienen estables y que sus clientes han aumentado.
Cree que es de vital importancia resurtir nuevamente su negocio para atender las demandas de sus clientes, solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar vestidos, pantalones, camisetas, faldas y otras prendas de vestir para ambos sexos, adultos y niños.
texts.en:
María has used her previous loans responsibly and has stocked her store with clothing, shoes, and other products that her customers request.  Her income is stable and she has gained new customers.

She believes it is vitally important to stock her store again to meet the demands of her customers, so she is requesting a new loan to purchase dresses, pants, shirts, skirts, and other clothing items for adults and children of both sexes.

loans.use: to purchase dresses, pants, shirts, skirts, and other clothing items for adults and children of both sexes.

loans.name: Wandza

texts.en:
Wandza is a single mother of one child, who is still too young to attend school. Wandza owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses is household consumables.

For over eight years, Wandza has operated an open air food selling business, selling from her home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Sheriat

texts.en:
Sheriat is a 25-year-old married man, who has been running a little bar-café in his village of residence.  The loan in an amount of 150,000 ALL that he is asking from Kiva lenders, will be used to stock up on some items for his café.  

In addition to this type of activity, he owns some agricultural land where he has planted mostly plum orchards and grapevines, from which he makes the local alcohol drink “raki” that he serves in the bar. “Patrons, including elders, come to my bar to have some nice homemade plum raki that is been boiled twice. Making it this way it gives the drink a smoother taste,” said a smiling Sheriat to the loan officer who visited him at the place.

loans.use: to buy stock of items he can serve in his bar cafe.

loans.name: Alhaji

texts.en: Alhaji is a Babban Gona maize farmer from  Kampa-Murga Village. Alhaji  joined Babban Gona to improve the lives of his family and children. Since joining Babban Gona, he no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to pay for his children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Alhaji will have access to high quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. This year, Alhaji has set high goals of harvesting 60 bags of maize. With increased yields and incomes, Alhaji has made it his ultimate goal to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Kodhel

texts.en:
Kodhel is a villager in his late 50s and also a married father of two who has been photographed next to a blossomed tangerine tree. 

About 15 years ago Kodhel bought 2,000 square meters from another villager, where he built a village house and also turned 8,000 square meters of bare land into agricultural land. He then planted 400 olive groves and 100 orchards of citrus and also placed there about 10 bee hives. All these past years, Kodhel thought that he had no obligations to pay for the latest land since this was not stated in the property contract. However, due to the corrupted system in the country that is impossible to explain through a little profile like this one, Kodhel was ordered to pay for the land. And this is the reason why he is seeking your understanding. “I will very much appreciate any financial help in this matter, because I’ve got to hurry and pay the dues, otherwise more legal fees will pile on me,” said Kodhel to the loan officer. 

To make an income, Kodhel sells olives, citrus fruits and raw honey to the local market.

loans.use: to pay for some land that he was recently ordered to purchase by court

loans.name: Maria Delmy

texts.es: Maria de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo de de granos básicos y hortalizas, se dedica a esta actividad desde que era una niña ya que sus padres le enseñaron ese tipo de trabajo y es asi como ha podido salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: abono, herbicida, insecticidas, fertilizantes y semillas, para poder tener una mejor cosecha y asi tener mas ganancias económicas.
texts.en:
Maria is 39 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and her four children. She grows basic grains and vegetables. She is been doing this since she was a little girl because her parents taught her this type of work and that's how she was able to thrive.

She is requesting the loan to buy farming supplies such as compost, weed-killer, insecticides, fertilizers, and seeds, to obtain a better harvest and make a better profit.

loans.use: to buy compost, weed-killer, insecticide, fertilizers, and seeds.

loans.name: Sergia

texts.en:
Sergia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children. She has been selling used clothing in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of used clothes to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.  Sergia dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ruzzel

texts.en:
Ruzzel is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like a beauty parlor. Ruzzel dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Joena

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Joena works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Joena is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Joena has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 55 years old and married with four children.  With one child in school, Evelyn works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods, noodles and other groceries. In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is 25 years old, married with one child who is is school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Mary Joy has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like shampoo, canned good, noodles and other groceries. Mary Joy has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Mary Joy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like shampoo, canned good, noodles and other groceries.

loans.name: Kanyansimbi Businge  Women Group

texts.en: Grace, whose hand is raised up, is a member of Kanyansimbi Businge Women Group where members guarantee one another for a loan. She is married with six children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda.  She is a hardworking retailer dealing in selling merchandise. She also gets additional income from cocoa growing. She is involved in the businesses to earn income to meet basic family needs. The local people are her main customers. She is challenged by competition and limited capital that hinders future prospects of expanding her business and making bigger profits. Grace has asked for a loan to buy merchandise like soap, sugar, sodas, beers, and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like soap, sugar, sodas, beers, and salt to sell

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio, vive con dos hijos, su esposa y su madre, la familia no tiene más ingresos económicos para subsistir que los que son generados de una granja de pollos de engorde que atiende don Julio, los miembros de su familia le ayudan en las diferentes actividades que tiene que realizar para mantener su negocio funcionando, el negocio nació por iniciativa propia y el oficio lo aprendió por medio de clases.
Invertirá en pollos recién nacidos, concentrado, vacunas y vitaminas, el resto del crédito le servirá para ampliar las galeras de la granja, procurará utilizar el crédito únicamente para su negocio, su finalidad es mejorar la capacidad de venta y tener ganancias mayores para cancelar sus deudas y cubrir necesidades básicas familiares.
Los sueños que tiene son construir su propia casa, mantener el apoyo económico para su familia y cumplir con sus compromisos.
texts.en:
Julio lives with his two children, his wife, and his mother.  The family supports themselves with the income generated by a chicken farm that Julio runs.  The family members help with different activities that help keep the business running.  He started the business himself and he took classes to learn about chicken farming.

He will use this loan to invest in newborn chicks, feed, vaccines, and vitamins.  He will use the rest of the loan to expand the farm's shed.  He is requesting this loan to be used only for his business.  His goal is to improve his sales capacity and earn more income to repay his debts and meet his family's basic needs.

His dream is to built his own house, continue supporting his family, and fulfill his commitments.

loans.use: to invest in newborn chicks, feed, vaccines, and vitamins and to expand the farm's shed.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose, a permanent resident of Kirinyabigo, Kawanda, is a married woman with four children. Rose is running a retail shop in her home place where she sells daily household use items to the neighboring households and passersby. She uses part of the profits from the sales to pay school fees for the children and the balance for home consumption. Due to the high demand for goods in the area, which implies high profits, she wants to boost her business by purchasing more commodities. She has opted to borrow UGX 1,000,000 from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI). This will help her to meet her customers' demands and be competitive. She thanks the Kiva lenders through UGAFODE for the tremendous work of alleviating poverty in communities and supporting small scale enterpreneurs.

loans.use: to boost her retail shop by buying sugar, toiletries, and beverages among other items to sell

loans.name: Dania Margarita

texts.es:
Dania es una joven muy dedicada al estudio, desde muy pequeña sus padres han luchado para sacarla adelante, a sus veinte años de edad, está en segundo año de la carrera de Banca y Finanzas, licenciatura que decidió estudiar por su gran habilidad con los números, la persona que más la apoya para que siga sus sueños es su madre, que trabaja como comerciante independiente. 
En estos momentos es de vital importancia que Dania tenga como herramienta para su desempeño académico una computadora portátil, para realizar sus trabajos universitarios de forma más rápida y con mejor calidad, con la ayuda de Kiva junto a MiCrédito esta joven tiene oportunidad de poder adquirir su laptop. Poco a poco Dania va avanzado hacia la meta que se ha trazado, que es terminar su carrera universitaria, para luego poder optar a un trabajo que le ayude a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Dania is a young woman who is dedicated to her studies. Since she was very young, her parents worked hard to support her. 

She is 20 years old, and she is in the second year of her degree in Banking and Finance. She chose this subject because of her great ability with numbers. The person who supports her the most so that she can follow her dreams is her mother, who works as an independent retailer.

Now, it is vital that Dania has a portable computer to use for school so that she can do her school work faster and so it is better quality. With help from Kiva along with MiCredito, this young woman has the opportunity to buy a laptop. 

Little by little, Dania is advancing towards her goal, which is to finish her university degree so that later she can select a job that will improve her quality of life and that of her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy a laptop.

loans.name: Nasiru

texts.en: Nasiru is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kampa-Murga Village. Nasiru  joined Babban Gona to improve the life of his family and children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Nasiru will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income significantly. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Nasiru now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to diversify his farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy trees inorder to supply timber for income gain

loans.name: Hirma

texts.es:
Hirma tiene 50 años de edad, vive con conyuge,en casa propia de material rústico de dos pisos, ubicada en la zona rural del caserio El Arenal,distrito Santo Tomas, provincia de Cutervo, Región Cajamarca, Sierra norte del Perú; caserio esta distante del Distrito de Santo Tomas es un lugar de poco trafico vehicular, cuenta con buenas referencias personales y comerciales en la zona.

La actividad a la que se dedica es el cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 2 has. Tambien cría y vende de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y otros) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, platano, viticas, menestras y otros)

El destino del crédito será para mantenimiento y cultivo de 2 ha. De café en producción, asegurando una buena producción para campaña 2015, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendra mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Hirma is 50 years old and lives with her husband in a two-story house built from rustic materials that they own in the town of El Arenal in the Santo Tomas district, Cutervo province, and Cajamarca region of the northern mountains of Peru.  The town is far from the district of Santo Tomas in an area with little traffic.  She has good personal and business references in the area.

Hirma works growing coffee.  She currently has two hectares of coffee crops.  She also raises and sells small animals (chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, and others) and grows cereals (yucca, plantains, viticas, pulses, and others).  

She will use this loan to maintain and cultivate her two hectares of coffee in order to ensure a good production for the 2015 season.  This will be reflected in a greater volume of sales, which means she can earn more income and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to maintain and cultivate two hectares of coffee.

loans.name: Melvin

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Melvin works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing. Melvin is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of groceries to sell for her general store business.

Melvin has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of three children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing. Evelyn is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell for her general store business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 58 years old and married with five children.

Nida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Nida has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 27 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Nida aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Karen Joy

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Karen Joy works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. 

Karen Joy is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Karen Joy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to her expand business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 50 years old, married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Estela has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like canned goods, shampoo, noodles and personal care products. Estela has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Estela would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like canned goods, shampoo, noodles and personal care products.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 62 years old and a widow with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Emelita has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending. Emelita aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Justice Group

texts.en:
This is 24-year-old Fatmata 1. She is married and has two children. Her children are both school-going children.  

Fatmata 1 belongs to a solidarity group of five women who have come together to complement each other to achieve their individual dreams. “Justice” is the name of Fatmata’s solidarity group. The women have named their group “Justice” because they are determined to repay their loan.  

“Justice” group needs a total loan of 5,000,000 SLL. Fatmata 1 will receive 1,000,000 SLL, which she needs in order to buy five bags of groundnuts and four bags of beans for her business. See Fatmata as she stands in the middle of the group picture.

Fatmata 1 established her food stuff business in 1991; she established the business to ensure her family gets enough money for their basic needs. Fatmata 1 uses profit from this business to provide a livelihood for her family and support her children’s education. She opens her business Monday through Saturday every week.  Fatmata 1 is a hardworking women; she opens her business from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m.

In the future, Fatmata plans to support her children to acquire a university education. She hopes that one day she will become an international businesswoman.  

She thanks you for supporting them.

loans.use: to buy five bags of groundnuts and four bags of beans for her business.

loans.name: Koba

texts.en:
Koba is 52 years old and is the only breadwinner in his 4 member family. He has a wife and school-aged daughter and son. Koba works at the local restaurant as a cook and gets 400 GEL monthly.  This is really hardly enough to cover even basic needs. As it becomes harder to earn a living over time, Koba wants to start another business, in order to more effectively meet the daily costs of his family. 

A loan of USD 900 will be a great support to this hard-working man and his family, enabling him to open a small store for selling food products locally and start trading. Koba has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan will greatly assist Koba and he will be able to improve his economic situation and give his family a better style of life.

loans.use: To start trading with food products, to provide additional income for his family

loans.name: Taj  Pari

texts.en: Taj Pari is a 49-year-old married mother of 7 children. She along with her husband is running a business buying and selling livestock. She looks after the animals and is responsible for feeding them while her husband sells to different markets in the city. Their business is providing them with enough income to support their family. In order to expand her earnings, Taj Pari has requested from Murabaha loan of 35,000 PKR to buy more animals such as calves and heifers for resale purposes. She is hopeful that expanding the business will help improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy more animals such as calves and heifers for resale purposes.

loans.name: Goma

texts.en:
Goma is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gidan Maijaki Village. Goma joined Babban Gona to increase her wealth. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Goma will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags of maize. 

This season, Goma has grand plans to harvest 40 bags. This will see her increase her household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Goma now has the opportunity to increase her yields and income and use her extra earnings to move into a better home with her family.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase yields.

loans.name: Vane

texts.en:
Vane is 29 years old. She is married to Wilfred and supports a family of 2 children. She has been practicing farming for the last 6 years, earning KES 8,000 per month.
 
Vane has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy certified seeds for high production and supply, in order to earn more income. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to start poultry farming. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy certified seeds for high production and supply, in order to earn more income.

loans.name: Lemcel

texts.en:
Lemcel is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children. She has a fishing in the Philippines and requested a 50,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy bamboo, binder and other fishing equipment.She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like a general store business. 

Lemcel dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bamboo, binder and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Myla

texts.en:
Myla is 32 years old, married with three children.

Myla works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell. Myla has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from frozen food retail business.

Myla aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Florence

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Ma. Florence works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store and pig fattening. 

Ma. Florence is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy a fishing net and other equipment for her fishing business.

Ma. Florence has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and other equipment.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 49 years old and has nine children. She is married and has six children who are in school. Emma is in the agricultural business of raising livestock in the Philippines. 

She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock. Emma has been raising livestock for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Emma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Jose Noe

texts.es:
José, utilizo el crédito anterior para presentar un nuevo inventario a sus clientes, las ventas mejoraron en su momento y cuenta con nuevos clientes, su familia se mantiene.
Requiere de otro crédito para resurtir la tienda, pues no tiene la disponibilidad suficiente para adquirir nueva mercadería, comprará azúcar, sal, jugos, boquitas, aceite, etc., para atender las necesidades de sus clientes y mantener en el mercado su negocio.
texts.en:
José used the last loan to offer new inventory to his customers.  His sales improved and he has new customers and his family is supported.

He is requesting a new loan to restock his store.  He does not have enough money available upfront to purchase new merchandise.  He will purchase sugar, salt, juices, snacks, oil, and other items to meet the needs of his customers and continue his business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, salt, juices, snacks, oil, and other items to meet the needs of his customers.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 59 years old and a widow with two children.  With one child in school, Gloria works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Gloria has been in this business for 30 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, bread, biscuits and other groceries. In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Robelyn

texts.en:
Robelyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 48 years old and has three children who are in school.

Robelyn has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment. Robelyn has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 37 years old and has six children. She is married and has three children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Margarita has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. She has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Margarita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Nighat

texts.en: Nighat is a 36-year-old, married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband, who is a van driver by profession. He drives in the main city and makes enough income to cover all the expenses of his family. He wants to change the engine of his van as it is causing a lot of pollution and is consuming too much oil for its work. That is why Nighat has availed Murabaha of 30,000 PKR for her husband, who will buy a new engine for the van to provide better facilities to his customers. Nighat is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: To buy a new engine for her husband's van to provide better facilities to his customers.

loans.name: Sahzia

texts.en: Sahzia is a 38 year old working woman. She felt that she should work to improve their financial condition, so she started a business selling cloth in her locality. She is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. She has taken out a Murabaha loan of 25000 PKR to purchase good-quality cloth in different colors to increase sales and earn substantial profits. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality cloth in different colors to increase sales and earn substantial profits.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en: Farzana is 49 years old. Her son (also shown in the photo) is a barber, by profession. He earns a good amount of income to meet family expenses. Over time he has attained a list of regular customers and he makes enough to contribute to the family income. He needs to deal with more customers, time after time. For this he requires hair and skin care products, along with combs, brushes and scissors. So Farzana has applied for a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR, for her son. She is confident that his business will move toward a positive direction.

loans.use: to purchase hair and skin care products, along with combs, brushes and scissors for her son's barber shop

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en: 31-year old, Sumaira is a married woman and deals in the business of cloth sale and purchase to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices and then sells it to the people of her locality. She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. For the improvement of her business, she has requested a Murabaha loan of 35,000 PKR to buy a greater variety of cloth in various colors and designs to fulfill the demand of her customers on time. She is shown in the photo with her husband.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in various colors and designs to fulfill the demand of her customers on time.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo,  se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace 10 años inicio con capital propio, también trabaja como motorista de un camión con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con su esposa, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono, herbicida, insecticidas, semillas, entre otras cosas y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para tener un buen cultivo y así seguir con sus ventas que le generan buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
The youth whose face has been pixelated is 28 years old and lives in a high risk zone. He has earned a living cultivating maize for over 10 years with his own capital. He also works as a truck driver from which he earns his work in order to cover some of the costs of his home.

The youth lives in his own house with his wife, and is asking for a loan in order to purchase fertilizer, herbicide, insecticide, and seeds amongst other things to improve the land which is shown in the photo, in order to have a good harvest  and continue with his sales to make good profits.

loans.use: to purchase fertiliser, herbicide, insecticide, and seed amongst other things to improve the land

loans.name: Gloria Margarita

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Jaime Roldos se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Gloria, tiene 64 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad, con ella viven dos nietos que crio desde muy pequeños pero ya son mayores de edad. Su esposo no trabaja por enfermedad.
Doña Gloria se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, zapatos, productos y artículos para el hogar, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta tres o cuatro  días por semana y no tiene horarios fijos sino en los momentos que está desocupada, también vende en su casa si sus clientes así lo quieren, deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, lleva más de 10 años con esta actividad la cual empezó con uno de los créditos que recibió del grupo por lo cual está muy agradecida. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pantalones, camisas y ropa interior de niños que es lo que más se vende actualmente. Lleva 10 años en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque con los créditos ella empezó su negocio. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The Jaime Roldos Credit Group meets every fortnight in the Jaramijo district, which is known for its beautiful beaches.  The majority of its inhabitants are hard working and have jobs related to the sea. Gloria lives there, is 64 years old and married. Through her marriage she has three grown up children. Two of her grandchildren live with her and she has raised them since they were very young; they are also now grown up. Her husband doesn't work due to illness.

Gloria works selling all types of clothing, shoes and household goods. She sells them door to door three or four times a week but she has no fixed schedule. In the moments when she is not busy she also sells from her home if her customers require it.  She offers credit and charges every eight days.  She has been doing this for more than 10 years and began with one of the loans she received from the group and for which she is very grateful.  

This loan is going to be used to buy trousers, shirts and children's underwear which is currently the best selling item. She has spent 10 years with the group and she likes it because with the loans she began her business. Her dream is to give her family the best.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shirts and children's underwear.

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en:
Theresia is a single woman, with 2 children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a restaurant where she has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

She will use the Kes 65,000 loan to buy more stocks of ingredients for preparing food. She hopes that in the future, she will excel in business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stocks of ingredients for preparing food in her restaurant

loans.name: Elvis Orlando

texts.es: Elvis de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo desde hace 6 años, vende sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas es como logra salir adelante, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para continuar con sus cultivos y así tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Elvis is 27 years old and lives in his own house with his wife. He earns a living cultivating maize and sorghum, which he has done for 6 years.

He sells his produce in the nearby villages, and with the earnings he gets from his sales he continues to move forward. He is asking for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and pest controls to improve the land which is shown in the photo, in order to continue with his cultivation and thus improve his economic income.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizers, and pest control to improve the land.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a married man and he has 5 children. He describes himself to be diligent. He operates a retail business where he sells basins, cooking pans, cutlery. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be storage of goods he sells. 

He will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy more stock of basins, cutlery and other items. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of basins, cutlery and other items

loans.name: Deodeth

texts.en:
Deodeth is 39 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Deodeth has been raising pigs for two years now, and she has borrowed from NWTF three times in the past to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ma. Ginalyn is a married woman and she is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 40 years old and has two children who are in school. She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

Ma. Ginalyn has requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall. She has been in this business for two years. In the future, Ma. Ginalyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela works hard to support herself. She is single and has a manicure services business in the Philippines.

Angela requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy new supplies for her manicure services.

She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Angela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her manicure services.

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en: Hajara is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Marmara Village. Hajara  joined Babban Gona to expand her farm and grow her agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Hajara will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see her increase her household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Hajara now has the opportunity to increase her yields and income and use her extra earnings to ensure that all her children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her maize yields

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 46 years old, married and has two children. 

Leonida is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Leonida requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Leonida has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Leonida would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Rabeka

texts.en: Rabeka is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Marmara Village. Rabeka joined Babban Gona to create a better life for her children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Rabeka will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see her increase her household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Rabeka now has the opportunity to increase her yields and income and use her additional earnings to purchase improved farm machinery and hire skilled labour.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her maize yields

loans.name: Rabi

texts.en: Rabi is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dole Village. Rabi joined Babban Gona to increase her wealth. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Rabi will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags of maize. This will see her increase her household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Rabi now has the opportunity to increase her yields and income and use her extra earnings to ensure that all her children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her maize yields

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en: Rahab is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Marmara Village. Rahab joined Babban Gona to expand her farm and grow her agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Rahab will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see her increase her household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Rahab now has the opportunity to increase her yields and income and use her extra earnings to ensure that all her children get a post secondary education .

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her maize yields

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is 24-year-old, single man from Deir al Balah City. He lives with his family in a small humble house. Mohammed has stall to sell watermelons; this stall is the sole source of income for him and his family. 

He took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN.  This loan will help him to buy new goods (watermelons) to sell it in his stall. After Muhammad takes the loan he will increase the sales and improve his income. As a result, he will provide the basic needs for his family. Muhammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new goods (watermelons) to sell it in his stall.

loans.name: Analina

texts.en:
Analina is 48 years old and has three children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

Analina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Analina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Analina has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Analina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene works hard to support herself. She is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Irene requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Irene would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Margielyn

texts.en:
Margielyn is 25 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Margielyn is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other vitamins for her pigs.

Margielyn has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to provide and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Cesar is 60 years old, married with four children. He is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Cesar has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines. He requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy wheels and other spare parts for his tricycle.

Cesar has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Cesar would like to save enough money to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy wheels and other spare parts for his tricycle.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 25 years old, married, and has one child who is in school.

Rose works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more inventory of groceries to sell.

Rose has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Rose aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 52 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Teresita has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from pig fattening. Teresita aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 44 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Nilda is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Nilda has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from gasoline retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 58 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by farming rice and vegetables in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Leonora has been farming rice and vegetables for 40 years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dreams, to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ma. Paz

texts.en:
Ma. Paz is 59 years old, married, and has seven children. She is in the agricultural business of farming rice and vegetables in the Philippines. Ma. Paz has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She has been farming rice and vegetables for 10 years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  In the future, Ma. Paz would like to save enough money to buy more farmlands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 58 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nelia has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from clothing sales. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 30 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Jocelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business .

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is widow and she works hard to support her family.

She has a bread retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Zenaida is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more bread to sell in her food stall.

Zenaida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 35 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bread to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is now borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from her fattening pigs business.

Leonora dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jorena

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Jorena works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from chicken raising and rice retailing businesses. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Jorena has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Pompia

texts.en:
Pompia is 59 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Pompia is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Pompia has been raising pigs for four years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money in order to support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Imelda is 44 years old and has five children who are in school. She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. 

Imelda has requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stock of rice to sell. She has been in this business for four years. In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Palerma

texts.en:
Palerma is 47 years old and has six children.  She is married and has one child who is in school. She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Palerma has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. She has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Palerma would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 65 years old, married, and has nine children. She is in the agricultural business of farming bananas in the Philippines. 

Magdalena has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm. She has been farming bananas for 21 years now, and has borrowed 24 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Magdalena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Magaji

texts.en: Magaji is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Paki Village. Magaji  joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Magaji suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to move into a better home. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Magaji has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 40 bags of maize this year, Magaji can now ensure that his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en: Adamu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Pegi Village. Adamu joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Adamu suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Adamu will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Adamu now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en: Ayuba is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Pegi Village. Ayuba joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Ayuba suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to feed his family and children. Now that he  has joined Babban Gona, Ayuba has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 40 bags of maize this year, Ayuba can now ensure that his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 27-year-old married man from Rafah City. He lives there with his wife and little daughter in a small humble house. He is an employee in a job where he gets a low income that barely covers his family expenses.

Bilal took a USD loan from FATEN to buy a water filtering machine and a solar system. This loan will help him to provide clean and hot water without using electricity.

Bilal appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water filtering machine and a solar system.

loans.name: Junavie

texts.en:
Junavie is a 33-year-old married woman with three children, who are all in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. 

She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more clothing to sell.

Junavie has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Yeni

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Yeni, one of Ruma's agents. Yeni lives in Majalengka, located in regency West Java, located about a 5-hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband and her only child. Yeni owns a stall that sells stationaries and mobile airtime credits to her community. She decided to join Ruma because she wants to expand her business in technology, as well as give more contribution to her community. Her community sees her as an informative, kind, and trusted mobile provider. 

As the business grows, Yeni needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. Yeni’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for her community,  Ruma’s latest product called Mapan, so later her community can have access to better products with lower prices. Yeni is the one who is seen in the photo. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of her village community.

loans.name: Elin

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is one of Ruma's agents, Elin. She lives in Majalengka, located in regency West Java, located about a 5-hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband and her children. Elin owns a stall that sells small snacks and drinks and mobile airtime credits to her community. She decided to join Ruma because she wants to expand her business in technology, as well as give more contribution to her community. Her community sees her as an informative and trusted mobile provider. 

As the business grows, Elin needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community, so her community can easily communicate with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. Elin’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for her community, Ruma’s latest product called Mapan, so later on, her community can have access to better products with lower prices. Elin is the one who is seen in the photo. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment service for her village community.

loans.name: Laazarus

texts.en: Laazarus is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Pegi Village. Laazarus joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Laazarus suffered from poor yields that inhibited his ability to improve his farming skills. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Laazarus has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare.
