Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 80 bags of maize this year, Laazarus can now ensure that his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase maize yields

loans.name: Miya Achhem

texts.en:
Achhem is a 44-year-old married woman from Falakata.  She is a homemaker and is blessed with three children (a son and two daughters).  She passed grade five and her husband studied until grade 10.  They live in a small village named Joychandpur in West Bengal. Two of their children read in grade 10 and 9 and the other one is in college now.

Achhem's husband is a farmer by profession.  He has been working on his own land for many years.  He learned his profession from his parents. He mainly grows paddy along with other seasonal vegetables. Achhem looks after her household work, and after that, she helps her husband in his activities.  As a farmer, he has a great passion for his profession, as all day long, without regard for climate, he goes to look after his crops.  The couple works tirelessly to provide financial sustenance to their family. They gained many good customers by their polite and simple behavior and good quality crops at a cheaper rate.  Like the other farmers, they also dream of extending and improving their production.

That is why Achhem is requesting a loan for the purchase good quality paddy seeds, compost and fertilizer.  This loan will be a great help because it will allow her to maintain a work rhythm and ensure a vigorous crop, so that she can give a good wellbeing to her family.

She is very much thankful to her generous lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Shikha

texts.en:
Shikha is an enterprising woman of 44 years from a small village named Parangerpar in the district of Alipurduar. She is married and a mother of four children (two sons and two daughters). Her daughters are married now and her sons are engaged in small-income-generating work.  Her husband is involved in a betel nut business.

Due to inconsistent family income, Shikha has been practicing cattle farming to give sustenance to her family through her dairy business. She finds dairy farming enjoyable and profitable. She has a few dairy cows on her farm. She supplies milk to her neighbors. In order to increase her business, she needs to purchase one more cow. But the biggest challenge she faces is limited funds.

Shikha is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow and fodder. It will produce enough milk to enable her to supply more, and satisfy her customers, and thus earn more. So, she has taken a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS.

She dreams of purchasing more cows in the future to enlarge her business. Her goals are to construct a better and decent house in the future.

She gives her heartiest thanks to her lenders, BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow  for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a Babban Gona farmer from Kanakargo Village.

He joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Haruna no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to pay his children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria. This will see him increase his income considerably. This season Haruna has ambitious plans to harvest 80 bags of maize.

Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Haruna now has the opportunity to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm's yield.

loans.name: Renu

texts.en:
Renu is 29 years old, married and a loving mother of three children (one son and two daughters).  All of her children are studying in different grades in a local village school. Renu lives with her family in a small village in Falakata, West Bengal.

Renu's husband is associated with agricultural activities. Mainly, he cultivates mushrooms, which need a lot of effort. Mushroom growing techniques require the correct combination of humidity and temperature. Renu also helps her husband in this business. They cultivate mushrooms and sell the harvest in the market. There is a great demand for mushrooms in West Bengal, thus they have chosen this business. 

Now they need some agricultural supplies to cultivate more mushrooms. So Renu has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to purchase seeds, fertilizers and necessary supplies to execute their plan. 

Her goals for the future are to improve their agribusiness, to improve their family economy and to use the profits to give her children a good education. She appreciates the support of her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other necessary supplies to cultivate mushrooms.

loans.name: Ma. Rachel

texts.en:
Ma. Rachel is 39 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Ma. Rachel has been raising pigs for four years now and has borrowed from NWTF eight times in the past to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 24 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jessica has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed from NWTF eight times in the past to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Rohman

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is one of Ruma's agents, Rohman. He just joined Ruma last year.

Rohman lives in Sumedang, located in West Java, about 4-5 hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his only child. Rohman is an employee in a private company. He decided to join Ruma last year because he wants to start to become an entrepreneur, as well as provide more contribution to his community. Rohman is really excited to be a part of Ruma’s network because it is something new for him. His community sees him as a trusted and informed mobile provider.

With the support and assistance from Ruma staff, he is now offering to process mobile payment services for customers. Right now, customers can buy mobile airtime credits from him, as well as pay their electricity bill. He is requesting a Kiva loan to help him to purchase more mobile payment services. His goal for his business is to become a trusted mobile payment service provider for his community.

Rohman is the one who is seen in the photo. He will be thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide bill payment service and sell mobile airtime credits to give his village community better access to communication and financial services.

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kanakargo Village. He joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Mathew will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Mathew now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Dolon

texts.en:
Dolon is a resident of a remote region in Falakata. She is only 26 years old and studied up to grade 10. Now she is married and a mother of two lovely daughters. One of her daughters reads in grade one and other reads in kindergarten.

Dolon is a housewife and her husband Biplab, 34 years old, is a farmer by profession. He grows a variety of seasonal vegetables on their farm land.  Dolon helps him with the farming activities, especially at the time of harvesting and selling. His family's primary income comes from growing different vegetables.  They need to earn more to meet all the costs of the family. Now they plan to cultivate teasel gourds, which is a profitable vegetable in the summer season. But they need financial help. 

Dolon applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs to cultivate teasel gourds. Dolon strongly believes that the loan’s profit will enable her to upgrade the family financial status. Her first priority is to provide a good education to her daughters.

She will be ever grateful to BJS and Kiva for the financial help.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs to cultivate teasel gourds.

loans.name: Alpana

texts.en:
Alpana is a 25-year-old resident of a remote village named Harinathpur in Falakata, West Bengal. She is a housewife and blessed with one son who reads in grade one. Her husband is engaged in an agribusiness. 

Alpana's husband grows seasonal vegetables on their farm land. Alpana also helps her husband with farming activities. The income generated from the farm is the main source of income for the family. They grow a variety of seasonal crops in different seasons and sell the harvest in the nearby village market. 

Now she decided to cultivate pointed gourds on their small piece of land, as this vegetable is in much demand in the summer in West Bengal. So, she asked for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase pointed gourd seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and other farm supplies to cultivate pointed gourds. She hopes to earn a good profit from this cultivation.

Her goal is to increase and improve production, which will help her to improve the living conditions of her family.

She expressed her gratitude to the lenders.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies for pointed gourd cultivation.

loans.name: Refije

texts.en:
Refije is 48 years old and a divorced mother of two children, living in the city of Elbasan, where she’s been practicing her seamstress profession for almost twenty years. She’s been stitching bed linens, curtains and drapes, clothes mostly for women, repairs and also traditional costumes that she sells upon request. “When I first started my activity I was young and inexperienced and did not know much of my talents. However, the more I did pursue this activity, the more I discovered talents and did more things. Now, I make roughly $500/month which is not very bad in a country with a very high unemployment rate and a pricy living life,” said Refije to the branch assistant who took part of her interview. “I have established a good clientele and I serve them very well,” continued Refije in her interview.

This loan will help her buy another sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine for her little home activity

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en: Iliya is a Babban Gona farmer from Kanakargo Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Iliya no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to increase his farmland. Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see him increase his income considerably. This season Iliya has ambitious plans to harvest 80 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Iliya now has the opportunity to diversify his farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farm yields.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Two Fresh Life Toilets.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en: Gabriel is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kanakargo Village. He joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Gabriel will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Gabriel now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to diversify his farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farm yields.

loans.name: Tata

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it's time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Tata. Tata lives in Sumedang, a village in West Java, located about a five-hour drive from Jakarta. He owns a small stall where he sells mobile phone accessories and mobile airtime credits for his community.

Tata joined Ruma in 2014. He knew about Ruma from one of the sales executives who came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to expand his business, as well as increase his savings and give more contribution to his community. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Tata sees improvements in his business. As the business grows, he is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to provide more mobile airtime credits for his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Tata improve his business and accordingly, his community, which needs access to such services.

As seen in the photo, Tata is the one who is sitting in his own small stall. He is very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for the members of his village community.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en: Yusuf is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kunda Village. Yusuf joined Babban Gona to improve the lives of his family and children. Since joining Babban Gona, he no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to feed his family and children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Yusuf will have access to high quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. This year, Yusuf has set high goals of harvesting 30 bags of maize. With increased yields and incomes, Yusuf has made it his ultimate goal to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Isiyaku

texts.en: Isiyaku is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kanakargo Village. Isiyaku joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Isiyaku suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to increase his farmland. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Isiyaku has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 50 bags of maize this year, Isiyaku can now ensure that his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Yusif

texts.en:
Yusif  is a Babban Gona Farmer's Organization farmer from Zanfarawa Village. He joined Babban Gona, so that he could realize better yields on his farm. 

Since joining Babban Gona, Yusif  no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to improve his farming skills. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to top of the range farm inputs, such as fertilizer, herbicide, and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will help him to considerably increase his income.  

This season, Yusif has ambitious plans to harvest 50 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Yusif now has the opportunity to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program .

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a Babban Gona Farmer's Organization maize farmer from Sarki Village. Ibrahim joined Babban Gona to increase his wealth. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Ibrahim will have access to the best farm inputs in the market, such as fertilizer, herbicide, and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags of maize.  

This season, Ibrahim  has grand plans to harvest 60 bags. This will help him to considerably increase his household income. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Ibrahim now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into a Babban Gona farm.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Virgie works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Virgie is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

Virgie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en: Gabriel  is a Babban Gona farmer from Kanakargo Village. He joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Gabriel will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Gabriel would like to use his extra earnings to ensure that his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farm yields.

loans.name: Kusmanto

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Kusmanto, one of Ruma's agents. Kusmanto lives in Kudus, located east of Semarang, the capital of Central Java, a nine-hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Kusmanto owns a stall that sells small mobile airtime credits for his community. He has already joined Ruma for a year. He knew about Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive who came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he is interested in Ruma’s system. The sales executive will be coming to his stall to collect the money. Moreover, his community sees him as a trustworthy mobile provider.

As the business grows, Kusmanto is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits and bill payment services for his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Kusmanto improve his business and accordingly, his community, which needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Kusmanto is the one who is sitting in his own stall. He will be very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to give his village community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: El grupo “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS” está conformado por socias trabajadoras y responsables. Estefani es soltera. Ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos para damas de toda estación con el apoyo de su madre. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de  zapatos de estación de invierno (botas) y zapatos de vestir. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Estefani es la se encuentra adherida en la parte superior izquierda ya que no pudo estar presente en la reunión por motivos de estar atendiendo su negocio.
texts.en: The “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS” group is formed by hardworking and responsible working women. Estefani is single. With her mother's support, she works selling women shoes for all seasons. She will use the loan to buy winter shoes, such as boots and dress shoes. The group is grateful to the KIVA lenders for the given loan. Estefani' s photo is taped on the top left part, since she was not able to be present in the meeting due to the fact that she had to tend to her business.

loans.use: to buy boots and dress shoes.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Ahmad, one of Ruma’s agents. Ahmad lives in Purwokerto, a small area located in Central Java, around an eight-hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He is happily married. He and his wife have three children, two daughters and one son. Ahmad owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits and provides electricity bill payment services for his community. He has already joined Ruma for a year. He knew about Ruma from the Ruma’s sales executive who came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he already heard before that Ruma has the best service and system.

As the business grows, Ahmad is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and electricity bill payment services to his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Ahmad improve his business and accordingly, his community, which needs access to such services. Ahmad is the one who is seen in the photo. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to give his village community better access to communication and financial services by selling mobile airtime credits and providing bill payment services.

loans.name: Miskan

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Miskan, one of Ruma’s agents. Miskan lives in Malang, a small area in East Java located about one hour and thirty minutes from Jakarta by plane. Miskan owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits. He is happily married. He and his wife have two cute children. Miskan owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits for his community. He has already joined Ruma for almost a year. He knew about Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive who came to his stall. He feels happy because since he joined Ruma, he can give more contribution to his community.

As the business grows, Miskan is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits for his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Miskan improve his business and accordingly, his community, which needs access to such services. Miskan's goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community, so later on, his community can have access to better products with lower prices. As seen in the photo, Miskan is the one who is standing in his own stall. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of his local community.

loans.name: Idris

texts.en: Idris is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dankwaire Village. He joined Babban Gona to increase his wealth. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Idris will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags of maize. This season, Idris has grand plans to harvest 40 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Idris now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farm yields.

loans.name: Nasipkan

texts.ru: Насипкан, 44 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 1 ребенка. У Насипкан- среднее образование, работает медсестрой в больнице. В качестве дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, стартовав 25 лет назад с 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Насипкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 коровы, 18 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 29,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Насипкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Насипкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Nasipkan is 44 and married with one child. She has a high school education and works as a nurse in the hospital. She also works in animal husbandry as an additional source of income for her family, a business she started 25 years ago with 5,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work she currently has three cows and 18 sheep on her farm, with a monthly income of 29,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Nasipkan has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 KGS to purchase livestock to increase her herd. She plans to put profits from the loan into further increasing her quantity of livestock.

loans.use: to buy some livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
43-year-old Josie runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various commodities ranging from canned goods, noodles, seasonings, sugar and toiletries. She is married with  four children as is from Talibon, Bohol. Her oldest child is 23 and the youngest is 9 years old.

She has been running a sari-sari (variety) store for more than 10 years already. In addition to that, Josie also engages in seaweed farming. She grows and sells seaweed.

She is asking for a loan to buy seaweed seedlings and materials like straw and tissue paper. This will help improve Josie's production of seaweed. It will increase her yield and her income will be augmented. Thus, it enables Josie to handle her finances and pay her obligations. She could now able to continue send her children to school and provide nutritious meals to the whole family.

Josie dreams to expand her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings and materials like straw and tissue paper

loans.name: Jafaru

texts.en:
Jafaru is a Babban Gona farmer from Sarki village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realize better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Jafaru no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to feed his family and children. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top-of-the-line farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see him increase his income considerably.   

Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Jafaru now has the opportunity to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farmer’s yields

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia works hard to support her family. Cecilia is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Cecilia requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials and gears for her business.
Cecilia has been in this business for 5 years now.

Cecilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and gears for her business.

texts.en:

This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farmer’s yields

loans.name: Rodisa

texts.en:
Rodisa raises and sells hogs to earn a living. She is a 29-year-old married woman with a 2-year-old dependent. Aside from hog raising, she also runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic household commodities like sugar, cooking oil, shampoo, canned good, beverages and toiletries. 

She has requested a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP to buy pig feed and stock for the store, like canned goods, soft drinks and assorted groceries. These will keep her store full of supplies and enable more buyers to come. Thus, it enables her to settle her obligations and start to augment her income.

Rodisa is determined to manage both her businesses to become productive and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and stock for the store

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farmer’s yields

This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. 

With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Alhaji Sule would like to use his extra earnings to buy improved machinery and hire skilled labour .

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farmer’s yields

loans.name: Ibrahim

Ibrahim is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Chirai village. Ibrahim joined Babban Gona to increase his wealth.

This season, Ibrahim  has grand plans to harvest 31 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Ibrahim now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farmer’s yields

texts.en:
Laazarus Sogiji is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Talle Kwatakware village. Laazarus Sogiji joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Laazarus Sogiji will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizer, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. texts.en:
Sunday is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Chirai village. Sunday joined Babban Gona to increase his wealth. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Sunday will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizer, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags of maize.   This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Sunday now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farmer’s yields

loans.name: Sandhya

texts.en:
Sandhya is a 41-year-old entrepreneur who lives with her husband and two children (one son and one daughter) in Falakata. Her children study in the local village school in different grades. 

Sandhya and her husband are engaged with a batasha business. They make batasha in their home and supply the candy to the local shops and in their neighborhood. Batasha is a semi-spherical crisp and spongy sugar drop candy. It is mostly used as Prasad in temples and in different Hindu festivals. There is a high demand for batasha in their local area, thus they want to develop their business to satisfy the demand of their customers.  But they need financial aid to invest in the business.

Thus Sandhya applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS. She will use the loan to buy the ingredients to make batasha. She hopes that this business loan will give a boost in their micro-enterprise and also generate sufficient income with which she can easily bear the educational costs of her children along with the household expenses. 

Sandhya is really grateful to her lenders for their kind support.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making batasha (sugar drop candy) for their existing business.

loans.name: Kabila

texts.en:
Kabila is a 28-year-old lady who lives in a small village named Jogendrapur of the Alipurduar district with her husband. She and her husband have not received any formal education, but they can sign their names. Kabila’s husband runs a modest grocery store with the help of Kabila.

They sell the daily necessities consumed by the villagers like oil, biscuits, flour, rice, sugar, salt, etc. Kabila manages the store in the absence of her husband. 

Kabila wants to expand her business by stocking up on more grocery items for their shop. This will attract more customers and also elevate their business income. As the market price keeps fluctuating, buying groceries in bulk will be difficult for them.  

Kabila is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy stocks of grocery items for their grocery store. Kabila hopes this financial assistance will help them to develop their business and attract more customers. 

She is thankful to Kiva and BJS for this support.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of grocery items for their grocery store.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a cheerful enterprising woman, 30 years old, from a small village called Harinathpur in Falakata of West Bengal. She is married and a mother of two children (one son and one daughter). One of them studies in grade 1 and other is an infant. Her husband Narayan is a vegetable vender by occupation.

Anita has been engaged with milk supply business to give sustenance to her family. She finds this business enjoyable and profitable. She has a dairy cow. She supplies milk from door to door in her neighborhood. She also sells cattle by-products like cow dung for additional income.  In order to increase her business and satisfy her customers' demand, she needs to purchase one more cow, but the biggest challenge she faces is limited funds.

Anita is seeking a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS to buy a dairy cow. It will produce enough milk to supply and satisfy her customers' demand; thus she hopes to earn more profit. She expects this loan will give a lift in her business. She is grateful to her lenders for this financial support.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Juan José es un caficultor del norte de Nicaragua, que se ha dedicado la caficultura toda su vida. Vive en su pequeña finca con su esposa en una comunidad rural al norte de  Nicaragua. En el último ciclo, su cosecha de café fue disminuida debido a la afectación de la roya, que es una plaga altamente peligrosa para la nutrición de los cafetos.
 
Para este ciclo, este pequeño productor ha diseñado un plan de mejoramiento nutricional para sus cafetos, con el apoyo del soporte técnico de la asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC), con lo cual se ha propuesto aumentar el nivel de producción de café. Para su ejecución, está solicitando el financiamiento para la adquisición de fertilizantes y abonos que requiere su cafetal para estabilizar su producción y con ello asegurar los ingresos para el mantenimiento de su familia.
texts.en: Juan José is a coffee producer in the north of Nicaragua. He has worked in coffee all his life. He lives on a small farm with his wife in a rural community in the north of Nicaragua. Last season his harvest was lower due to infestation by coffee rust which is a highly dangerous blight which affects the nourishment of coffee plants. For this season this small producer has devised a plan to improve nutrition for his coffee plants with the aid of technical support from the asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC) in which he proposes to increase the level of coffee production. In order to carry it out he is requesting financing to acquire fertilizer and manure that his coffee crops need to stabilize their production and doing that assure the income needed to maintain his family.

loans.use: to increase his coffee harvest this cycle, applying adequate fertilizer.

loans.name: Ofelia Mabel

texts.es:
Ofelia, ha tenido una experiencia agradable con el uso del crédito anterior, mantuvo su negocio de venta de frutas y verduras surtido y tiene clientes satisfechos. Continúa viviendo con su hijo.
Han finalizado la construcción del mercado nuevo en su comunidad, necesita de otro crédito para pagar el acondicionamiento del nuevo local y comprar frutas y verduras frescas, atenderá mejora sus clientes y les ofrecerá productos de calidad.
texts.en:
Ofelia has had a pleasant experience with the use of the previous loan. She kept her fruits and vegetables business stocked and has satisfied customers.

She continues to live with her child.

They have finished building the new market in her community, and she needs another loan to pay to outfit the new retail space and purchase fresh fruits and vegetables. She will serve her customers better and offer them quality products.

loans.use: to pay to outfit the new retail space and purchase fresh fruits and vegetables; she will serve her customers better and offer them quality products.

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es:
Juan Ramón es un pequeño cafetalero del norte de Nicaragua. Es padre de 5 hijos todos estudiando en diferentes grados de primaria en la escuela de su comunidad. Desde los 24 años él se ha dedicado a la producción de café, y actualmente cuenta con la certificación de su finca por comercio justo, a través de la asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC). 

Para este ciclo, este pequeño productor está solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas que le ayuden a mejorar la nutrición de sus cafetos, como parte del plan de manejo de su finca, mediante el cual se ha propuesto incrementar la productividad de su finca, para mejorar los ingresos de su familia.

El sueño de Juan Ramón es contar con una finca modelo que le ayude a mejorar los ingresos de su familia y contribuir de manera responsable con su comunidad, mediante la generación de algunos empleos en períodos de cosecha.
texts.en:
Juan Ramón is a small coffee grower in the north of Nicaragua. He is the father of 5 children, all of whom are in different grades at the community primary school. For the past 24 years, he has worked growing coffee. He currently has fair trade certification for his farm, through Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC). 

For this season, this small producer is asking for a loan to purchase agricultural supplies that will help him to improve the coffee plants' nutrition, as part of his farm management plan, through which he has proposed increasing his farm's productivity to increase his family's income.

Juan Ramón's dream is to have a model farm which will help him to increase his family's income and contribute responsibly to the community, through creating some jobs during the harvest season.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies which he will apply to his coffee crop to increase his production.

loans.name: Miya Nilipha

texts.en:
Nilipha is a 41-year-old lady and mother of three children (one daughter and two sons). Her daughter has got married and her sons are associated with some income-generating work.  She lives in a village called Parengerpar in Falakata of West Bengal with her family in a semi-concrete house. 

Nilipha runs a milk-selling business to supplement her family income. She rears cows and supplies milk in her neighborhood. As there is growing demand for cow's milk in the locality, she has planned to purchase another cow to satisfy the demand of her customers.  Hence she came up with the idea to access a loan to expand her business. 

So Nilipha is seeking a loan from Kiva through BJS. The business profit generated from her business will uplift her family’s standard of living. In the future she wants to buy more cows to elevate her business. 

Nilipha's full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase one dairy cow for her dairy business.

loans.name: Kaushalya

texts.en:
Fifty-year-old Kaushalya lives in a small village in Falakata of West Bengal.  She is the mother of one son and two daughters. Her daughters have got married and her son works in a computer repair shop.

She and her husband have been engaged in agriculture for many years. They cultivate different crops and sell the gathered harvest in the local markets. Now they are thinking of cultivating a crop which is profitable, a year-round crop. So they have decided to grow paddy on their farmland. But they have inadequate capital to invest in their business; thus they need some financial help to develop their business. 

Kaushalya has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). The requested loan is very important for Kaushalya to be able to purchase fertilizer and seeds for paddy cultivation. The loan will greatly help this family to organize cultivation work and they hope for a good harvest.  Kaushalya believes that it will be a lucrative business as the crop has a tremendous demand in the market. She dreams of purchasing new land and expanding their agricultural business in the future.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies for growing paddy  (rice).

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas, desde hace 2 años, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo es como puede salir adelante, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando las puertas y ventanas ya que las que actualmente tiene son provisionadas, por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de puertas, ventanas y pago de mano de obra, para poder vivir mas cómodos y seguros.
texts.en: Rosa, 41 years old, lives with her two children in a house she owns. She has worked selling tortillas for the past 2 years. With what she earns from her work, she is able to get ahead. She wants to improve her house, replacing the doors and windows since the ones she has now are temporary. For this reason, she asks for a loan to purchase doors and windows and pay labor costs, to live more comfortably and securely.

loans.use: to purchase doors and windows and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
La pulpería de doña Juana es una de más conocidas en su vecindario, merito que se ha ganado gracias a su buen servicio y al esfuerzo que ha entregado por más de seis años. Además pudo surtir su negocio con préstamos anteriores con MiCrédito y Kiva, con los que ha comprado distintos granos básicos y bebidas para vender. Por esta razón, ella quiere agradecer a todas las personas que la han ayudado a salir adelante con esos créditos. 
Su progreso la ha ayudado a motivarse, de manera que solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar arroz, gaseosas, sopas instantáneas, azúcar, frijoles, papel higiénico, entre otros productos de alta demanda en su negocio y que le ayudará a seguir dando excelente servicio. Afortunadamente cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y de uno de sus hijos lo que la hace inspirarse cada día. Más adelante considera mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Juana's general store is one of the best-known ones in the neighborhood, a reputation she has earned thanks to her good service and the efforts she has put into it for more than six years. In addition, she could stock her business with previous loans from MiCrédito and Kiva, with which she has bought various basic grains and drinks to sell. For this reason, she wants to thank all the people who have helped her get ahead with these loans. 

Her progress has helped to motivate her, so she asks for another loan to purchase rice, soft drinks, instant soups, sugar, beans, toilet paper and other high demand products in her business, and that will help her to continue offering excellent service. Luckily, she has the support of her husband and one of her children, which inspires her each day. In the future, the is thinking about improving the infrastructure of her house.

loans.use: to purchase rice, soft drinks, instant soups, sugar, beans, toilet paper, and other products.

loans.name: Chitrabala

texts.en:
44-year-old Chitrabala lives in a small village called Kalipur in Falakata with her family, comprised of herself,  her husband Bindeshwar, and two children (one son and one daughter). She sends her children to a nearby village school. Both Chitrabala and her husband have no formal education, but they can sign their names. 

Her husband is engaged with an agricultural business; he grows different seasonal crops and sells them at the market. Chitrabala is an enterprising lady; she is also involved in a milk-selling business. She supplies cow's milk and cattle by-products in her local area. Her neighbors are the main customers. Now she has decided to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase another dairy cow to sell more milk to increase her family's income. 

Chitrabala is struggling a lot to earn money so that her children do not suffer from poverty. She is confident that she can give her children a good education and run the family smoothly with the profit from her dairy business. She is very much obliged to BJS and Kiva for their kind support.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for her dairy business.

loans.name: Saraida

texts.es:
Saraida tiene 44 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, con su conyugue y sus tres menores hijos de edades 16,10,5 años.Ella vive en la parte rural del distrito de Pucará, de la Provincia de Jaén, de la Región de Cajamarca. Contando con servicios de agua y luz.

La actividad que realiza es costura de prendas de vestir como blusas, pantalones polos, disfraces cortinas entre otros, cuenta con más de 18 años de muy buena experiencia en el rubro, así como también se dedica a la venta de aves como gallinas, pavos así mismo como tambien a la venta de cargas de leña, ingresos adicionales que le permiten solventar el credito sin ningún problema.

El destino del crédito será para invertir en negocio en compra de telas,hilos entre otros. Con ello le generará mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios.
texts.en:
Saraida is 44 years old, lives in her own house, made of rustic material, with her spouse and their three children, ages 16, 10, and 5. She lives in the rural part of Pucará district, in Jaén province, Cajamarca region. She has running water and electricity. 

The work she does is sewing clothing such as blouses, pants, polo shirts, costumes, curtains, and others. She has more than 18 years of very good experience in this field, as well as working selling poultry such as chickens and turkeys and also selling loads of firewood, additional income which allows her to pay off the loan without any problems. 

The loan will be destined to invest in the business, purchasing fabric, thread, and more. With that, it will generate more income for her and also she will be able to improve her quality of life and that of her family. In this field, there isn't a lot of competition in the area, and with that, she gets better prices.

loans.use: to invest in her business, purchasing fabric, thread, and more.

loans.name: Idris

texts.en:
Idris is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Karofi Village. Idris joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Idris suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay his children's school fees. 

Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Idris has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. 

With the ambitious goal of harvesting 30 bags of maize this year, Idris can now ensure that his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To ensure children get post secondary school education

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna  is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Umbo Village. Haruna  joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Haruna suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay his children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Haruna will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Haruna now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To acquire land to put into the Babban Gona program

loans.name: Christian Orlando

texts.es:
Christian Orlando tiene 18 años de edad, cliente vive en casa familiar, vive con su madre, no cuenta con cónyugue ni hijos en su poder.Natural del distrito de Pucará, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Él se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, el préstamo será utilizado para la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Christian Orlando is 18 years old.  He lives with his mother in the family home.  He does not have a marital partner nor any children.  He is native to the district of Pucara, a community whose inhabitants make their living from agriculture, commerce and ranching.  It is located in the Province of Jaen which is part of the Cajamarca Region in the northern sierras of Peru. 

Christian makes a living selling general groceries.  His business is located in his house.  The loan will be used to buy a larger quantity of merchandise to offer to his customers and in this way generate a greater income in order to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of merchandise to offer to his customers

loans.name: Grupo Choxin Group

texts.es:
Manuela (la primera del lado derecho de la fotografía de blusa gris) tiene ahora 27 años, y junto a su grupo están muy satisfechos por el apoyo que recibieron con el crédito anterior, pues gracias a ello invirtieron un poco más en su negocio de venta de ropa he hilos y afortunadamente les fue muy bien por lo que sus ganancias incrementaron,  manuela cuenta que confía en ADICLA Y KIVA por ser dos asociaciones que le brindan a ella la oportunidad de superarse por medio de los créditos, pues ella antes no obtenía buenas ganancias porque no contaba con los productos suficientes para llamar la atención de los clientes pero ahora tiene muchos clientes y logro terminar la construcción de su casa, es por ello que ahora solicitan un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en su negocio de ropa e hilos para seguir surtiendo su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias.
El gran sueño de manuela es poder contar con un local donde pueda exhibir mejor  su negocio de venta de ropas.
texts.en:
Manuela (the person to the right of the photo wearing a grey blouse) is 27 years old. Together with her group is very satisfied for the support they received with the previous loan. Thanks to that she invest a little more in her business selling clothing and thread and fortunately things went well and she increased her profits.

Manuela says that she has confidence in ADICLA and Kiva that provided her the opportunity to excel through the loans. She did not make good profit before because she did not have enough products to get the attention of the clients. But now she has a lot more clients and has manged to complete the construction of her house.

So she is now requesting a new loan to invest in her clothing and thread business to continue stocking her business and improving the quality of living of her family. Manuela's big dream is to be able to have a store where she could better display her clothing selling business.

loans.use: buy and sell traditional clothing.

loans.name: Dabo

texts.en:
Dabo is a Babban Gona maize farmer from  Fulani Village. Dabo joined Babban Gona to improve the lives of his family and children. Since joining Babban Gona, he no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to repair his house. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Dabo will have access to high quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. This year, Dabo has set high goals for harvesting 60 bags of maize. With increased yields and incomes, Dabo has made it his ultimate goal to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmers' yields

loans.name: Musa Police

Musa Police is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Liman Village. Musa Police  joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Musa Police suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to purchase better inputs to improve his yield. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Musa Police will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Musa Police now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmers' yields

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmers' yields
