loans.name: Muttaka

texts.en:
Muttaka is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Maáji Village. 

Muttaka joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, he suffered from poor harvests that crippled his ability to purchase better inputs to improve his yield. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Muttaka will have access to the best farm inputs in the market - such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds - that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Muttaka now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm's yield.

loans.name: Danjuma

texts.en:
Danjuma is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Chirai Village. 

Danjuma joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, he suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Danjuma will have access to the best farm inputs in the market - such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds - that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Danjuma now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm's yield.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is a responsible father and lives in Landing, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. He is widower with six dependents. Romeo has been engaged in an farming for 10 years already.  He earns approximately PHP15,000 quarterly from doing this type of work; this amount is so helpful to meet their family needs. 

He has requested a loan to be used as down payment of a motorbike for passenger transportation, as additional income. Romeo has been a member of PMPC after her wife died 3 years ago. In the future, Romeo hopes to see his children finish their education.

loans.use: to make a down payment on a motorbike to earn more to support his children

loans.name: Safira

texts.en:
Safira is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, spices, milk, coffee, eggs, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like buying and selling vegetables.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Safira dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, spices, milk, coffee, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Margarita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has been operating a repair shop business for one year in the Philippines. She earns additional income from processing meat and direct-selling UNO Products. She is borrowing 50,000 PHP through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF), to purchase equipment like wires, tester machine, table, etc needed for her repair shop. Margarita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase equipment like wires, tester machine, table, etc needed for her repair shop

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde is 53 years old and married. She has five children, three of whom are in school.

Matilde is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Matilde has been raising pigs for 10 years now and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Matilde requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs and other supplies to raise livestock.

In the future, Matilde would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs and other supplies to raise livestock.

loans.name: Jafaru Sarki

texts.en:
Jafaru Sarki is a Babban Gona farmer from Sarki Vilage. Jafaru joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Jafaru will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer.

With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Jafaru would like to use his extra earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Aitan

texts.en:
Aitan is 29 years old and from the small village named Sadakhlo in Marneuli district, in southern Georgia. She is married and lives with her husband and parents-in-law who have retirement pensions. Her husband generates a small daily income as a house painter.

Aitan’s family are farmers. They have 0.6 hectares of farmland where they grow maize and sunflowers. From this they earn a small seasonal income from their harvest.

Aitan has decided to buy dairy cows. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, will be a great support for her family. She will receive a 3000 GEL loan that she will use to buy two cows. They will produce the milk needed for dairy products that she can sell for more income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase 2 cows and start husbandry business

loans.name: Surajo

texts.en:
Surajo is a Babban Gona farmer from Sarki Dandamisa Village. Surajo joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Surajo will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer.

With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Surajo would like to use his extra earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Abdullahi	Himidi

texts.en:
Abdullahi Himidi is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Ali Gari Village. Abdullahi Himidi joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Abdullahi Himidi will have access to the best farm inputs in the market, such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably.

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Abdullahi Himidi now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Aminu

texts.en:
Aminu is a Babban Gona farmer from Lili Village. 

Aminu joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to top-of-the-line farm inputs, such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. 

With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Aminu would like to use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm's yields.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro, se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, por lo general el cultivo que más práctica es el de maíz, con su negocio puede generar los recursos económicos que son de ayuda para ir cubriendo sus compromisos. Vive con su mamá y sus hijos.
Comprará abono, semilla, insecticidas y herbicidas, con dichos materiales su cultivo tendrá un mejor desarrollo, espera que la cosecha sea muy abundante y que le permita abastecer a su familia y a sus clientes.
Sus aspiraciones son tener siempre las fuerzas necesarias para mantenerse trabajando y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Ramiro works in agriculture and cattle raising. In general, the crop he focuses most on is corn. Through his business he can generate the financial means to cover his responsibilities. He lives with his mother and his children.

Ramiro will buy fertilizer, seeds, insecticides and herbicides. These materials will help his crop improve. He hopes that the harvest will be abundant enough so that he can provide for his family and satisfy his customers. Ramiro's goals are to always have the strength to keep working and to support his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, insecticides and herbicides. These materials will help his crop improve.

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is an entrepreneur from Melitopol. She works at a local central marketplace selling women's clothing inventory. Larisa owns her vending location. She has been working in this sphere for 20 years already. Larisa is married with two grown-up sons. She is 51 at the moment. 

Larisa is seeking 40,000 Grivnyas to purchase merchandise for the summer season. She wants to buy dresses, blouses, t-shirts, tank tops, etc. which always sell well in hot summer days in Ukraine.

loans.use: to purchase dresses, blouses, t-shirts and tank tops for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer so as to improve soil nutrients for a better harvest.

loans.name: Nashwa

texts.en:
Nashwa lives in Irbid and is a 49-year-old married woman with six children. One of those kids is Suha that appears in the photo instead her mom because she is conservative.

Nashwa is keen on raising her children and teaching them the best education. Her daughter Suha is studying software engineering. She chose this major because she knows how to deal with computers and it is easy to find work in this area.

The father is retired and his pension is not enough to cover Suha's university fees. Therefore Nashwa applied for an education loan to help her daughter to pay her semester fees and achieve her dreams.

loans.use: To help her daughter to pay her semester fees and achieve her dreams

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorized  rickshaw's body for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Sirajo

texts.en:
Sirajo is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Nassarawan Kudan Village. Sirajo joined Babban Gona to increase his wealth. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Sirajo will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags of maize.  This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Sirajo now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmers' yields

loans.name: Hudu

texts.en:
Hudu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Nassarawan Kudan Village. Hudu  joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Hudu suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to purchase better inputs to improve his yields. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Hudu will have access to the best farm inputs on the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Hudu now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmers' yields

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm produce for resale. These include assorted cereals, and fresh vegetables as well as fruits

loans.name: Dalisay

texts.en:
Dalisay is earning a living doing farming activities. At her age, she never stopped pursuing her goals for the sake of the family. Dalisay is a fully fledged member of PMPC and has took several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. 

From her desire to earn extra income, she wants to open a small sari-sari (small grocery) store business. So she applied for a loan to buy a store with basic commodities and other consumables and to purchase bags of farm fertilizer.  

Dalisay continues to seek business ideas for farming, proof that she has the determination to fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to buy a store with basic commodities and other consumables and purchase bags of farm fertilizer.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena works hard to support her family. Rowena is married and has an egg noodles-making business in the Philippines. Rowena has been in this business for six years now, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

Rowena requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, eggs, salt, etc.

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, egg, salt, etc.

loans.name: Norlita

texts.en:
Norlita is 50 years old, married and has seven children. 

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Norlita requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feeds.

Norlita has been pig fattening for eight years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Norlita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds

loans.name: Gerber Antonio

texts.es:
Gerber, se encuentra descapitalizado y como sabe que Padecoms y Kiva le han apoyado cuando lo ha necesitado, hace la solicitud de otro financiamiento para invertirlo en madera, clavos, barniz, pegamento, etc., para continuar elaborando muebles, espera tener un mejor inventario en la carpintería para satisfacer las demandas de sus clientes.
Con el crédito anterior ha logrado mantener su fuente de ingresos activa, los ingresos que genera son de subsistencia y los utiliza para cubrir sus deudas, costear gastos familiares y para continuar apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Gerber is short on liquidity. Since he knows that Padecoms and Kiva have supported him when he needed it, he is requesting another loan in order to invest in wood, nails, varnish, glue, etc., so that he can continue making furniture. He hopes to improve the stock in his workshop in order to satisfy the demands of his customers.

With the previous credit, he has managed to keep his source of income alive. He earns a subsistence income, which he uses to cover his debts, pay for family-related expenses and continue supporting his children in their studies.

loans.use: to invest in wood, nails, varnish, glue, etc., so that he can continue making furniture

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca, es una mujer que toda su vida ha trabajado en el cultivo de granos básicos y en la crianza de cerdos, el vivir en el campo le facilita mucho realizar dichas actividades. Ella vive con su compañero de vida y tiene  un hijo que es totalmente independiente.
Requiere de un crédito para comprar concentrado y vitaminas para los cerdos, los mantendrá gordos y saludables para luego venderlos a precios altos, de esta manera sus ingresos incrementaran y cumplirá con sus compromisos económicos.
Francisca sueña con tener resultados favorables de la inversión y con ello tener el sustento diario en su hogar.
texts.en:
Francisca is a woman who has worked her entire life growing basic grains and raising pigs. Living in the countryside makes these activities much easier. 

She lives with her life partner and she has one son who is completely independent. She needs a loan to buy feed and vitamins for the  pigs.  She will keep them fat and healthy so she can then sell them at a high price. This will increase her income and allow her to meet her financial obligations. 

Francisca dreams of having a good return on her investment leading to daily sustenance for her household.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for the pigs.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married and has 2 children. She has been making dairy products for 12 years. Since her last loan on Kiva, Svetlana and her husband were able to finish building their house. Also, her daughter was able to enroll in a college. 

Currently, Svetlana does not sell dairy products at the market. She wholesales the products to milk factories. However, she wants to develop her business further. She is a hardworking and responsible person. She wishes to be able to also provide her younger son with a higher education.

Svetlana is requesting a loan of 30,000 UAH to buy a car for her business. The new car will make the transportation of her products much easier.

loans.use: to buy a new car for her business.

loans.name: Aura Marisol

texts.es:
Aura es una mujer lleno de sueños y metas tiene 37 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 5 y 15 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez.
Aura para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de abarrotes, pero para mejorar sus ingresos también trabaja como maestra de educación primaria, gracias a estas dos actividades ha prosperado con su familia.
Aura con el afán de seguir incrementado su negocio solicita un préstamo para poder comprar más productos de  abarrotería como azúcar, aceite, golosinas, gaseosa, pues por ser una de las tiendas que presta el mejor servicio la gente lo busca mucho, entonces para satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes es necesario la inversión.
El gran sueño de Aura es hacer de su negocio más grande para obtener mejores ingresos y que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Aura is a woman full of dreams and goals. She is 37 years old, is married, and has a nice family consisting of three children between the ages of 5 and 15. This humble family lives in a community in Suchitepéquez.

In order to earn an income and support her family, Aura buys and sells groceries, but to supplement her income she also works as a primary school teacher. Thanks to these two occupations her family has prospered.

With the aim of continuing to grow her business, Aura requests a loan to be able to buy more groceries, such as sugar, oil, candy and soda. Since her store offers some of the best service, it is very popular. Therefore, to satisfy the needs of the customers, investments are necessary.

Aura's big dream is to grow her business more, increase her income and achieve a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries, such as sugar, oil, candy and soda.

loans.name: José Humberto

texts.es: José de 33 años, nació en una familia campesina y toda su vida estuvo rodeada de las labores del campo, experiencia que le permitió asumir la administración de una finca en el municipio de Villapinzón en donde convino con el propietario cultivar papas y criar ganado de su propiedad. Todos los días al amanecer ordeña las vacas para suministrar la leche a sus clientes, mientras que su cultivo de papas brota de la tierra cuando hay cosecha cada seis meses,  su día a día es velar que todos los asuntos de la finca se encuentren prosperando.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar una motocicleta para su transporte.  Esta inversión le permitirá viajar más cómodamente del pueblo hacia su trabajo.  Él es padre de dos hijos menores de edad a quienes ofrece bienestar gracias al fruto de su trabajo.
texts.en:
José is 33 years old. He was born to a farming family and spent his whole life surrounded by farm work, an experience that allowed him to assume the role of managing a farm in the city of Villapinzón. He works with the owner of the property to grow potatoes and raise livestock. Everyday he wakes up and milks the cows in order to supply his customers with milk, and every six months, he harvests his potatoes.  On a daily basis, he sees to all of the farm's affairs and makes sure that everything is going well.

He is currently seeking his first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use this loan to purchase a motorcycle for his own transportation.  This investment will allow him to travel more comfortably from his town to his job. He is the father of two young children who he provides for.

loans.use: purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Likita

texts.en:
Likita is a Babban Gona farmer from Kunda Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could gain better yields on his farm. 

Since joining Babban Gona, Likita no longer has to worry about not having enough income to pay for his children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top-of-the-line farm inputs - such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds - that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the Nigerian national average. This will see him increase his income considerably.  

This season Likita has ambitious plans to harvest 30 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, he now has the opportunity to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm's yield.

loans.name: Damazo Antonio

texts.es: Damazo de 68 años de edad es un hombre de trabajador que se dedica desde hace 2 años a la elaboración y venta de coco rallado, actividad que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia. Damazo vive con su esposa y su hija de 31 años de edad en vivienda propia desde hace 15 años. Damazo cuenta con algunos utensilios para la elaboración de sus productos, pero ya se encuentran deteriorados, además le solicitan productos por mayoreo, por lo que desea incrementar su producción, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cocos, azúcar, ollas, entre otros productos, para elaborar coco rallado.
texts.en:
Damazo is 68 years old. He is a hardworking man who has been making and selling shaved coconut for the last two years. This has enabled him to help his family to get ahead. Damazo has lived with his wife and his 31 year-old daughter in his own home for the last fifteen years. 

Damazo has some utensils used to make his products, but they are run-down. Furthermore, he is being asked for his products wholesale, so he would like to increase production. This is why he is seeking a loan from FUSAI to invest in coconuts, sugar, and pots among other things, to make shaved coconut.

loans.use: to invest in coconuts, sugar, pots and other products to make his shaved coconut.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, de 59 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado, está casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene dos hijos de 39 y 37 años de edad, el mayor esta en Estados Unidos y su otro hijo está casado pero vive en su casa con sus dos hijos.

Juan, tiene un negocio de venta de calzado desde hace 6 años, siempre le gusto este negocio; antes el tenia una venta de pan y luego puso una panadería, pero ahora tiene un puesto en el mercado y vende calzado, viaja todos los días 8 kilómetro desde su casa y su horario es de 8:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m.

El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar calzado de niños, adultos y jóvenes de todos los estilos. 

El sueño de Juan, es poder ver algún día a su hijo que está en los  Estados Unidos.
texts.en: Juan is 59 years old, has an 8th grade education, and is married.  His wife is a homemaker and together they have two children ages 39 and 37. Their eldest son lives in the United States and their younger son is married and lives with them along with his two children.  Juan has a business selling footwear, which he has run for six years. He has always enjoyed this business.  Before starting it, he sold bread and eventually opened a bakery. However, he now has a stall in the market where he sells footwear. He travels 8km from his home to his business everyday, and he works from 8am to 5pm.  This loan will be used to purchase footwear for all ages in many styles.  Juan's dream is to someday see his son who lives in the United States.

loans.use: purchase footwear for children, adults and young people in all styles.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es: Manuela es mujer que día con día se esmera para superarse y brindarle a su familia todo lo necesario, ella está muy satisfecha por el crédito anterior pues gracias a ello compro sus hilos para la elaboración de cortes, blusas y fajas, con esta inversión mejoraron sus ingresos y con ello la calidad de vida su familia ha cambiado, Manuela solicita un nuevo  préstamo para comprar  ahora pisos, vidrios para ventanas y puertas para terminar la construcción de su casa, pues para ella no hay nada más importante que terminar su casa y darle a su familia un mejor hogar, es por eso que tiene las esperanzas de contar nuevamente con su apoyo para hacer posible este anhelo.
texts.en:
Manuela is a woman who day after day strives to get ahead and offer everything necessary to her family.  She is very satisfied with the previous loan.  Thanks to it, she bought her threads to make skirts, blouses and belts.  With this investment, they improved their income and with it the quality of life for the family has changed.  
Manuela is requesting a new loan in order to buy flooring, glass for windows and doors now so as to complete the construction of her house.  For her, there is nothing more important than to finish her house and give her family a better home.  It is because of this that she hopes to be able to count on your support in order to make her wish possible.

loans.use: to buy flooring, glass for windows, and doors.

loans.name: Kanukadi Group

texts.fr:
Sur la photo  c’est  Bourema  qui  tient les pagnes en mains.  Il est âge de 60 ans il est marié, et a  7 enfants, âgés de  4  à 30 ans dont  4 sont  scolarisés.      Sa  femme fait des petits commerces après le ménage. Il s’approvisionne à  Bobo-Dioulasso (Burkina-Faso) en gros et les revend en détail dans le marché de sa localité, son bénéfice  mensuel    plus que 75 000 FCFA. IL fait  recourt  au R M C R  pour  acheter beaucoup de pagnes à vendre. 
Il exerce  ce  travail  depuis  5 ans  les  revenus  qui’ il gagne  lui  permettent  de couvrir  les  charge  familiales . Son rêve est d’ouvrir une grande boutique de pagne.
texts.en:
In the photo, Bourema is the one holding ‘pagne’ cloth. He is 60 years old and a married father of seven, aged 4 to 30, of whom four are in school. His wife works in a small-scale business after her housework. Bourema gets his supplies wholesale in Bobo-Dioulasso (Burkina-Faso) and resells the goods at the market in his town. His monthly profit exceed 75,000 francs CFA. 

He has turned to the microfinance institution RMCR to purchase many lengths of ‘pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) to sell. He has been doing this work for five years. The revenues he earns enable him to cover family expenses. His dream is to open a large ‘pagne’ shop.

loans.use: to purchase 'pagne' cloth to resell

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua  is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kanakargo Village. He joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children, who suffered in the past when his farm's yields were poor. With Babban Gona’s support, Joshua will have access to the best farm inputs in the market, including fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will mean a better life for his family. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Joshua now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into our program.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies to increase his output.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en: Annie lives in the town of Siquijor and supports her children by building houses from the ground up. She has successfully repaid a previous loan, which she used to buy building materials and paints, and to pay her workers. She wants her children to get an education and escape the life of backbreaking work she has had to endure.

loans.use: to buy building materials and paint, and to pay her workers.

loans.name: Idi

texts.en: Idi is a Babban Gona farmer from Dogon Juri Village. He joined our organization to realize better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Idi  no longer has to worry about having adequate income to meet his farm's needs. Through our loan program, he will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will allow him to increase his income considerably. This season, in fact, Idi has ambitious plans to harvest 65  bags of maize per hectare. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Idi  now has the opportunity to provide employment to members of his community on his farm.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies that will increase his output.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase bread, sugar, coffee, beans, rice, oil, soap, detergent, juice and dairy products for her store.

loans.name: Djiguisèmè Group

texts.fr:
Abdoulaye  c’est  lui qui  tient  la corde  du bœuf  sur  la photo. il  est  âgé  de 51  ans,  père de  famille avec  9 enfants, âgés  de 8 à  27 ans  donc  5  sont  scolarisés.       
Sa  femme  lui  aide  dans  ses activités. Il  est  gentil  avec  tout  le monde  notamment  les  enfants.       
Son  lieu  d’ approvisionnent en boeufs est  dans  les  marchés  de  sa  localité  il  peut  avoir  un  revenu  de  75000 FCFA  par  mois  comme  bénéfice  mensuel.   il exerce  ce   travail  depuis  des années.    
Les  revenus  qu’ il  gagne  Lui  permettent  de  Payer   tous  les  frais  scolaire  de ces enfants    
Son rêve est d’envoyer  tous  ses  enfants  à l’  école   afin de préparer leur avenir.
texts.en: Abdoulaye is the one in the photo holding the steer’s rope. He is 51 years old and a father of nine children, aged 8 to 27, of whom five are in school. His wife helps in his business. Abdoulaye is nice to everyone, especially his children. His supplies of cattle come from the markets in his town. He can have an income of 75,000 francs CFA per month as profit. He has been doing this work for years. The revenues he earns enable him to pay for all his children’s school fees, so as to prepare for their future.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to sell

loans.name: Baballiya

texts.en: Baballiya is a Babban Gona farmer from Dogon Juri Village. He joined our organization so that he could realize better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Baballiya  no longer has to worry about having inadequate income for his farmland. Through our loans, he will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria. This will allow him to increase his income considerably. This season, in fact, Baballiya has ambitious plans to harvest 60 bags of maize per hectare. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Baballiya now has the opportunity to provide employment on his farm to members of his community.

loans.use: to buy supplies that will increase his farm's output.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dogon Juri Village. Haruna joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.

In the past, Haruna suffered from poor crop yields, which inhibited his ability to increase his farmland. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Haruna has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, which is double the national average in Nigeria, and to thereby earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With an ambitious goal of harvesting 70 bags of maize this year, Haruna is seeking to ensure that his children get a post-secondary school education.

loans.use: To increase his crop yield by purchasing additional farm inputs

loans.name: Yiriwaton Group

texts.fr:
Moussa est un éleveur  de bovins et ovins, âge de 42 ans, marié,  père de  7 enfants,  âgée de 4 à 22 ans dont  5 sont  scolarisés ,sur la photo  c’est  lui  qui  se tient devant  à côté du bœuf . Sa  femme   ménagère  vend aussi de savon   pour  gagner sa vie.
 Il aime être d’éleveur car il tire beaucoup de profits, son  approvisionnement  se fait  dans  le marché de sa localité. Son bénéfice  mensuel  peut s’élever jusqu’à 100000 FCFA.   
IL fait  recourt au R M C R  pour  avoir plus d’argent  afin d’élargir son  d’élevages, il a une expérience de 05 ans,  il exerce  ce  travail  ,  les  revenus  générés  lui  permettent  de couvrir  les  charge  familiales .
Etant donné qu’il habite dans un milieu rural au Mali, Moussa souhaite dans les jours à venir construire une  villa dans le cercle de KOUTIALA.
texts.en:
Moussa is a livestock farmer of cattle and sheep. He is 42 years old and a married father of seven children, aged 4 to 22, of whom five are in school. In the photo, he is the one standing next to the steer. His wife is a homemaker, and she also sells soap for income. Moussa likes raising livestock, since he make a lot of profit. His supplies are gotten from the market in his town. His monthly profit can reach 100,000 francs CFA.

He has turned to the microfinance institution RMCR to obtain more money in order to expand his business. He has five years of experience in this work. The revenues generated enable him to cover family expenses. Since Moussa lives in a rural area in Mali, he would like to build a villa in Cercle de KOUTIALA in the days to come.

loans.use: to purchase animals to sell later

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
Gerlie is 32 years old. She is known in the Ozamiz area for her retailing business. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the co-op offers. She hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record.

She wants to live comfortably, with a decent house. As a result, she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house.

loans.name: Bazarkul

texts.ru: Базаркул, 56 лет, 4 детей. У нее высшее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи, Базаркул занимается животноводством, стартовав 35 лет назад. В хозяйстве есть 8 коров, 51 овца. Благодаря упорному труду, Базаркул на сегодняшний день имеет ежемесячную прибыль от бизнеса 33,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Базаркул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Базаркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса за счет покупки дойных коров и ремонт дома.
texts.en: Bazarkul is 56 and has four children. She has a college education and earns income for her family by raising livestock, which she began 35 years ago. She has eight cows and 51 sheep. Thanks to her hard work, Bazarkul currently earns 33,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to develop her business in the future, Bazarkul applied for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy cows and increase her herd. She plans to use the earnings from the loan to invest in expanding her business by buying dairy cows and renovating her house.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to increase her herd
